initiation
the initiation of transcription begin at a promoter , a dna sequence onto which the transcription machinery bind and initiate transcription .
the nucleotide pair in the dna double helix that correspond to the site from which the first five ' rna nucleotide be transcribe be the initiation site .
nucleotide precede the initiation site be designate " upstream , " whereas nucleotide follow the initiation site be call " downstream " nucleotide .
in most case , promoter be locate just upstream of the gene - pron - regulate .
although promoter sequence vary among bacterial genome , a few element be conserve .
at the – one  zero and – three  five position within the dna prior to the initiation site ( designate + one ) , there be two promoter consensus sequence , or region that be similar across all promoter and across various bacterial specie .
the – one  zero consensus sequence , call the tata box , be tataat .
the – three  five sequence be recognize and bind by σ .
elongation
the elongation in transcription phase begin when the σ subunit dissociate from the polymerase , allow the core enzyme to synthesize rna complementary to the dna template in a five ' to three ' direction at a rate of approximately four  zero nucleotide per second .
as elongation proceed , the dna be continuously unwind ahead of the core enzyme and rewound behind - pron - ( figure one  one  .  one  one ) .

during elongation , the bacterial rna polymerase track along the dna template , synthesize mrna in the five ' to three ' direction , and unwind and rewind the dna as - pron - be read .
termination
once a gene be transcribe , the bacterial polymerase must dissociate from the dna template and liberate the newly make rna .
this be refer to as termination of transcription .
the dna template include repeat nucleotide sequence that act as termination signal , cause rna polymerase to stall and release from the dna template , free the rna transcript .

transcription in eukaryotes prokaryotes and eukaryote perform fundamentally the same process of transcription , with a few significant difference ( see table one  one  .  three ) .
eukaryote use three different polymerase , rna polymerase i , ii , and iii , all structurally distinct from the bacterial rna polymerase .
each transcribe a different subset of gene .
interestingly , archaea contain a single rna polymerase that be more closely related to eukaryotic rna polymerase ii than to - pron - bacterial counterpart .
eukaryotic mrnas be also usually monocistronic , mean that - pron - each encode only a single polypeptide , whereas prokaryotic mrnas of bacteria and archaea be commonly polycistronic , mean that - pron - encode multiple polypeptide .
the most important difference between prokaryote and eukaryote be the latter 's membrane - bind nucleus , which influence the ease of use of rna molecule for protein synthesis .
with the gene bind in a nucleus , the eukaryotic cell must transport protein - encode rna molecule to the cytoplasm to be translate .
protein - encode primary transcript , the rna molecule directly synthesize by rna polymerase , must undergo several processing step to protect these rna molecule from degradation during the time - pron - be transfer from the nucleus to the cytoplasm and translate into a protein .
for example , eukaryotic mrnas may last for several hour , whereas the typical prokaryotic mrna last no more than five second .
the primary transcript ( also call pre - mrna ) be first coat with rna - stabilize protein to protect - pron - from degradation while - pron - be process and export out of the nucleus .
the first type of processing begin while the primary transcript be still be synthesize  a special seven  - methylguanosine nucleotide , call the five ' cap , be add to the five ' end of the grow transcript .
in addition to prevent degradation , factor involve in subsequent protein synthesis recognize the cap , which help initiate translation by ribosome .
once elongation be complete , another processing enzyme then add a string of approximately two  zero  zero adenine nucleotide to the three ' end , call the poly - a tail .
this modification further protect the pre - mrna from degradation and signal to cellular factor that the transcript need to be export to the cytoplasm .
eukaryotic gene that encode polypeptide be compose of code sequence call exon ( ex - on signifie that - pron - be express ) and intervene sequence call intron ( int - ron denote - pron - intervene role ) .
transcribed rna sequence correspond to intron do not encode region of the functional polypeptide and be remove from the premrna during processing .
- pron - be essential that all of the intron - encode rna sequence be completely and precisely remove from a pre - mrna before protein synthesis so that the exon - encode rna sequence be properly join together to code for a functional polypeptide .
if the process err by even a single nucleotide , the sequence of the rejoined exon would be shift , and the result polypeptide would be nonfunctional .
the process of remove intron - encode rna sequence and reconnecte those encode by exon be call rna splicing and be facilitate by the action of a spliceosome contain small nuclear ribonucleo protein ( snrnps ) .
intron - encode rna sequence be remove from the pre - mrna while - pron - be still in the nucleus .
although - pron - be not translate , intron appear to have various function , include gene regulation and mrna transport .
on completion of these modification , the mature transcript , the mrna that encode a polypeptide , be transport out of the nucleus , destine for the cytoplasm for translation .
intron can be splice out differently , result in various exon be include or exclude from the final mrna product .
this process be know as alternative splicing .
the advantage of alternative splicing be that different type of mrna transcript can be generate , all derive from the same dna sequence .
in recent year , - pron - have be show that some archaea also have the ability to splice - pron - pre - mrna .

one  one  .  four protein synthesis ( translation )
learning objectives
 describe the genetic code and explain why - pron - be consider almost universal

explain the process of translation and the function of the molecular machinery of translation 
compare translation in eukaryote and prokaryote the synthesis of protein consume more of a cell 's energy than any other metabolic process .
in turn , protein account for more mass than any other macromolecule of live organism .
- pron - perform virtually every function of a cell , serve as both functional ( e . g . , enzymes ) and structural element .
the process of translation , or protein synthesis , the second part of gene expression , involve the decoding by a ribosome of an mrna message into a polypeptide product .
the genetic code translation of the mrna template convert nucleotide - base genetic information into the “ language " of amino acid to create a protein product .
a protein sequence consist of two  zero commonly occur amino acid .
each amino acid be define within the mrna by a triplet of nucleotide call a codon .
the relationship between an mrna codon and - pron - correspond amino acid be call the genetic code .
the three - nucleotide code mean that there be a total of six  four possible combination ( four  three , with four different nucleotide possible at each of the three different position within the codon ) .
this number be great than the number of amino acid and a give amino acid be encode by more than one codon ( figure one  one  .  one  two ) .
this redundancy in the genetic code be call degeneracy .
typically , whereas the first two position in a codon be important for determine which amino acid will be incorporate into a grow polypeptide ,
the third position , call the wobble position , be less critical .
in some case , if the nucleotide in the third position be change , the same amino acid be still incorporate .
whereas six  one of the six  four possible triplet code for amino acid , three of the six  four codon do not code for an amino acid  - pron - terminate protein synthesis , release the polypeptide from the translation machinery .
these be call stop codon or nonsense codon .
another codon , aug , also have a special function .
in addition to specify the amino acid methionine , - pron - also typically serve as the start codon to initiate translation .
the reading frame , the way nucleotide in mrna be group into codon , for translation be set by the aug start codon near the five ' end of the mrna .
each set of three nucleotide follow this start codon be a codon in the mrna message .
the genetic code be nearly universal .
with a few exception , virtually all specie use the same genetic code for protein synthesis , which be powerful evidence that all extant life on earth share a common origin .
however , unusual amino acid such as selenocysteine and pyrrolysine have be observe in archaea and bacteria .
in the case of selenocysteine , the codon use be uga ( normally a stop codon ) .
however , uga can encode for selenocysteine use a stem - loop structure ( know as the selenocysteine insertion sequence , or secis element ) , which be find at the three ' untranslated region of the mrna .
pyrrolysine use a different stop codon , uag .
the incorporation of pyrrolysine require the pyl gene and a unique transfer rna ( trna ) with a cua anticodon .

the protein synthesis machinery
in addition to the mrna template , many molecule and macromolecule contribute to the process of translation .
the composition of each component vary across taxa  for instance , ribosome may consist of different number of ribosomal rnas ( rrnas ) and polypeptide depend on the organism .
however , the general structure and function of the protein synthesis machinery be comparable from bacteria to human cell .
translation require the input of an mrna template , ribosome , trnas , and various enzymatic factor .
ribosomes
a ribosome be a complex macromolecule compose of catalytic rrnas ( call ribozyme ) and structural rrnas , as well as many distinct polypeptide .
mature rrnas make up approximately five  zero % of each ribosome .
prokaryote have seven  zero s ribosome , whereas eukaryote have eight  zero s ribosome in the cytoplasm and rough endoplasmic reticulum , and seven  zero s ribosome in mitochondria and chloroplast .
ribosome dissociate into large and small subunit when - pron - be not synthesize protein and reassociate during the initiation of translation .
in e . coli , the small subunit be describe as three  zero s ( which contain the one  six s rrna subunit ) , and the large subunit be five  zero s ( which contain the five s and two  three s rrna subunit ) , for a total of seven  zero s ( svedberg unit be not additive ) .
eukaryote ribosome have a small four  zero s subunit ( which contain the one  eight s rrna subunit ) and a large six  zero s subunit ( which contain the five s , five  .  eight s and two  eight s rrna subunit ) , for a total of eight  zero s .
the small subunit be responsible for bind the mrna template , whereas the large subunit bind trnas chapter one  one

each mrna molecule be simultaneously translate by many ribosome , all synthesize protein in the same direction  read the mrna from five ' to three ' and synthesize the polypeptide from the n terminus to the c terminus .
the complete structure contain an mrna with multiple associate ribosome be call a polyribosome ( or polysome ) .
in both bacteria and archaea , before transcriptional termination occur , each protein - encode transcript be already be use to begin synthesis of numerous copy of the encode polypeptide ( s ) because the process of transcription and translation can occur concurrently , form polyribosome ( figure one  one  .  one  three ) .
the reason why transcription and translation can occur simultaneously be because both of these process occur in the same five ' to three ' direction , - pron - both occur in the cytoplasm of the cell , and because the rna transcript be not process once - pron - be transcribe .
this allow a prokaryotic cell to respond to an environmental signal require new protein very quickly .
in contrast , in eukaryotic cell , simultaneous transcription and translation be not possible .
although polyribosome also form in eukaryote , - pron - can not do so until rna synthesis be complete and the rna molecule have be modify and transport out of the nucleus .

transfer rna transfer rna ( trnas ) be structural rna molecule and , depend on the specie , many different type of trnas exist in the cytoplasm .

initiation
the initiation of protein synthesis begin with the formation of an initiation complex .
in e . coli , this complex involve the small three  zero s ribosome , the mrna template , three initiation factor that help the ribosome assemble correctly , guanosine triphosphate ( gtp ) that act as an energy source , and a special initiator trna carry n - formylmethionine ( fmet - trnafmet )

in e . coli mrna , a leader sequence upstream of the first aug codon , call the shine - dalgarno sequence ( also know as the ribosomal binding site aggagg ) , interact through complementary base pair with the rrna molecule that compose the ribosome .
this interaction anchor the three  zero s ribosomal subunit at the correct location on the mrna template .
at this point , the five  zero s ribosomal subunit then bind to the initiation complex , form an intact ribosome .

elongation
in prokaryote and eukaryote , the basic of elongation of translation be the same .

there be one notable exception to this assembly line of trnas

the termination of translation occur when a nonsense codon ( uaa , uag , or uga ) be encounter for which there be no complementary trna .

analyze sequence of dna and identify example of type of mutation
a mutation be a heritable change in the dna sequence of an organism .
the result organism , call a mutant , may have a recognizable change in phenotype compare to the wild type , which be the phenotype most commonly observe in nature .
a change in the dna sequence be conferred to mrna through transcription , and may lead to an altered amino acid sequence in a protein on translation .
because protein carry out the vast majority of cellular function , a change in amino acid sequence in a protein may lead to an altered phenotype for the cell and organism .
effect of mutations on dna sequence
there be several type of mutation that be classify accord to how the dna molecule be alter .
one type , call a point mutation , affect a single base and most commonly occur when one base be substitute or replace by another .
mutation also result from the addition of one or more basis , know as an insertion , or the removal of one or more basis , know as a deletion .

what type of a mutation occur when a gene have two few nucleotide in - pron - sequence ?
effect of mutations on protein structure and function point mutation may have a wide range of effect on protein function ( figure one  one  .  one  eight ) .
as a consequence of the degeneracy of the genetic code , a point mutation will commonly result in the same amino acid be incorporate into the result polypeptide despite the sequence change .
this change would have no effect on the protein 's structure , and be thus call a silent mutation .
a missense mutation result in a different amino acid be incorporate into the result polypeptide .
the effect of a missense mutation depend on how chemically different the new amino acid be from the wild - type amino acid .
the location of the change amino acid within the protein also be important .
for example , if the change amino acid be part of the enzyme 's active site , then the effect of the missense mutation may be significant .
many missense mutation result in protein that be still functional , at least to some degree .
sometimes the effect of missense mutation may be only apparent under certain environmental condition  such missense mutation be call conditional mutation .
rarely , a missense mutation may be beneficial .
under the right environmental condition , this type of mutation may give the organism that harbor - pron - a selective advantage .
yet another type of point mutation , call a nonsense mutation , convert a codon encode an amino acid ( a sense codon ) into a stop codon ( a nonsense codon ) .
nonsense mutation result in the synthesis of protein that be short than the wild type and typically not functional .
deletion and insertion also cause various effect .
because codon be triplet of nucleotide , insertion or deletion in group of three nucleotide may lead to the insertion or deletion of one or more amino acid and may not cause significant effect on the result protein 's functionality .
however , frameshift mutation , cause by insertion or deletion of a number of nucleotide that be not a multiple of three be extremely problematic because a shift in the chapter one  one  mechanisms of microbial genetics four  six  nine read frame result ( figure one  one  .  one  eight ) .
because ribosome read the mrna in triplet codon , frameshift mutation can change every amino acid after the point of the mutation .
the new reading frame may also include a stop codon before the end of the code sequence .
consequently , protein make from gene contain frameshift mutation be nearly always nonfunctional .

for this reason , dna testing for the mutation be not widely recommend by public health official so as not to encourage risky behavior in those who carry the mutation .
nevertheless , inhibit the binding of hiv to ccr five continue to be a valid strategy for the development of drug therapy for those infect with hiv .

cause of mutations mistakes in the process of dna replication can cause spontaneous mutation to occur .
the error rate of dna polymerase be one incorrect base per billion base pair replicate .
exposure to mutagen can cause induce mutation , which be various type of chemical agent or radiation ( table one  one  .  four ) .
exposure to a mutagen can increase the rate of mutation more than one  zero  zero  zero  - fold .
mutagen be often also carcinogen , agent that cause cancer .
however , whereas nearly all carcinogen be mutagenic , not all mutagen be necessarily carcinogen .
chemical mutagens
various type of chemical mutagen interact directly with dna either by act as nucleoside analog or by modify nucleotide basis .
chemical call nucleoside analog be structurally similar to normal nucleotide basis and can be incorporate into dna during replication ( figure one  one  .  two  zero ) .
these base analog induce mutation because - pron - often have different base - pair rule than the basis - pron - replace .
other chemical mutagen can modify normal dna basis , result in different base - pair rule .
for example , nitrous acid deaminate cytosine , convert - pron - to uracil .
uracil then pair with adenine in a subsequent round of replication , result in the conversion of a gc base pair to an at base pair .
nitrous acid also deaminate adenine to hypoxanthine , which base pair with cytosine instead of thymine , result in the conversion of a ta base pair to a cg base pair .
chemical mutagen know as intercalate agent work differently .
these molecule slide between the stack nitrogenous basis of the dna double helix , distort the molecule and create atypical spacing between nucleotide base pair ( figure one  one  .  two  one ) .
as a result , during dna replication , dna polymerase may either skip replicate four  seven  two chapter one  one  mechanisms of microbial genetics
this openstax book be available for free at http / / cnx . org / content / col one  two  zero  eight  seven  /  one  .  five several nucleotide ( create a deletion ) or insert extra nucleotide ( create an insertion ) .
either outcome may lead to a frameshift mutation .
combustion product like polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon be particularly dangerous intercalate agent that can lead to mutation - cause cancer .
the intercalate agent ethidium bromide and acridine orange be commonly use in the laboratory to stain dna for visualization and be potential mutagen .

radiation exposure to either ionize or nonionize radiation can each induce mutation in dna , although by different mechanism .
strong ionize radiation like x - ray and gamma ray can cause single - and double - strand break in the dna backbone through the formation of hydroxyl radical on radiation exposure ( figure one  one  .  two  two ) .
ionize radiation can also modify basis  for example , the deamination of cytosine to uracil , analogous to the action of nitrous acid . [ four ]
ionize radiation exposure be use to kill microbe to sterilize medical device and food , because of - pron - dramatic nonspecific effect in damage dna , protein , and other cellular component ( see use physical methods to control microorganisms ) .
nonionize radiation , like ultraviolet light , be not energetic enough to initiate these type of chemical change .
however , nonionize radiation can induce dimer formation between two adjacent pyrimidine basis , commonly two thymine , within a nucleotide strand .
during thymine dimer formation , the two adjacent thymine become covalently link and , if leave unrepaired , both dna replication and transcription be stall at this point .
dna polymerase may proceed and replicate the dimer incorrectly , potentially lead to frameshift or point mutation .

dna repair
the process of dna replication be highly accurate , but mistake can occur spontaneously or be induce by mutagen .
uncorrected mistake can lead to serious consequence for the phenotype .
cell have develop several repair mechanism to minimize the number of mutation that persist .
proofread most of the mistake introduce during dna replication be promptly correct by most dna polymerase through a function call proofread .
in proofread , the dna polymerase read the newly add base , ensure that - pron - be complementary to the corresponding base in the template strand before add the next one .
if an incorrect base have be add , the enzyme make a cut to release the wrong nucleotide and a new base be add .
mismatch repair
some error introduce during replication be correct shortly after the replication machinery have move .
this mechanism be call mismatch repair .
the enzyme involve in this mechanism recognize the incorrectly add nucleotide , excise - pron - , and replace - pron - with the correct base .
one example be the methyl - direct mismatch repair in e . coli .
the dna be hemimethylate .
this mean that the parental strand be methylate while the newly synthesize daughter strand be not .
- pron - take several minute before the new strand be methylate .
proteins muts , mutl , and muth bind to the hemimethylated site where the incorrect nucleotide be find .
muth cut the nonmethylate strand ( the new strand ) .
an exonuclease remove a portion of the strand ( include the incorrect nucleotide ) .
the gap form be then fill in by dna pol iii and ligase .
repair of thymine dimers
because the production of thymine dimer be common ( many organism can not avoid ultraviolet light ) , mechanism have evolve to repair these lesion .
in nucleotide excision repair ( also call dark repair ) , enzyme remove the pyrimidine dimer and replace - pron - with the correct nucleotide ( figure one  one  .  two  three ) .
in e . coli , the dna be scan by an enzyme complex .
if a distortion in the double helix be find that be introduce by the pyrimidine dimer , the enzyme complex cut the sugar - phosphate backbone several basis upstream and downstream of the dimer , and the segment of dna between these two cut be then enzymatically remove .
dna pol i replace the miss nucleotide with the correct one and dna ligase seal the gap in the sugar - phosphate backbone .
the direct repair ( also call light repair ) of thymine dimer occur through the process of photoreactivation in the presence of visible light .
an enzyme call photolyase recognize the distortion in the dna helix cause by the thymine dimer and bind to the dimer .
then , in the presence of visible light , the photolyase enzyme change conformation and break apart the thymine dimer , allow the thymine to again correctly base pair with the adenine on the complementary strand .
photoreactivation appear to be present in all organism , with the exception of placental mammal , include human .
photoreactivation be particularly important for organism chronically expose to ultraviolet radiation , like plant , photosynthetic bacteria , algae , and coral , to prevent the accumulation of mutation cause by thymine dimer formation .

identify bacterial mutants one common technique use to identify bacterial mutant be call replica plating .
this technique be use to detect nutritional mutant , call auxotroph , which have a mutation in a gene encode an enzyme in the biosynthesis pathway of a specific nutrient , such as an amino acid .
as a result , whereas wild - type cell retain the ability to grow normally on a medium lack the specific nutrient , auxotroph be unable to grow on such a medium .
during replica plate ( figure one  one  .  two  four ) , a population of bacterial cell be mutagenize and then plate as individual cell on a complex nutritionally complete plate and allow to grow into colony .
cell from these colony be remove from this master plate , often use sterile velvet .
this velvet , contain cell , be then press in the same orientation onto plate of various medium .
at least one plate should also be nutritionally complete to ensure that cell be be properly transfer between the plate .
the other plate lack specific nutrient , allow the researcher to discover various auxotrophic mutant unable to produce specific nutrient .
cell from the corresponding colony on the nutritionally complete plate can be use to recover the mutant for further study .

the ames test
the ames test , develop by bruce ames ( one  nine  two  eight – ) in the one  nine  seven  zero , be a method that use bacteria for rapid , inexpensive screening of the carcinogenic potential of new chemical compound .
the test measure the mutation rate associate with exposure to the compound , which , if elevate , may indicate that exposure to this compound be associate with great cancer risk .
the ames test use as the test organism a strain of salmonella typhimurium that be a histidine auxotroph , unable to synthesize - pron - own histidine because of a mutation in an essential gene require for - pron - synthesis .
after exposure to a potential mutagen , these bacteria be plate onto a medium lack histidine , and the number of mutant regain the ability to synthesize histidine be record and compare with the number of such mutant that arise in the absence of the potential mutagen ( figure one  one  .  two  five ) .
chemical that be more mutagenic will bring about more mutant with restore histidine synthesis in the ames test .
because many chemical be not directly mutagenic but be metabolize to mutagenic form by liver enzyme , rat liver extract be commonly include at the start of this experiment to mimic liver metabolism .
after the ames test be conduct , compound identify as mutagenic be further test for - pron - potential carcinogenic property by use other model , include animal model like mouse and rat .

how asexual prokaryotes achieve genetic diversity learning objectives

typically , when - pron - consider genetic transfer , - pron - think of vertical gene transfer , the transmission of genetic information from generation to generation .
vertical gene transfer be by far the main mode of transmission of genetic information in all cell .
in sexually reproduce organism , cross - over event and independent assortment of individual chromosome during meiosis contribute to genetic diversity in the population .
genetic diversity be also introduce during sexual reproduction , when the genetic information from two parent , each with different complement of genetic information , be combine , produce new combination of parental genotype in the diploid offspring .
the occurrence of mutation also contribute to genetic diversity in a population .
genetic diversity of offspring be useful in change or inconsistent environment and may be one reason for the evolutionary success of sexual reproduction .
when prokaryote and eukaryote reproduce asexually , - pron - transfer a nearly identical copy of - pron - genetic material to - pron - offspring through vertical gene transfer .
although asexual reproduction produce more offspring more quickly , any benefit of diversity among those offspring be lose .
how then do organism whose dominant reproductive mode be asexual create genetic diversity ?
in prokaryote , horizontal gene transfer ( hgt ) , the introduction of genetic material from one organism to another organism within the same generation , be an important way to introduce genetic diversity .
hgt allow even distantly relate specie to share gene , influence - pron - phenotype .
- pron - be think that hgt be more prevalent in prokaryote but that only a small fraction of the prokaryotic genome may be transfer by this type of transfer at any one time .
as the phenomenon be investigate more thoroughly , - pron - may be reveal to be even more common .
many scientist believe that hgt and mutation be significant source of genetic variation , the raw material for the process of natural selection , in prokaryote .
although hgt be more common among evolutionarily relate organism , - pron - may occur between any two specie that live together in a natural community .
hgt in prokaryote be know to occur by the three primary mechanism that be illustrate in figure one  one  .  two  six

transformation frederick griffith be the first to demonstrate the process of transformation .
in one  nine  two  eight , - pron - show that live , nonpathogenic streptococcus pneumoniae bacteria could be transform into pathogenic bacteria through exposure to a heat - kill pathogenic strain .
- pron - conclude that some sort of agent , which - pron - call the “ transform principle , " have be pass from the dead pathogenic bacteria to the live , nonpathogenic bacteria .
in one  nine  four  four , oswald avery ( one  eight  seven  seven – one  nine  five  five ) , colin macleod ( one  nine  zero  nine – one  nine  seven  two ) , and maclyn mccarty ( one  nine  one  one – two  zero  zero  five ) demonstrate that the transform principle be dna ( see use microorganism to discover the secrets of life ) .
in transformation , the prokaryote take up naked dna find in - pron - environment and that be derive from other cell that have lyse on death and release - pron - content , include - pron - genome , into the environment .
many bacteria be naturally competent , mean that - pron - actively bind to environmental dna , transport - pron - across - pron - cell envelope into - pron - cytoplasm , and make - pron - single strand .
typically , double - strand foreign dna within cell be destroy by nuclease as a defense against viral infection .
however , these nuclease be usually ineffective against singlestranded dna , so this single - strand dna within the cell have the opportunity to recombine into the bacterial genome .
a molecule of dna that contain fragment of dna from different organism be call recombinant dna .
( recombinant dna will be discuss in more detail in microbes and the tool of genetic engineering . )
if the bacterium incorporate the new dna into - pron - own genome through recombination , the bacterial cell may gain new phenotypic property .
for example , if a nonpathogenic bacterium take up dna for a toxin gene from a pathogen and then incorporate - pron - into - pron - chromosome , - pron - , too , may become pathogenic .
plasmid dna may also be take up by competent bacteria and confer new property to the cell .
overall , transformation in nature be a relatively inefficient process because environmental dna level be low because of the activity of nuclease that be also chapter one  one  mechanisms of microbial genetics four  eight  one release during cellular lysis .
additionally , genetic recombination be inefficient at incorporate new dna sequence into the genome .
in nature , bacterial transformation be an important mechanism for the acquisition of genetic element encode virulence factor and antibiotic resistance .
gene encode resistance to antimicrobial compound have be show to be widespread in nature , even in environment not influence by human .
these gene , which allow microbe live in mixed community to compete for limited resource , can be transfer within a population by transformation , as well as by the other process of hgt .
in the laboratory , - pron - can exploit the natural process of bacterial transformation for genetic engineering to make a wide variety of medicinal product , as discuss in microbes and the tool of genetic engineering .

transduction virus that infect bacteria ( bacteriophage ) may also move short piece of chromosomal dna from one bacterium to another in a process call transduction ( see figure six  .  nine ) .
recall that in generalize transduction , any piece of chromosomal dna may be transfer to a new host cell by accidental packaging of chromosomal dna into a phage head during phage assembly .
by contrast , specialized transduction result from the imprecise excision of a lysogenic prophage from the bacterial chromosome such that - pron - carry with - pron - a piece of the bacterial chromosome from either side of the phage 's integration site to a new host cell .
as a result , the host may acquire new property .
this process be call lysogenic conversion .
of medical significance , a lysogenic phage may carry with - pron - a virulence gene to - pron - new host .
once insert into the new host 's chromosome , the new host may gain pathogenicity .
several pathogenic bacteria , include corynebacterium diphtheriae ( the causative agent of diphtheria ) and clostridium botulinum ( the causative agent of botulism ) , be virulent because of the introduction of toxin - encode gene by lysogenic bacteriophage , affirm the clinical relevance of transduction in the exchange of gene involve in infectious disease .
archaea have - pron - own virus that translocate genetic material from one individual to another .

conjugation
in conjugation , dna be directly transfer from one prokaryote to another by mean of a conjugation pilus , which bring the organism into contact with one another .
in e . coli , the gene encode the ability to conjugate be locate on a bacterial plasmid call the f plasmid , also know as the fertility factor , and the conjugation pilus be call the f pilus .
the f - plasmid gene encode both the protein compose the f pilus and those involve in roll circle replication of the plasmid .
cell contain the f plasmid , capable of form an f pilus , be call f+ cell or donor cell , and those lack an f plasmid be call f− cell or recipient cell .
conjugation of the f plasmid during typical conjugation in e . coli , the f pilus of an f+ cell come into contact with an f– cell and retract , bring the two cell envelope into contact ( figure one  one  .  two  eight ) .
then a cytoplasmic bridge form between the two cell at the site of the conjugation pilus .
as roll circle replication of the f plasmid occur in the f+ cell , a single - strand copy of the f plasmid be transfer through the cytoplasmic bridge to the f− cell , which then synthesize the complementary strand , make - pron - double strand .
the f− cell now become an f+ cell capable of make - pron - own conjugation pilus .
eventually , in a mixed bacterial population contain both f+ and f− cell , all cell will become f+ cell .
gene on the e . coli f plasmid also encode protein prevent conjugation between f+ cell .

conjugation of f ' and hfr cells
although typical conjugation in e . coli result in the transfer of the f - plasmid dna only , conjugation may also transfer chromosomal dna .
this be because the f plasmid occasionally integrate into the bacterial chromosome through recombination between the plasmid and the chromosome , form an hfr cell ( figure one  one  .  two  nine ) .
“
hfr " refer to the high frequency of recombination see when recipient f− cell receive genetic information from hfr cell through conjugation .
similar to the imprecise excision of a prophage during specialized transduction , the integrated f plasmid may also be imprecisely excise from the chromosome , produce an f ' plasmid that carry with - pron - some chromosomal dna adjacent to the integration site .
on conjugation , this dna be introduce to the recipient cell and may be either maintain as part of the f ' plasmid or be recombine into the recipient cell 's bacterial chromosome .
hfr cell may also treat the bacterial chromosome like an enormous f plasmid and attempt to transfer a copy of - pron - to a recipient f− cell .
because the bacterial chromosome be so large , transfer of the entire chromosome take a long time ( figure one  one  .  three  zero ) .
however , contact between bacterial cell during conjugation be transient , so - pron - be unusual for the entire chromosome to be transfer .
host chromosomal dna near the integration site of the f plasmid , displace by the unidirectional process of roll circle replication , be more likely to be transfer and recombine into a recipient cell 's chromosome than host gene farther away .
thus , the relative location of bacterial gene on the hfr cell 's genome can be map base on when - pron - be transfer through conjugation .
as a result , prior to the age of widespread bacterial genome sequencing , distance on prokaryotic genome map be often measure in minute .

transposition genetic element call transposon ( transposable element ) , or “ jumping gene , " be molecule of dna that include special invert repeat sequence at - pron - end and a gene encode the enzyme transposase ( figure one  one  .  three  one ) .
transposon allow the entire sequence to independently excise from one location in a dna molecule and integrate into the dna elsewhere through a process call transposition .
transposon be originally discover in maize ( corn ) by american geneticist barbara mcclintock ( one  nine  zero  two – one  nine  nine  two ) in the one  nine  four  zero .
transposon have since be find in all type of organism , both prokaryote and eukaryote .
thus , unlike the three previous mechanism discuss , transposition be not prokaryote - specific .
most transposon be nonreplicative , mean - pron - move in a “ cut - and - paste ” fashion .
some may be replicative , however , retain - pron - location in the dna while make a copy to be insert elsewhere ( “ copy and paste " ) .
because transposon can move within a dna molecule , from one dna molecule to another , or even from one cell to another , - pron - have the ability to introduce genetic diversity .
movement within the same dna molecule can alter phenotype by inactivate or activate a gene .
transposon may carry with - pron - additional gene , move these gene from one location to another with - pron - .
for example , bacterial transposon can relocate antibiotic resistance gene , move - pron - from chromosome to plasmid .
this mechanism have be show to be responsible for the colocalization of multiple antibiotic resistance gene on a single r plasmid in shigella strain cause bacterial dysentery .
such an r plasmid can then be easily transfer among a bacterial population through the process of conjugation .

one  one  .  seven gene regulation  operon theory learning objectives

describe why regulation of operon be important
each nucleate cell in a multicellular organism contain copy of the same dna .
similarly , all cell in two pure bacterial culture inoculate from the same start colony contain the same dna , with the exception of change that arise from spontaneous mutation .
if each cell in a multicellular organism have the same dna , then how be - pron - that cell in different part of the organism 's body exhibit different characteristic ?
similarly , how be - pron - that the same bacterial cell within two pure culture expose to different environmental condition can exhibit different phenotype ?
in both case , each genetically identical cell do not turn on , or express , the same set of gene .
only a subset of protein in a cell at a give time be express .
genomic dna contain both structural gene , which encode product that serve as cellular structure or enzyme , and regulatory gene , which encode product that regulate gene expression .
the expression of a gene be a highly regulated process .
whereas regulate gene expression in multicellular organism allow for cellular differentiation , in singlecelle organism like prokaryote , - pron - primarily ensure that a cell 's resource be not waste make protein that the cell do not need at that time .
elucidate the mechanism control gene expression be important to the understanding of human health .
malfunction in this process in human lead to the development of cancer and other disease .
understand the interaction between the gene expression of a pathogen and that of - pron - human host be important for the understanding of a particular infectious disease .
gene regulation involve a complex web of interaction within a give cell among signal from the cell 's environment , signal molecule within the cell , and the cell 's dna .
these interaction lead to the expression of some gene and the suppression of other , depend on circumstance .
prokaryote and eukaryote share some similarity in - pron - mechanism to regulate gene expression  however , gene expression in eukaryote be more complicated because of the temporal and spatial separation between the process of transcription and translation .
thus , although most regulation of gene expression occur through transcriptional control in prokaryote , regulation of gene expression in eukaryote occur at the transcriptional level and posttranscriptionally ( after the primary transcript have be make ) .
prokaryotic gene regulation
in bacteria and archaea , structural protein with related function be usually encode together within the genome in a block call an operon and be transcribe together under the control of a single promoter , result in the formation of a polycistronic transcript ( figure one  one  .  three  two ) .
in this way , regulation of the transcription of all of the structural gene encode the enzyme that catalyze the many step in a single biochemical pathway can be control simultaneously , because - pron - will either all be need at the same time , or none will be need .
for example , in e . coli , all of the structural gene that encode enzyme need to use lactose as an energy source lie next to each other in the lactose ( or lac ) operon under the control of a single promoter , the lac promoter .
french scientist françois jacob ( one  nine  two  zero – two  zero  one  three ) and jacques monod at the pasteur institute be the first to show the organization of bacterial gene into operon , four  eight  eight chapter one  one
 mechanisms of microbial genetics
this openstax book be available for free at http / / cnx . org / content / col one  two  zero  eight  seven  /  one  .  five through - pron - study on the lac operon of e . coli .
for this work , - pron - win the nobel prize in physiology or medicine in one  nine  six  five .
although eukaryotic gene be not organize into operon , prokaryotic operon be excellent model for learn about gene regulation generally .
there be some gene cluster in eukaryote that function similar to operon .
many of the principle can be apply to eukaryotic system and contribute to - pron - understanding of change in gene expression in eukaryote that can result pathological change such as cancer .
each operon include dna sequence that influence - pron - own transcription  these be locate in a region call the regulatory region .
the regulatory region include the promoter and the region surround the promoter , to which transcription factor , protein encode by regulatory gene , can bind .
transcription factor influence the binding of rna polymerase to the promoter and allow - pron - progression to transcribe structural gene .
a repressor be a transcription factor that suppress transcription of a gene in response to an external stimulus by bind to a dna sequence within the regulatory region call the operator , which be locate between the rna polymerase binding site of the promoter and the transcriptional start site of the first structural gene .
repressor bind physically block rna polymerase from transcribe structural gene .
conversely , an activator be a transcription factor that increase the transcription of a gene in response to an external stimulus by facilitate rna polymerase bind to the promoter .
an inducer , a third type of regulatory molecule , be a small molecule that either activate or repress transcription by interact with a repressor or an activator .
in prokaryote , there be example of operon whose gene product be require rather consistently and whose expression , therefore , be unregulated .
such operon be constitutively express , mean - pron - be transcribe and translate continuously to provide the cell with constant intermediate level of the protein product .
such gene encode enzyme involve in housekeep function require for cellular maintenance , include dna replication , repair , and expression , as well as enzyme involve in core metabolism .
in contrast , there be other prokaryotic operon that be express only when need and be regulate by repressor , activator , and inducer .

in prokaryote , structural gene of related function be often organize together on the genome and transcribe together under the control of a single promoter .
the operon 's regulatory region include both the promoter and the operator .
if a repressor bind to the operator , then the structural gene will not be transcribe .
alternatively , activator may bind to the regulatory region , enhance transcription .

 mechanisms of microbial genetics four  eight  nine regulation by repression prokaryotic operon be commonly control by the binding of repressor to operator region , thereby prevent the transcription of the structural gene .
such operon be classify as either repressible operon or inducible operon .
repressible operon , like the tryptophan ( trp ) operon , typically contain gene encode enzyme require for a biosynthetic pathway .
as long as the product of the pathway , like tryptophan , continue to be require by the cell , a repressible operon will continue to be express .
however , when the product of the biosynthetic pathway begin to accumulate in the cell , remove the need for the cell to continue to make more , the expression of the operon be repress .
conversely , inducible operon , like the lac operon of e . coli , often contain gene encode enzyme in a pathway involve in the metabolism of a specific substrate like lactose .
these enzyme be only require when that substrate be available , thus expression of the operon be typically induce only in the presence of the substrate .
the trp operon 
a repressible operon e . coli can synthesize tryptophan use enzyme that be encode by five structural gene locate next to each other in the trp operon ( figure one  one  .  three  three ) .
when environmental tryptophan be low , the operon be turn on .
this mean that transcription be initiate , the gene be express , and tryptophan be synthesize .
however , if tryptophan be present in the environment , the trp operon be turn off .
transcription do not occur and tryptophan be not synthesize .
when tryptophan be not present in the cell , the repressor by - pron - do not bind to the operator  therefore , the operon be active and tryptophan be synthesize .
however , when tryptophan accumulate in the cell , two tryptophan molecule bind to the trp repressor molecule , which change - pron - shape , allow - pron - to bind to the trp operator .
this bind of the active form of the trp repressor to the operator block rna polymerase from transcribe the structural gene , stop expression of the operon .
thus , the actual product of the biosynthetic pathway control by the operon regulate the expression of the operon .

the five structural gene need to synthesize tryptophan in e . coli be locate next to each other in the trp operon .
when tryptophan be absent , the repressor protein do not bind to the operator , and the gene be transcribe .
when tryptophan be plentiful , tryptophan bind the repressor protein at the operator sequence .
this physically block the rna polymerase from transcribe the tryptophan biosynthesis gene .

the lac operon  an inducible operon
the lac operon be an example of an inducible operon that be also subject to activation in the absence of glucose ( figure one  one  .  three  four ) .
the lac operon encode three structural gene necessary to acquire and process the disaccharide lactose from the environment , break - pron - down into the simple sugar glucose and galactose .
for the lac operon to be express , lactose must be present .
this make sense for the cell because - pron - would be energetically wasteful to create the enzyme to process lactose if lactose be not available .
in the absence of lactose , the lac repressor be bind to the operator region of the lac operon , physically prevent rna polymerase from transcribe the structural gene .
however , when lactose be present , the lactose inside the cell be convert to allolactose .
allolactose serve as an inducer molecule , bind to the repressor and change - pron - shape so that - pron - be no longer able to bind to the operator dna .
removal of the repressor in the presence of lactose allow rna polymerase to move through the operator region and begin transcription of the lac structural gene .
figure one  one  .  three  four
the three structural gene that be need to degrade lactose in e . coli be locate next to each other in the lac operon .
when lactose be absent , the repressor protein bind to the operator , physically block the rna polymerase from transcribe the lac structural gene .
when lactose be available , a lactose molecule bind the repressor protein , prevent the repressor from bind to the operator sequence , and the gene be transcribe .
the lac operon  activation by catabolite activator protein bacteria typically have the ability to use a variety of substrate as carbon source .
however , because glucose be usually preferable to other substrate , bacteria have mechanism to ensure that alternative substrate be only use when glucose have be deplete .
additionally , bacteria have mechanism to ensure that the gene encode enzyme for use alternative substrate be express only when the alternative substrate be available .
in the one  nine  four  zero , jacques monod be the first to demonstrate the preference for certain substrate over other through - pron - study of e . coli 's growth when culture in the presence of two different substrate simultaneously .
such study generate diauxic growth curve , like the one show in figure one  one  .  three  five .
although the preferred substrate glucose be use first , e . coli link to learn chapter one  one
 mechanisms of microbial genetics four  nine  one grow quickly and the enzyme for lactose metabolism be absent .
however , once glucose level be deplete , growth rate slow , induce the expression of the enzyme need for the metabolism of the second substrate , lactose .
notice how the growth rate in lactose be slow , as indicate by the low steepness of the growth curve .
the ability to switch from glucose use to another substrate like lactose be a consequence of the activity of an enzyme call enzyme iia ( eiia ) .
when glucose level drop , cell produce less atp from catabolism ( see catabolism of carbohydrates ) , and eiia become phosphorylate .
phosphorylated eiia activate adenylyl cyclase , an enzyme that convert some of the remain atp to cyclic amp ( camp ) , a cyclic derivative of amp and important signal molecule involve in glucose and energy metabolism in e . coli .
as a result , camp level begin to rise in the cell ( figure one  one  .  three  six ) .
the lac operon also play a role in this switch from use glucose to use lactose .
when glucose be scarce , the accumulate camp cause by increase adenylyl cyclase activity bind to catabolite activator protein ( cap ) , also know as camp receptor protein ( crp ) .
the complex bind to the promoter region of the lac operon ( figure one  one  .  three  seven ) .
in the regulatory region of these operon , a cap bind site be locate upstream of the rna polymerase binding site in the promoter .
bind of the cap - camp complex to this site increase the bind ability of rna polymerase to the promoter region to initiate the transcription of the structural gene .
thus , in the case of the lac operon , for transcription to occur , lactose must be present ( remove the lac repressor protein ) and glucose level must be deplete ( allow bind of an activating protein ) .
when glucose level be high , there be catabolite repression of operon encode enzyme for the metabolism of alternative substrate .
because of low camp level under these condition , there be an insufficient amount of the cap - camp complex to activate transcription of these operon .
see table one  one  .  six for a summary of the regulation of the lac operon .

global responses of prokaryotes
in prokaryote , there be also several high level of gene regulation that have the ability to control the transcription of many related operon simultaneously in response to an environmental signal .
a group of operon all control simultaneously be call a regulon .
alarmones when sense impending stress , prokaryote alter the expression of a wide variety of operon to respond in coordination .
- pron - do this through the production of alarmone , which be small intracellular nucleotide derivative .
alarmone change which gene be express and stimulate the expression of specific stress - response gene .
the use of alarmone to alter gene expression in response to stress appear to be important in pathogenic bacteria .
on encountering host defense mechanism and other harsh condition during infection , many operon encode virulence gene be upregulate in response to alarmone signal .
knowledge of these response be key to be able to fully understand the infection process of many pathogen and to the development of therapy to counter this process .
alternate σ factors
since the σ subunit of bacterial rna polymerase confer specificity as to which promoter should be transcribe , alter the σ factor use be another way for bacteria to quickly and globally change what regulon be transcribe at a give time .
the σ factor recognize sequence within a bacterial promoter , so different σ factor will each recognize slightly different promoter sequence .
in this way , when the cell sense specific environmental condition , - pron - may respond by change which σ factor - pron - express , degrade the old one and produce a new one to transcribe the operon encode gene whose product will be useful under the new environmental condition .
for example , in sporulate bacteria of the genera bacillus and clostridium ( which include many pathogen ) , a group of σ factor control the expression of the many gene need for sporulation in response to sporulation - stimulate signal .

although most gene expression be regulate at the level of transcription initiation in prokaryote , there be also mechanism to control both the completion of transcription as well as translation concurrently .
since - pron - discovery , these mechanism have be show to control the completion of transcription and translation of many prokaryotic operon .
because these mechanism link the regulation of transcription and translation directly , - pron - be specific to prokaryote , because these process be physically separate in eukaryote .
one such regulatory system be attenuation , whereby secondary stem - loop structure form within the five ' end of an mrna be transcribe determine if transcription to complete the synthesis of this mrna will occur and if this mrna will be use for translation .
beyond the transcriptional repression mechanism already discuss , attenuation also control expression of the trp operon in e . coli ( figure one  one  .  three  eight ) .
the trp operon regulatory region contain a leader sequence call trpl between the operator and the first structural gene , which have four stretch of rna that can base pair with each other in different combination .
when a terminator stem - loop form , transcription terminate , release rna polymerase from the mrna .
however , when an antiterminator stem - loop form , this prevent the formation of the terminator stem - loop , so rna polymerase can transcribe the structural gene .
a related mechanism of concurrent regulation of transcription and translation in prokaryote be the use of a riboswitch , a small region of noncode rna find within the five ' end of some prokaryotic mrna molecule ( figure one  one  .  three  nine .
a riboswitch may bind to a small intracellular molecule to stabilize certain secondary structure of the mrna molecule .
the binding of the small molecule determine which stem - loop structure form , thus influence the completion of mrna synthesis and protein synthesis .

other factors affect gene expression in prokaryotes and eukaryotes
although the focus on - pron - discussion of transcriptional control use prokaryotic operon as example , eukaryotic transcriptional control be similar in many way .
as in prokaryote , eukaryotic transcription can be control through the binding of transcription factor include repressor and activator .
interestingly , eukaryotic transcription can be influence by the binding of protein to region of dna , call enhancer , rather far away from the gene , through dna looping facilitate between the enhancer and the promoter ( figure one  one  .  four  zero ) .
overall , regulate transcription be a highly effective way to control gene expression in both prokaryote and eukaryote .
however , the control of gene expression in eukaryote in response to environmental and cellular stress can be accomplish in additional way without the binding of transcription factor to regulatory region .

in eukaryote , an enhancer be a dna sequence that promote transcription .
each enhancer be make up of short dna sequence call distal control element .
activator bind to the distal control element interact with mediator protein and transcription factor .

dna - level control
in eukaryote , the dna molecule or associate histone can be chemically modify in such a way as to influence transcription  this be call epigenetic regulation .
methylation of certain cytosine nucleotide in dna in response to environmental factor have be show to influence use of such dna for transcription , with dna methylation commonly correlating to lower level of gene expression .
additionally , in response to environmental factor , histone protein for package dna can also be chemically modify in multiple way , include acetylation and deacetylation , influence the packaging state of dna and thus affect the availability of loosely wound dna for transcription .
these chemical modification can sometimes be maintain through multiple round of cell division , make at least some of these epigenetic change heritable .

summary one  one  .  one
the functions of genetic material  dna serve two important cellular function  - pron - be the genetic material pass from parent to offspring and - pron - serve as the information to direct and regulate the construction of the protein necessary for the cell to perform all of - pron - function .

the central dogma state that dna organize into gene specify the sequence of messenger rna ( mrna ) , which , in turn , specify the amino acid sequence of protein .

the genotype of a cell be the full collection of gene a cell contain .
not all gene be use to make protein simultaneously .
the phenotype be a cell
's observable characteristic result from the protein - pron - be produce at a give time under specific environmental condition .
one  one  .  two dna replication

the dna replication process be semiconservative , which result in two dna molecule , each have one parental strand of dna and one newly synthesize strand .

in bacteria , the initiation of replication occur at the origin of replication , where supercoiled dna be unwind by dna gyrase , make single - strand by helicase , and bind by single - strand bind protein to maintain - pron - single - strand state .
primase synthesize a short rna primer , provide a free three ' - oh group to which dna polymerase iii can add dna nucleotide .

during elongation , the lead strand of dna be synthesize continuously from a single primer .
the lag strand be synthesize discontinuously in short okazaki fragment , each require - pron - own primer .
the rna primer be remove and replace with dna nucleotide by bacterial dna polymerase i , and dna ligase seal the gap between these fragment .

termination of replication in bacteria involve the resolution of circular dna concatemer by topoisomerase iv to release the two copy of the circular chromosome .

eukaryotes typically have multiple linear chromosome , each with multiple origin of replication .
overall , clinical focus chapter one  one  mechanisms of microbial genetics four  nine  nine replication in eukaryote be similar to that in prokaryote .

the linear nature of eukaryotic chromosome necessitate telomere to protect gene near the end of the chromosome .
telomerase extend telomere , prevent - pron - degradation , in some cell type .
 roll circle replication be a type of rapid unidirectional dna synthesis of a circular dna molecule use for the replication of some plasmid .
one  one  .  three rna transcription

during transcription , the information encode in dna be use to make rna .

rna polymerase synthesize rna , use the antisense strand of the dna as template by add complementary rna nucleotide to the three ' end of the grow strand .

rna polymerase bind to dna at a sequence call a promoter during the initiation of transcription .

genes encode protein of related function be frequently transcribe under the control of a single promoter in prokaryote , result in the formation of a polycistronic mrna molecule that encode multiple polypeptide .

unlike dna polymerase , rna polymerase do not require a three ' - oh group to add nucleotide , so a primer be not need during initiation .

termination of transcription in bacteria occur when the rna polymerase encounter specific dna sequence that lead to stall of the polymerase .
this result in release of rna polymerase from the dna template strand , free the rna transcript .

eukaryotes have three different rna polymerase .
eukaryote also have monocistronic mrna , each encode only a single polypeptide .

eukaryotic primary transcript be process in several way , include the addition of a five ' cap and a three ′ - poly - a tail , as well as splice , to generate a mature mrna molecule that can be transport out of the nucleus and that be protect from degradation .
one  one  .  four protein synthesis ( translation )

in translation , polypeptide be synthesize use mrna sequence and cellular machinery , include trnas that match mrna codon to specific amino acid and ribosome compose of rna and protein that catalyze the reaction .

the genetic code be degenerate in that several mrna codon code for the same amino acid .
the genetic code be almost universal among live organism .

prokaryotic ( seven  zero s ) and cytoplasmic eukaryotic ( eight  zero s ) ribosome be each compose of a large subunit and a small subunit of differ size between the two group .
each subunit be compose of rrna and protein .
organelle ribosome in eukaryotic cell resemble prokaryotic ribosome .
 some six  zero to nine  zero specie of trna exist in bacteria .
each trna have a three - nucleotide anticodon as well as a binding site for a cognate amino acid .
all trna with a specific anticodon will carry the same amino acid .

initiation of translation occur when the small ribosomal subunit bind with initiation factor and an initiator trna at the start codon of an mrna , follow by the bind to the initiation complex of the large ribosomal subunit .

in prokaryotic cell , the start codon code for n - formyl - methionine carry by a special initiator trna .
in eukaryotic cell , the start codon code for methionine carry by a special initiator trna .
in addition , whereas ribosomal binding of the mrna in prokaryote be facilitate by the shine - dalgarno sequence within the mrna , eukaryotic ribosome bind to the five ' cap of the mrna .

during the elongation stage of translation , a charge trna bind to mrna in the a site of the ribosome  a peptide bond be catalyze between the two adjacent amino acid , break the bond between the first amino acid and - pron - trna  the ribosome move one codon along the mrna  and the first trna be move from the p site of the ribosome to the e site and leave the ribosomal complex .

termination of translation occur when the ribosome encounter a stop codon , which do not code for a trna .
release factor cause the polypeptide to be release , and the ribosomal complex dissociate .

in prokaryote , transcription and translation may be couple , with translation of an mrna molecule begin as soon as transcription allow enough mrna exposure for the binding of a ribosome , prior to transcription termination .
transcription and translation be not couple in eukaryote because transcription occur in the nucleus , whereas translation occur in the cytoplasm or in association with the rough endoplasmic reticulum .

polypeptides often require one or more post - translational modification to become biologically active .
one  one  .  five mutations

a mutation be a heritable change in dna .
a mutation may lead to a change in the amino - acid sequence of a protein , possibly affect - pron - function .

a point mutation affect a single base pair .
a point mutation may cause a silent mutation if the mrna codon code for the same amino acid , a missense mutation if the mrna codon code for a different amino acid , or a nonsense mutation if the mrna codon become a stop codon .

missense mutation may retain function , depend on the chemistry of the new amino acid and - pron - location in the protein .
nonsense mutation produce truncate and frequently nonfunctional protein .

a frameshift mutation result from an insertion or deletion of a number of nucleotide that be not a multiple of three .
the change in read frame alter every amino acid after the point of the mutation and result in a nonfunctional protein .

spontaneous mutation occur through dna replication error , whereas induce mutation occur through exposure to a mutagen .

mutagenic agent be frequently carcinogenic but not always .
however , nearly all carcinogen be mutagenic .

chemical mutagen include base analog and chemical that modify exist basis .
in both case , mutation be introduce after several round of dna replication .

ionizing radiation , such as x - ray and γ - ray , lead to breakage of the phosphodiest backbone of dna and can also chemically modify basis to alter - pron - base - pair rule .

nonionize radiation like ultraviolet light may introduce pyrimidine ( thymine ) dimer , which , during dna replication and transcription , may introduce frameshift or point mutation .

cell have mechanism to repair naturally occur mutation .
dna polymerase have proofread activity .
mismatch repair be a process to repair incorrectly incorporate basis after dna replication have be complete .

pyrimidine dimer can also be repair .
in nucleotide excision repair ( dark repair ) , enzyme recognize the distortion introduce by the pyrimidine dimer and replace the damage strand with the correct basis , use the undamaged dna strand as a template .
bacteria and other organism may also use direct repair , in which the photolyase enzyme , in the presence of visible light , break apart the pyrimidine .

through comparison of growth on the complete plate and lack of growth on medium lack specific nutrient , specific loss - of - function mutant call auxotroph can be identify .

the ames test be an inexpensive method that use auxotrophic bacteria to measure mutagenicity of a chemical compound .
mutagenicity be an indicator of carcinogenic potential .
one  one  .  six
how asexual prokaryotes achieve genetic diversity 
horizontal gene transfer be an important way for asexually reproduce organism like prokaryote to acquire new trait .

there be three mechanism of horizontal gene transfer typically use by bacteria  transformation , transduction , and conjugation .

transformation allow for competent cell to take up naked dna , release from other cell on - pron - death , into - pron - cytoplasm , where - pron - may recombine with the host genome .

in generalize transduction , any piece of chromosomal dna may be transfer by accidental packaging of the degraded host chromosome into a phage head .
in specialized transduction , only chromosomal dna adjacent to the integration site of a lysogenic phage may be transfer as a result of imprecise excision of the chapter one  one  mechanisms of microbial genetics five  zero  one prophage .

conjugation be mediate by the f plasmid , which encode a conjugation pilus that bring an f plasmidcontaining f+ cell into contact with an f - cell .

the rare integration of the f plasmid into the bacterial chromosome , generate an hfr cell , allow for transfer of chromosomal dna from the donor to the recipient .
additionally , imprecise excision of the f plasmid from the chromosome may generate an f ' plasmid that may be transfer to a recipient by conjugation .

conjugation transfer of r plasmid be an important mechanism for the spread of antibiotic resistance in bacterial community .

transposon be molecule of dna with invert repeat at - pron - end that also encode the enzyme transposase , allow for - pron - movement from one location in dna to another .
although find in both prokaryote and eukaryote , transposon be clinically relevant in bacterial pathogen for the movement of virulence factor , include antibiotic resistance gene .
one  one  .  seven gene regulation 
operon theory

gene expression be a tightly regulate process .
 gene expression in prokaryote be largely regulate at the point of transcription .
gene expression in eukaryote be additionally regulate post - transcriptionally .
 prokaryotic structural gene of related function be often organize into operon , all control by transcription from a single promoter .
the regulatory region of an operon include the promoter - pron - and the region surround the promoter to which transcription factor can bind to influence transcription .

although some operon be constitutively express , most be subject to regulation through the use of transcription factor ( repressor and activator ) .
a repressor bind to an operator , a dna sequence within the regulatory region between the rna polymerase binding site in the promoter and first structural gene , thereby physically block transcription of these operon .
an activator bind within the regulatory region of an operon , help rna polymerase bind to the promoter , thereby enhance the transcription of this operon .
an inducer influence transcription through interact with a repressor or activator .

the trp operon be a classic example of a repressible operon .
when tryptophan accumulate , tryptophan bind to a repressor , which then bind to the operator , prevent further transcription .

the lac operon be a classic example an inducible operon .
when lactose be present in the cell , - pron - be convert to allolactose .
allolactose act as an inducer , bind to the repressor and prevent the repressor from bind to the operator .
this allow transcription of the structural gene .

the lac operon be also subject to activation .
when glucose level be deplete , some cellular atp be convert into camp , which bind to the catabolite activator protein ( cap ) .
the camp - cap complex activate transcription of the lac operon .
when glucose level be high , - pron - presence prevent transcription of the lac operon and other operon by catabolite repression .

small intracellular molecule call alarmone be make in response to various environmental stress , allow bacteria to control the transcription of a group of operon , call a regulon .

bacteria have the ability to change which σ factor of rna polymerase - pron - use in response to environmental condition to quickly and globally change which regulon be transcribe .

prokaryote have regulatory mechanism , include attenuation and the use of riboswitche , to simultaneously control the completion of transcription and translation from that transcript .
these mechanism work through the formation of stem loop in the five ' end of an mrna molecule currently be synthesize .

there be additional point of regulation of gene expression in prokaryote and eukaryote .
in eukaryote , epigenetic regulation by chemical modification of dna or histone , and regulation of rna processing be two method .

molecular cloning herbert boyer and stanley cohen first demonstrate the complete molecular cloning process in one  nine  seven  three when - pron - successfully clone gene from the african claw frog ( xenopus laevi ) into a bacterial plasmid that be then introduce into the bacterial host escherichia coli .

restriction enzymes and ligases
in recombinant dna technology , dna molecule be manipulate use naturally occur enzyme derive mainly from bacteria and virus .
the creation of recombinant dna molecule be possible due to the use of naturally occur restriction endonuclease ( restriction enzyme ) , bacterial enzyme produce as a protection mechanism to cut and destroy foreign cytoplasmic dna that be most commonly a result of bacteriophage infection .
stewart linn andwerner arber discover restriction enzyme in - pron - one  nine  six  zero study of how e . coli limit bacteriophage replication on infection .
today , - pron - use restriction enzyme extensively for cut dna fragment that can then be splice into another dna molecule to form recombinant molecule .
each restriction enzyme cut dna at a characteristic recognition site , a specific , usually palindromic , dna sequence typically between four to six base pair in length .
a palindrome be a sequence of letter that read the same forward as backward .
( the word
" level " be an example of a palindrome . )
palindromic dna sequence contain the same base sequence in the five ʹ to three ʹ direction on one strand as in the five ʹ to three ʹ direction on the complementary strand .
a restriction enzyme recognize the dna palindrome and cut each backbone at identical position in the palindrome .
some restriction enzyme cut to produce molecule that have complementary overhang ( sticky end ) while other cut without generate such overhang , instead produce blunt end ( figure one  two  .  three ) .
molecule with complementary sticky end can easily anneal , or form hydrogen bond between complementary basis , at - pron - sticky end .
the anneal step allow hybridization of the single - strand overhang .
hybridization refer to the join together of two complementary single strand of dna .
blunt end can also attach together , but less efficiently than sticky end due to the lack of complementary overhang facilitate the process .
in either case , ligation by dna ligase can then rejoin the two sugar - phosphate backbone of the dna through covalent bonding , make the molecule a continuous double strand .
in one  nine  seven  two , paul berg , a stanford biochemist , be the first to produce a recombinant dna molecule use this technique , combine the sv four  zero monkey virus with e . coli bacteriophage lambda to create a hybrid .

in this six - nucleotide restriction enzyme site , recognize by the enzyme bamhi , notice that the sequence read the same in the five ʹ to three ʹ direction on both strand .
this be know as a palindrome .
the cutting of the dna by the restriction enzyme at the site ( indicate by the black arrow ) produce dna fragment with sticky end .
another piece of dna cut with the same restriction enzyme could attach to one of these sticky end , form a recombinant dna molecule .
( b )
this four - nucleotide recognition site also exhibit a palindromic sequence .
the cutting of the dna by the restriction enzyme haeiii at the indicate site produce dna fragment with blunt end .
any other piece of blunt dna could attach to one of the blunt end produce , form a recombinant dna molecule .
plasmid
after restriction digestion , gene of interest be commonly insert into plasmid , small piece of typically circular , double - strand dna that replicate independently of the bacterial chromosome ( see unique characteristics of prokaryotic cells ) .
in recombinant dna technology , plasmid be often use as vector , dna molecule that carry dna fragment from one organism to another .
plasmid use as vector can be genetically engineer by researcher and scientific supply company to have specialize property , as illustrate by the commonly use plasmid vector puc one  nine ( figure one  two  .  four ) .
some plasmid vector contain gene that confer antibiotic resistance  these resistance gene allow researcher to easily find plasmid - contain colony by plate - pron - on medium contain the correspond antibiotic .
the antibiotic kill all host cell that do not harbor the desire plasmid vector , but those that contain the vector be able to survive and grow .
plasmid vector use for cloning typically have a polylinker site , or multiple cloning site ( mcs ) .
a polylinker site be a short sequence contain multiple unique restriction enzyme recognition site that be use for insert dna into the plasmid after restriction digestion of both the dna and the plasmid .
have these multiple restriction enzyme recognition site within the polylinker site make the plasmid vector versatile , so - pron - can be use for many different cloning experiment involve different restriction enzyme .
this polylinker site be often find within a reporter gene , another gene sequence artificially engineer into the plasmid that encode a protein that allow for visualization of dna insertion .
the reporter gene allow a researcher to distinguish host cell that contain recombinant plasmid with clone dna fragment from host cell that only contain the non - recombinant plasmid vector .
the most common reporter gene use in plasmid vector be the bacterial lacz five  one  two chapter one  two  modern applications of microbial genetics

the lacz reporter gene be disabled when the recombinant dna be splice into the plasmid .
because the lacz protein be not produce when the gene be disabled , x - gal be not degrade and white colony be produce , which can then be isolate .
this blue - white screening method be describe later and show in figure one  two  .  five .
in addition to these feature , some plasmid come pre - digested and with an enzyme link to the linearize plasmid to aid in ligation after the insertion of foreign dna fragment .
