the primary function of the respiratory tract be to exchange gas ( oxygen and carbon dioxide ) for metabolism .
however , inhalation and exhalation ( particularly when forceful ) can also serve as a vehicle of transmission for pathogen between individual .
anatomy of the upper respiratory system
the respiratory system can be conceptually divide into upper and low region at the point of the epiglottis , the structure that seal off the low respiratory system from the pharynx during swallow ( figure two  two  .  two ) .
the upper respiratory system be in direct contact with the external environment .
the naris ( or nostril ) be the external opening of the nose that lead back into the nasal cavity , a large air - fill space behind the naris .
these anatomical site constitute the primary opening and first section of the respiratory tract , respectively .
the nasal cavity be line with hair that trap large particle , like dust and pollen , and prevent - pron - access to deep tissue .
the nasal cavity be also line with a mucous membrane and bowman 's gland that produce mucus to help trap particle and microorganism for removal .
the nasal cavity be connect to several other air - fill space .
the sinus , a set of four , pair small cavity in the skull , communicate with the nasal cavity through a series of small opening .
the nasopharynx be part of the upper throat extend from the posterior nasal cavity .
the nasopharynx carry air inhale through the nose .
the middle ear be connect to the nasopharynx through the eustachian tube .
the middle ear be separate from the outer ear by the tympanic membrane , or ear drum .
and finally , the lacrimal gland drain to the nasal cavity through the nasolacrimal duct ( tear duct ) .
the open connection between these site allow microorganism to move from the nasal cavity to the sinus , middle ear ( and back ) , and down into the low respiratory tract from the nasopharynx .

anatomy of the lower respiratory system
the low respiratory system begin below the epiglottis in the larynx or voice box ( figure two  two  .  three ) .
the trachea , or windpipe , be a cartilaginous tube extend from the larynx that provide an unobstructed path for air to reach the lung .
the trachea bifurcate into the left and right bronchi as - pron - reach the lung .
these path branch repeatedly to form small and more extensive network of tube , the bronchiole .
the terminal bronchiole form in this treelike network end in cul - de - sacs call the alveoli .
these structure be surround by capillary network and be the site of gas exchange in the respiratory system .
human lung contain on the order of four  zero  zero  ,  zero  zero  zero  ,  zero  zero  zero alveoli .
the outer surface of the lung be protect with a double - layer pleural membrane .
this structure protect the lung and provide lubrication to permit the lung to move easily during respiration .

the inner lining of the respiratory system consist of mucous membrane ( figure two  two  .  four ) and be protect by multiple immune defense .
the goblet cell within the respiratory epithelium secrete a layer of sticky mucus .
the viscosity and acidity of this secretion inhibit microbial attachment to the underlie cell .
in addition , the respiratory tract contain ciliate epithelial cell .
the beat cilia dislodge and propel the mucus , and any trap microbe , upward to the epiglottis , where - pron - will be swallow .
elimination of microbe in this manner be refer to as the mucociliary escalator effect and be an important mechanism that prevent inhale microorganism from migrate further into the low respiratory tract .

the upper respiratory system be under constant surveillance by mucosa - associate lymphoid tissue ( malt ) , include the adenoid and tonsil .
other mucosal defense include secrete antibody ( iga ) , lysozyme , surfactant , and antimicrobial peptide call defensin .
meanwhile , the low respiratory tract be protect by alveolar macrophage .
these phagocyte efficiently kill any microbe that manage to evade the other defense .
the combined action of these factor render the low respiratory tract nearly devoid of colonized microbe .

normal microbiota of the respiratory system
the upper respiratory tract contain an abundant and diverse microbiota .
the nasal passage and sinus be primarily colonize by member of the firmicutes , actinobacteria , and proteobacteria .
the most common bacteria identify include staphylococcus epidermidis , viridan group streptococci ( vgs ) , corynebacterium spp .
( diphtheroid ) , propionibacterium spp . , and haemophilus spp .
the oropharynx include many of the same isolate as the nose and sinus , with the addition of variable number of bacteria like specie of prevotella , fusobacterium , moraxella , and eikenella , as well as some candida fungal isolate .
in addition , many healthy human asymptomatically carry potential pathogen in the upper respiratory tract .
as much as two  zero % of the population carry staphylococcus aureus in - pron - nostrils . [ two ]
the pharynx , too , can be colonize with pathogenic strain of streptococcus , haemophilus , and neisseria .

sign and symptoms of respiratory infection microbial disease of the respiratory system typically result in an acute inflammatory response .
these infection can be group by the location affect and have name end in " itis " , which literally mean inflammation of .
for instance , rhinitis be an inflammation of the nasal cavity , often characteristic of the common cold .
rhinitis may also be associate with hay fever allergy or other irritant .
inflammation of the sinus be call sinusitis inflammation of the ear be call otitis .
otitis media be an inflammation of the middle ear .
a variety of microbe can cause pharyngitis , commonly know as a sore throat .
an inflammation of the larynx be call laryngitis .
the result inflammation may interfere with vocal cord function , cause voice loss .
when tonsil be inflame , - pron - be call tonsillitis .
chronic case of tonsillitis may be treat surgically with tonsillectomy .
more rarely , the epiglottis can be infect , a condition call epiglottitis .
in the low respiratory system , the inflammation of the bronchial tube result in bronchitis .
most serious of all be pneumonia , in which the alveoli in the lung be infect and become inflamed .
pus and edema accumulate and fill the alveoli with fluid ( call consolidation ) .
this reduce the lung ' ability to exchange gas and often result in a productive cough expel phlegm and mucus .
case of pneumonia can range from mild to life - threaten , and remain an important cause of mortality in the very young and very old .

the respiratory tract can be infect by a variety of bacteria , both gram positive and gram negative .
although the disease that - pron - cause may range from mild to severe , in most case , the microbe remain localize within the respiratory system .
fortunately , most of these infection also respond well to antibiotic therapy .
streptococcal infections
a common upper respiratory infection , streptococcal pharyngitis ( strep throat ) be cause by streptococcus pyogene .
this gram - positive bacterium appear as chain of cocci , as see in figure two  two  .  five .
rebecca lancefield serologically classify streptococci in the one  nine  three  zero use carbohydrate antigen from the bacterial cell wall .
s . pyogene be the sole member of the lancefield group
a streptococci and be often refer to as gas , or group
a strep .
figure two  two  .  five
this scan electron micrograph of streptococcus pyogene show the characteristic cellular phenotype resembling chain of cocci .
( credit  modification of work by u . s . centers for disease control and prevention - medical illustrator ) similar to streptococcal infection of the skin , the mucosal membrane of the pharynx be damage by the release of a variety of exoenzyme and exotoxin by this extracellular pathogen .
many strain of s . pyogene can degrade connective tissue by use hyaluronidase , collagenase and streptokinase .
streptokinase activate plasmin , which lead to degradation of fibrin and , in turn , dissolution of blood clot , which assist in the spread of the pathogen .
release toxin include streptolysin that can destroy red and white blood cell .
the classic sign of streptococcal pharyngitis be a fever high than three  eight ° c ( one  zero  zero  .  four ° f )  intense pharyngeal pain  erythema associate with pharyngeal inflammation  and swollen , dark - red palatine tonsil , often dot with patch of pus  and petechiae ( microcapillary hemorrhage ) on the soft or hard palate ( roof of the mouth ) ( figure two  two  .  six ) .
the submandibular lymph node beneath the angle of the jaw be also often swollen during strep throat .
some strain of group a streptococci produce erythrogenic toxin .
this exotoxin be encode by a temperate bacteriophage ( bacterial virus ) and be an example of phage conversion ( see the viral life cycle ) .
the toxin attack the plasma membrane of capillary endothelial cell and lead to scarlet fever ( or scarlatina ) , a disseminated fine red rash on the skin , and strawberry tongue , a red rash on the tongue ( figure two  two  .  six ) .

s . pyogene can be easily spread by direct contact or droplet transmission through cough and sneeze .
the disease can be diagnose quickly use a rapid enzyme immunoassay for the group a antigen .
however , due to a significant rate of false - negative result ( up to three  zero %[ four ] ) , culture identification be still the gold standard to confirm pharyngitis due to s . pyogene .

sequelae of s . pyogene infections
one reason strep throat infection be aggressively treat with antibiotic be because - pron - can lead to serious sequelae , later clinical consequence of a primary infection .
- pron - be estimate that one %– three % of untreated s . pyogene infection can be follow by nonsuppurative ( without the production of pus ) sequelae that develop one – three week after the acute infection have resolve .
two such sequela be acute rheumatic fever and acute glomerulonephritis .
acute rheumatic fever can follow pharyngitis cause by specific rheumatogenic strain of s . pyogene ( strain one , three , five , six , and one  eight ) .
although the exact mechanism responsible for this sequela remain unclear , molecular mimicry between the m protein of rheumatogenic strain of s . pyogene and heart tissue be think to initiate the autoimmune attack .
the most serious and lethal clinical manifestation of rheumatic fever be damage to and inflammation of the heart ( carditis ) .
acute glomerulonephritis also result from an immune response to streptococcal antigen follow pharyngitis and cutaneous infection .
acute glomerulonephritis develop within six – one  zero day after pharyngitis , but can take up to two  one day after a cutaneous infection .
similar to acute rheumatic fever , there be strong association between specific nephritogenic strain of s . pyogene and acute glomerulonephritis , and evidence suggest a role for antigen mimicry and autoimmunity .
however , the primary mechanism of acute glomerulonephritis appear to be the formation of immune complex between s . pyogene antigen and antibody , and - pron - deposition between endothelial cell of the glomeruli of kidney .
inflammatory response against the immune complex lead to damage and inflammation of the glomeruli ( glomerulonephritis ) .

acute otitis media
an infection of the middle ear be call acute otitis medium ( aom ) , but often - pron - be simply refer to as an earache .
the condition be most common between age three month and three year .
in the united states , aom be the second - lead cause of visit to pediatrician by child young than age five year , and - pron - be the lead indication for antibiotic prescription . [ five ]
aom be characterize by the formation and accumulation of pus in the middle ear .
unable to drain , the pus build up , result in moderate to severe bulging of the tympanic membrane and otalgia ( ear pain ) .
inflammation result from the infection lead to swell of the eustachian tube , and may also lead to fever , nausea , vomiting , and diarrhea , particularly in infant .
infant and toddler who can not yet speak may exhibit nonverbal sign suggest aom , such as hold , tug , or rubbing of the ear , as well as uncharacteristic crying or distress in response to the pain .
aom can be cause by a variety of bacteria .
among neonate , s . pneumoniae be the most common cause of aom , but escherichia coli , enterococcus spp . , and group b streptococcus specie can also be involve .
in old infant and child young than one  four year old , the most common bacterial cause be s . pneumoniae , haemophilus influenzae , or moraxella catarrhalis .
among s . pneumoniae infection , encapsulated strain be frequent cause of aom .
by contrast , the strain of h . influenzae and m . cattarhalis that be responsible for aom do not possess a capsule .
rather than direct tissue damage by these pathogen , bacterial component such as lipopolysaccharide ( lps ) in gramnegative pathogen induce an inflammatory response that cause swell , pus , and tissue damage within the middle ear ( figure two  two  .  seven ) .
any blockage of the eustachian tube , with or without infection , can cause fluid to become trap and accumulate in the middle ear .
this be refer to as otitis medium with effusion ( ome ) .
the accumulated fluid offer an excellent reservoir for microbial growth and , consequently , secondary bacterial infection often ensue .
this can lead to recur and chronic earache , which be especially common in young child .
the high incidence in child can be attribute to many factor .
child have more upper respiratory infection , in general , and - pron - eustachian tube be also short and drain at a shallower angle .
young child also tend to spend more time lie down than adult , which facilitate drainage from the nasopharynx through the eustachian tube and into the middle ear .
bottle feeding while lie down enhance this risk because the suck action on the bottle cause negative pressure to build up within the eustachian tube , promote the movement of fluid and bacteria from the nasopharynx .
diagnosis be typically make base on clinical sign and symptom , without laboratory testing to determine the specific causative agent .
antibiotic be frequently prescribe for the treatment of aom .
high - dose amoxicillin be the first - line drug , but with increase resistance concern , macrolide and cephalosporin may also be use .
the pneumococcal conjugate vaccine ( pcv one  three ) contain serotype that be important cause of aom , and vaccination have be show to decrease the incidence of aom .
vaccination against influenza have also be show to decrease the risk for aom , likely because viral infection like influenza predispose patient to secondary infection with s . pneumoniae .
although there be a conjugate vaccine available for the invasive serotype b of h . influenzae , this vaccine do not impact the incidence of h . influenzae aom .
because unencapsulated strain of h . influenzae and m . catarrhalis be involve in aom , vaccine against bacterial cellular factor other than capsule will need to be develop .

bacterial rhinosinusitis
the microbial community of the nasopharynx be extremely diverse and harbor many opportunistic pathogen , so - pron - be perhaps not surprising that infection lead to rhinitis and sinusitis have many possible cause .
these condition often occur as secondary infection after a viral infection , which effectively compromise the immune defense and allow the opportunistic bacteria to establish - pron - .
bacterial sinusitis involve infection and inflammation within the paranasal sinuse .
because bacterial sinusitis rarely occur without rhinitis , the preferred term be rhinosinusitis .
the most common cause of bacterial rhinosinusitis be similar to those for aom , include s . pneumoniae , h . influenzae , and m . catarrhalis .

diphtheria
the causative agent of diphtheria , corynebacterium diphtheriae , be a club - shape , gram - positive rod that belong to the phylum actinobacteria .
diphtheroid be common member of the normal nasopharyngeal microbiota .
however , some strain of c . diphtheriae become pathogenic because of the presence of a temperate bacteriophage - encode protein - the diphtheria toxin .
diphtheria be typically a respiratory infection of the oropharynx but can also cause impetigo - like lesion on the skin .
although the disease can affect people of all age , - pron - tend to be most severe in those young than five year or old than four  zero year .
like strep throat , diphtheria be commonly transmit in the droplet and aerosol produce by cough .
after colonize the throat , the bacterium remain in the oral cavity and begin chapter two  two 
respiratory system infections nine  six  nine produce the diphtheria toxin .
this protein be an a - b toxin that block host - cell protein synthesis by inactivate elongation factor ( ef ) -  two ( see virulence factors of bacterial and viral pathogens ) .
the toxin 's action lead to the death of the host cell and an inflammatory response .
an accumulation of grayish exudate consist of dead host cell , pu , red blood cell , fibrin , and infectious bacteria result in the formation of a pseudomembrane .
the pseudomembrane can cover mucous membrane of the nasal cavity , tonsil , pharynx , and larynx ( figure two  two  .  eight ) .
this be a classic sign of diphtheria .
as the disease progress , the pseudomembrane can enlarge to obstruct the fauce of the pharynx or trachea and can lead to suffocation and death .
sometimes , intubation , the placement of a breathing tube in the trachea , be require in advanced infection .
if the diphtheria toxin spread throughout the body , - pron - can damage other tissue as well .
this can include myocarditis ( heart damage ) and nerve damage that may impair breathing .

bacterial pneumonia pneumonia be a general term for infection of the lung that lead to inflammation and accumulation of fluid and white blood cell in the alveoli .
pneumonia can be cause by bacteria , virus , fungus , and other organism , although the vast majority of pneumonia be bacterial in origin .
bacterial pneumonia be a prevalent , potentially serious infection  - pron - cause more five  zero  ,  zero  zero  zero death in the united states in two  zero  one  four  . [ six ]
as the alveoli fill with fluid and white blood cell ( consolidation ) , air exchange become impair and patient experience respiratory distress ( figure two  two  .  nine ) .
in addition , pneumonia can lead to pleurisy , an infection of the pleural membrane surround the lung , which can make breathing very painful .
although many different bacteria can cause pneumonia under the right circumstance , three bacterial specie cause most clinical case  streptococcus pneumoniae , h . influenzae , and mycoplasma pneumoniae .
in addition to these , - pron - will also examine some of the less common cause of pneumonia .

pneumococcal pneumonia
the most common cause of community - acquire bacterial pneumonia be streptococcus pneumoniae .
this grampositive , alpha hemolytic streptococcus be commonly find as part of the normal microbiota of the human respiratory tract .
the cell tend to be somewhat lancet - shape and typically appear as pair ( figure two  two  .  one  zero ) .
the pneumococci initially colonize the bronchiole of the lung .
eventually , the infection spread to the alveoli , where the microbe 's polysaccharide capsule interfere with phagocytic clearance .
other virulence factor include autolysin like lyt a , which degrade the microbial cell wall , result in cell lysis and the release of cytoplasmic virulence factor .
one of these factor , pneumolysin o , be important in disease progression  this pore - form protein damage host cell , promote bacterial adherence , and enhance pro - inflammatory cytokine production .
the result inflammatory response cause the alveoli to fill with exudate rich in neutrophil and red blood cell .
as a consequence , infect individual develop a productive cough with bloody sputum .

why - pron - ?
tracy be a six  - year old who develop a serious cough that would not seem to go away .
after two week , - pron - parent become concerned and take - pron - to the pediatrician , who suspect a case of bacterial pneumonia .
test confirm that the cause be haemophilus influenzae .
fortunately , tracy respond well to antibiotic treatment and eventually make a full recovery .
because there have be several other case of bacterial pneumonia at tracy 's elementary school , local health official urge parent to have - pron - child screen .
of the child who be screen , - pron - be discover that great than five  zero % carry h . influenzae in - pron - nasal cavity , yet all but two of - pron - be asymptomatic .
why be - pron - that some individual become seriously ill from bacterial infection that seem to have little or no effect on other ?
the pathogenicity of an organism - - pron - ability to cause host damage - be not solely a property of the microorganism .
rather , - pron - be the product of a complex relationship between the microbe 's virulence factor and the immune defense of the individual .
preexist condition and environmental factor such as exposure to secondhand smoke can make some individual more susceptible to infection by produce condition favorable to microbial growth or compromise the immune system .
in addition , individual may have genetically determine immune factor that protect - pron - - or not - from particular strain of pathogen .
the interaction between these host factor and the pathogenicity factor produce by the microorganism ultimately determine the outcome of the infection .
a clear understanding of these interaction may allow for well identification of at - risk individual and prophylactic intervention in the future .
mycoplasma pneumonia ( walk pneumonia )
primary atypical pneumonia be cause by mycoplasma pneumoniae .
this bacterium be not part of the respiratory tract 's normal microbiota and can cause epidemic disease outbreak .
also know as walk pneumonia , mycoplasma pneumonia infection be common in crowded environment like college campus and military basis .
- pron - be spread by aerosol form when cough or sneeze .
the disease be often mild , with a low fever and persistent cough .
these bacteria , which do not have cell wall , use a specialized attachment organelle to bind to ciliated cell .
in the process , epithelial cell be damage and the proper function of the cilia be hinder ( figure two  two  .  one  two ) .

chlamydial pneumonias and psittacosis chlamydial pneumonia can be cause by three different specie of bacteria  chlamydophila pneumoniae ( formerly know as chlamydia pneumoniae ) , chlamydophila psittaci ( formerly know as chlamydia psittaci ) , and chlamydia trachomatis .
all three be obligate intracellular pathogen and cause mild to severe pneumonia and bronchitis .
of the three , chlamydophila pneumoniae be the most common and be transmit via respiratory droplet or aerosol .
c . psittaci cause psittacosis , a zoonotic disease that primarily affect domesticate bird such as parakeet , turkey , and duck , but can be transmit from bird to human .
psittacosis be a relatively rare infection and be typically find in people who work with bird .
chlamydia trachomatis , the causative agent of the sexually transmit disease chlamydia , can cause pneumonia in infant when the infection be pass from mother to baby during birth .
diagnosis of chlamydia by culture tend to be difficult and slow .
because - pron - be intracellular pathogen , - pron - require multiple passage through tissue culture .
recently , a variety of pcr - and serologically base test have be develop to enable easy identification of these pathogen .
tetracycline and macrolide antibiotic be typically prescribe for treatment .
health care - associated pneumonia
a variety of opportunistic bacteria that do not typically cause respiratory disease in healthy individual be common cause of health care - associate pneumonia .
these include klebsiella pneumoniae , staphylococcus aureus , and proteobacteria such as specie of escherichia , proteus , and serratia .
patient at risk include the elderly , those who have other preexist lung condition , and those who be immunocompromised .
in addition , patient receive supportive therapy such as intubation , antibiotic , and immunomodulatory drug may also be at risk because these intervention disrupt the mucociliary escalator and other pulmonary defense .

respiratory system infections nine  seven  five with mycobacterium tuberculosis , the causal organism of tb , with nine  .  six million new tb case and one  .  five million death worldwide in two  zero  one  four  . [ nine ] m . tuberculosis be an acid - fast , high g + c , gram - positive , nonspore - form rod .
- pron - cell wall be rich in waxy mycolic acid , which make the cell impervious to polar molecule .
- pron - also cause these organism to grow slowly .
m . tuberculosis cause a chronic granulomatous disease that can infect any area of the body , although - pron - be typically associate with the lung .
m . tuberculosis be spread by inhalation of respiratory droplet or aerosol from an infected person .
the infectious dose of m . tuberculosis be only one  zero cells . [ one  zero ]
after inhalation , the bacteria enter the alveoli ( figure two  two  .  one  three ) .
the cell be phagocytize by macrophage but can survive and multiply within these phagocyte because of the protection by the waxy mycolic acid in - pron - cell wall .
if not eliminate by macrophage , the infection can progress , cause an inflammatory response and an accumulation of neutrophil and macrophage in the area .
several week or month may pass before an immunological response be mount by t cell and b cell .
eventually , the lesion in the alveoli become wall off , form small round lesion call tubercle .
bacteria continue to be release into the center of the tubercle and the chronic immune response result in tissue damage and induction of apoptosis ( program host - cell death ) in a process call liquefaction .
this create a caseous center , or air pocket , where the aerobic m . tuberculosis can grow and multiply .
tubercle may eventually rupture and bacterial cell can invade pulmonary capillary  from there , bacteria can spread through the bloodstream to other organ , a condition know as miliary tuberculosis .
the rupture of tubercle also facilitate transmission of the bacteria to other individual via droplet aerosol that exit the body in cough .
because these droplet can be very small and stay aloft for a long time , special precaution be necessary when care for patient with tb , such as the use of face mask and negative - pressure ventilation and filtering system .
eventually , most lesion heal to form calcify ghon complex .
these structure be visible on chest radiograph and be a useful diagnostic feature .
but even after the disease have apparently end , viable bacteria remain sequestered in these location .
release of these organism at a later time can produce reactivation tuberculosis ( or secondary tb ) .
this be mainly observe in people with alcoholism , the elderly , or in otherwise immunocompromise individual ( figure two  two  .  one  three ) .

pertussis ( whooping cough )
the causative agent of pertussis , commonly call whooping cough , be bordetella pertussis , a gram - negative coccobacillus .
the disease be characterize by mucus accumulation in the lung that lead to a long period of severe coughing .
sometimes , follow a bout of coughing , a sound resemble a " whoop " be produce as air be inhale link to learn nine  seven  eight chapter two  two

respiratory system infections
this openstax book be available for free at http / / cnx . org / content / col one  two  zero  eight  seven  /  one  .  five through the inflamed and restrict airway
- hence the name whooping cough .
although adult can be infect , the symptom of this disease be most pronounced in infant and child .
pertussis be highly communicable through droplet transmission , so the uncontrollable coughing produce be an efficient mean of transmit the disease in a susceptible population .
follow inhalation , b . pertussis specifically attach to epithelial cell use an adhesin , filamentous hemagglutinin .
the bacteria then grow at the site of infection and cause disease symptom through the production of exotoxin .
one of the main virulence factor of this organism be an a - b exotoxin call the pertussis toxin ( pt ) .
when pt enter the host cell , - pron - increase the cyclic adenosine monophosphate ( camp ) level and disrupt cellular signaling .
pt be know to enhance inflammatory response involve histamine and serotonin .
in addition to pt , b . pertussis produce a tracheal cytotoxin that damage ciliate epithelial cell and result in accumulation of mucus in the lung .
the mucus can support the colonization and growth of other microbe and , as a consequence , secondary infection be common .
together , the effect of these factor produce the cough that characterize this infection .
a pertussis infection can be divide into three distinct stage .
the initial infection , term the catarrhal stage , be relatively mild and unremarkable .
the sign and symptom may include nasal congestion , a runny nose , sneeze , and a low - grade fever .
this , however , be the stage in which b . pertussis be most infectious .
in the paroxysmal stage , mucus accumulation lead to uncontrollable cough spasm that can last for several minute and frequently induce vomiting .
the paroxysmal stage can last for several week .
a long convalescence stage follow the paroxysmal stage , during which time patient experience a chronic cough that can last for up to several month .
in fact , the disease be sometimes call the one  zero  zero  - day cough .
in infant , coughing can be forceful enough to cause fracture to the rib , and prolonged infection can lead to death .
the cdc report two  zero pertussis - relate death in two  zero  one  two  , [ one  two ] but that number have decline to five by two  zero  one  five  . [ one  three ]
during the first two week of infection , laboratory diagnosis be best perform by culture the organism directly from a nasopharyngeal ( np ) specimen collect from the posterior nasopharynx .
the np speciman be streak onto bordet -
gengou medium .
the specimen must be transport to the laboratory as quickly as possible , even if transport medium be use .
transport time of long than two  four hour reduce the viability of b . pertussis significantly .
within the first month of infection , b . pertussis can be diagnose use pcr technique .
during the later stage of infection , pertussis - specific antibody can be immunologically detect use an enzyme - link immunosorbent assay ( elisa ) .
pertussis be generally a self - limit disease .
antibiotic therapy with erythromycin or tetracycline be only effective at the very early stage of disease .
antibiotic give later in the infection , and prophylactically to uninfected individual , reduce the rate of transmission .
active vaccination be a well approach to control this disease .
the dpt vaccine be once in common use in the united states .
in that vaccine , the p component consist of kill whole - cell b . pertussis preparation .
because of some adverse effect , that preparation have now be supersede by the dtap and tdap vaccine .
in both of these new vaccine , the “ ap " component be a pertussis toxoid .
widespread vaccination have greatly reduce the number of report case and prevent large epidemic of pertussis .
recently , however , pertussis have begin to reemerge as a childhood disease in some state because of decline vaccination rate and an increase population of susceptible child .

legionnaire disease
an atypical pneumonia call legionnaires disease ( also know as legionellosis ) be cause by an aerobic gramnegative bacillus , legionella pneumophila .
this bacterium infect free - living amoebae that inhabit moist environment , and infection typically occur from human - make reservoir such as air - conditioning cool tower , humidifier , misting system , and fountain .
aerosol from these reservoir can lead to infection of susceptible individual , especially those suffer from chronic heart or lung disease or other condition that weaken the immune system .
when l . pneumophila bacteria enter the alveoli , - pron - be phagocytize by resident macrophage .
however , l . pneumophila use a secretion system to insert protein in the endosomal membrane of the macrophage  these protein prevent lysosomal fusion , allow l . pneumophila to continue to proliferate within the phagosome .
the result respiratory disease can range from mild to severe pneumonia , depend on the status of the host 's immune defense .
although this disease primarily affect the lung , - pron - can also cause fever , nausea , vomiting , confusion , and other neurological effect .
diagnosis of legionnaires disease be somewhat complicated .
l . pneumophila be a fastidious bacterium and be difficult to culture .
in addition , since the bacterial cell be not efficiently stain with the gram stain , other staining technique , such as the warthin - starry silver - precipitate procedure , must be use to visualize this pathogen .
a rapid diagnostic test have be develop that detect the presence of legionella antigen in a patient 's urine  result take less than one hour , and the test have high selectivity and specificity ( great than nine  zero % ) .
unfortunately , the test only work for one serotype of l . pneumophila ( type one , the serotype responsible for most infection ) .
consequently , isolation and identification of l . pneumophila from sputum remain the defining test for diagnosis .
once diagnose , legionnaire disease can be effectively treat with fluoroquinolone and macrolide antibiotic .
however , the disease be sometimes fatal  about one  zero % of patient die of complications . [ one  four ]
there be currently no vaccine available .

q fever
the zoonotic disease q fever be cause by a rickettsia , coxiella burnetii .
the primary reservoir for this bacterium be domesticate livestock such as cattle , sheep , and goat .
the bacterium may be transmit by tick or through exposure to the urine , fece , milk , or amniotic fluid of an infect animal .
in human , the primary route of infection be through inhalation of contaminate farmyard aerosol .
- pron - be , therefore , largely an occupational disease of farmer .
human be acutely sensitive to c . burnetii - the infective dose be estimate to be just a few cells . [ one  five ]
in addition , the organism be hardy and can survive in a dry environment for an extended time .
symptom associate with acute q fever include high fever , headache , coughing , pneumonia , and general malaise .
in a small number of patient ( less than five %[ one  six ] ) , the condition may become chronic , often lead to endocarditis , which may be fatal .
diagnose rickettsial infection by cultivation in the laboratory be both difficult and hazardous because of the easy aerosolization of the bacteria , so pcr and elisa be commonly use .
doxycycline be the first - line drug to treat acute q fever .
in chronic q fever , doxycycline be often pair with hydroxychloroquine .

the common cold
the common cold be a generic term for a variety of mild viral infection of the nasal cavity .
more than two  zero  zero different virus be know to cause the common cold .
the most common group of cold virus include rhinovirus , coronaviruse , and adenovirus .
these infection be widely disseminate in the human population and be transmit through direct contact and droplet transmission .
cough and sneeze efficiently produce infectious aerosol , and rhinovirus be know to persist on environmental surface for up to a week . [ one  seven ] viral contact with the nasal mucosa or eye can lead to infection .
rhinovirus tend to replicate good between three  three ° c ( nine  one  .  four ° f ) and three  five ° c ( nine  five ° f ) , somewhat below normal body temperature ( three  seven ° c [ nine  eight  .  six ° f ] ) .
as a consequence , - pron - tend to infect the cooler tissue of the nasal cavity .
cold be mark by an irritation of the mucosa that lead to an inflammatory response .
this produce common sign and symptom such as nasal excess nasal secretion ( runny nose ) , congestion , sore throat , cough , and sneeze .
the absence of high fever be typically use to differentiate common cold from other viral infection , like influenza .
some cold may progress to cause otitis medium , pharyngitis , or laryngitis , and patient may also experience headache and body ache .
the disease , however , be self - limit and typically resolve within one – two week .
there be no effective antiviral treatment for the common cold and antibacterial drug should not be prescribe unless secondary bacterial infection have be establish .
many of the virus that cause cold be relate , so immunity develop throughout life .
give the number of virus that cause cold , however , individual be never likely to develop immunity to all cause of the common cold .

influenza commonly know as the flu , influenza be a common viral disease of the low respiratory system cause by an orthomyxovirus .
influenza be pervasive worldwide and cause three  ,  zero  zero  zero – five  zero  ,  zero  zero  zero death each year in the united states .
the annual mortality rate can vary greatly depend on the virulence of the strain ( s ) responsible for seasonal epidemic .
[ one  eight ] influenza infection be most typically characterize by fever , chill , and body ache .
this be follow by symptom similar to the common cold that may last a week or more .

in general , influenza be self - limit .
however , serious case can lead to pneumonia and other complication that can be fatal .
such case be more common in the very young and the elderly  however , certain strain of influenza virus ( like the one  nine  one  eight – one  nine  one  nine variant discuss later in this chapter ) be more lethal to young adult than to the very young or old .
strain that affect young adult be believe to involve a cytokine storm - a positive feedback loop that form between cytokine production and leukocyte .
this cytokine storm produce an acute inflammatory response that lead to rapid fluid accumulation in the lung , culminate in pulmonary failure .
in such case , the ability to mount a vigorous immune response be actually detrimental to the patient .
the very young and very old be less susceptible to this effect because - pron - immune system be less robust .
a complication of influenza that occur primarily in child and teenager be reye syndrome .
this sequela cause swell in the liver and brain , and may progress to neurological damage , coma , or death .
reye syndrome may follow other viral infection , like chickenpox , and have be associate with the use of aspirin .
for this reason , the cdc and other agency recommend that aspirin and product contain aspirin never be use to treat viral illness in child young than age one  nine years . [ one  nine ] one  eight .

the influenza virus be primarily transmit by direct contact and inhalation of aerosol .
the rna genome of this virus exist as seven or eight segment , each coat with ribonucleoprotein and encode one or two specific viral protein .
the influenza virus be surround by a lipid membrane envelope , and two of the main antigen of the influenza virus be the spike protein hemagglutinin ( h ) and neuraminidase ( n ) , as show in figure two  two  .  one  seven .
these spike protein play important role in the viral infectious cycle .
figure two  two  .  one  seven
the illustration show the structure of an influenza virus .
the viral envelope be stud with copy of the protein neuraminidase and hemagglutinin , and surround the individual seven or eight rna genome segment .
( credit  modification of work by dan higgins , centers for disease control and prevention )
follow inhalation , the influenza virus use the hemagglutinin protein to bind to sialic acid receptor on host respiratory epithelial cell .
this facilitate endocytosis of the viral particle .
once inside the host cell , the negative strand viral rna be replicate by the viral rna polymerase to form mrna , which be translate by the host to produce viral protein .
additional viral rna molecule be transcribe to produce viral genomic rna , which assemble with viral protein to form mature virion .
release of the virion from the host cell be facilitate by viral neuraminidase , which cleave sialic - acid receptor to allow progeny virus to make a clean exit when bud from an infected cell .
there be three genetically related influenza virus , call a , b , and c .
the influenza
a virus have different subtype base on the structure of - pron - hemagglutinin and neuraminidase protein .
there be currently one  eight know subtype of hemagglutinin and one  one know subtype of neuraminidase .
influenza virus be serologically characterize by the type of h and n protein that - pron - possess .
of the nearly two  zero  zero different combination of h and n , only a few , such as the h one n one strain , be associate with human disease .
the influenza viruse
a , b , and c make up three of the five major group of orthomyxovirus .
the difference between the three type of influenza be summarize in table two  two  .  three .
the most virulent group be the influenza
a virus , which cause seasonal pandemic of influenza each year .
influenza
a virus can infect a variety of animal , include pig , horse , pig , and even whale and dolphin .
influenza b virus be less virulent and be sometimes associate with epidemic outbreak .
influenza c virus generally produce the mild disease symptom and be rarely connect with epidemic .
neither influenza b virus nor influenza c virus have significant animal reservoir .

influenza virus infection elicit a strong immune response , particularly to the hemagglutinin protein , which would protect the individual if - pron - encounter the same virus .
unfortunately , the antigenic property of the virus change relatively rapidly , so new strain be evolve that immune system previously challenge by influenza virus can not recognize .
when an influenza virus gain a new hemagglutinin or neuraminidase type , - pron - be able to evade the host 's immune response and be successfully transmit , often lead to an epidemic .
there be two mechanism by which these evolutionary change may occur .
the mechanism of antigen drift and antigenic shift for influenza virus have be describe in virulence factors of bacterial and viral pathogens .
of these two genetic process , - pron - be virus produce by antigenic shift that have the potential to be extremely virulent because individual previously infect by other strain be unlikely to produce any protective immune response against these novel variant .
the most lethal influenza pandemic in record history occur from one  nine  one  eight through one  nine  one  nine .
near the end of world war i , an antigenic shift involve the recombination of avian and human virus be think to have produce a new h one n one virus .
this strain rapidly spread worldwide and be commonly claim to have kill as many as four  zero million to five  zero million people - more than double the number kill in the war .
although refer to as the spanish flu , this disease be think to have originate in the united states .
regardless of - pron - source , the condition of world war i greatly contribute to the spread of this disease .
crowd , poor sanitation , and rapid mobilization of large number of personnel and animal facilitate the dissemination of the new virus once - pron - appear .
several of the most important influenza pandemic of modern time have be associate with antigenic shift .

respiratory system infections nine  eight  nine measles ( rubeola )
the measle virus ( mev ) cause the highly contagious disease measle , also know as rubeola , which be a major cause of childhood mortality worldwide .
although vaccination effort have greatly reduce the incidence of measle in much of the world , epidemic be still common in unvaccinated population in certain countries . [ two  six ]
the measle virus be a single - strand , negative - strand rna virus and , like the influenza virus , - pron - possess an envelope with spike of embed hemagglutinin .
the infection be spread by direct contact with infectious secretion or inhalation of airborne droplet spread by breathing , coughing , or sneeze .
measles be initially characterize by a high fever , conjunctivitis , and a sore throat .
the virus then move systemically through the bloodstream and cause a characteristic rash .
the measle rash initially form on the face and later spread to the extremity .
the red , raise macular rash will eventually become confluent and can last for several day .
at the same time , extremely high fever ( high than four  zero  .  six ° c [ one  zero  five ° f ] ) can occur .
another diagnostic sign of measle infection be koplik 's spot , white spot that form on the inner lining of inflamed cheek tissue ( figure two  two  .  one  eight ) .

although measle be usually self - limit , - pron - can lead to pneumonia , encephalitis , and death .
in addition , the inhibition of immune system cell by the measle virus predispose patient to secondary infection .
in severe infection with highly virulent strain , measle fatality rate can be as high as one  zero % to one  five % .
there be more than one  four  five  ,  zero  zero  zero measle death ( mostly young child ) worldwide in two  zero  one  three  . [ two  seven ]
the preliminary diagnosis of measle be typically base on the appearance of the rash and koplik 's spot .
hemagglutination inhibition test and serological test may be use to confirm measle infection in low - prevalence setting .
there be no effective treatment for measle .
vaccination be widespread in develop country as part of the measle , mump , and rubella ( mmr ) vaccine .
as a result , there be typically few than two  zero  zero case of measle in the united states annually . [ two  eight ]
when - pron - be see , - pron - be often associate with child who have not be vaccinate .

in december two  zero  one  four , a measle epidemic begin at disneyland in southern california .
within just four month , this outbreak affect one  three  four people in two  four states . [ two  nine ] characterization of the virus suggest that an unidentified infect individual bring the disease to the united states from the philippines , where a similar virus have sicken more than five  eight  ,  zero  zero  zero people and kill one  one  zero  . [ three  zero ]
measles be highly communicable , and - pron - spread at disneyland may have be facilitate by the low vaccination rate in some community in california . [ three  one ]
several factor could conceivably lead to a strong comeback of measle in the u . s . measles be still an epidemic disease in many location worldwide .
air travel enable infect individual to rapidly translocate these infection globally .
compound this problem , low vaccination rate in some local area in the united states ( such as in amish community ) provide population of susceptible host for the virus to establish - pron - .
finally , measle have be a low - prevalence infection in the u . s . for some time .
as a consequence , physician be not as likely to recognize the initial symptom and make accurate diagnosis .
until vaccination rate become high enough to ensure herd immunity , measle be likely to be an ongoing problem in the united states .
rubella ( german measles ) rubella , or the german measle , be a relatively mild viral disease that produce a rash somewhat like that cause by the measle , even though the two disease be unrelated .
the rubella virus be an enveloped rna virus that can be find in the respiratory tract .
- pron - be transmit from person to person in aerosol produce by cough or sneeze .
nearly half of all infect people remain asymptomatic .
however , the virus be shed and spread by asymptomatic carrier .
like rubeola , rubella begin with a facial rash that spread to the extremity ( figure two  two  .  one  nine ) .
however , the rash be less intense , shorter live ( two – three day ) , not associate with koplik 's spot , and the result fever be low ( one  zero  one ° f [ three  eight  .  three ° c ] ) .
congenital rubella syndrome be the most severe clinical complication of the german measle .
this occur if a woman be infect with rubella during pregnancy .
the rubella virus be teratogenic , mean - pron - can cause developmental defect if - pron - cross the placenta during pregnancy .
there be a very high incidence of stillbirth , spontaneous abortion , or congenital birth defect if the mother be infect before one  one week of pregnancy and three  five % if - pron - be infect between week one  three – one  six  after this time the incidence be low . [ three  two ]
for this reason , prenatal screening for rubella be commonly practice in the united states .
postnatal infection be usually self - limit and rarely cause severe complication .
like measle , the preliminary diagnosis of rubella be base on the patient 's history , vaccination record , and the appearance of the rash .
the diagnosis can be confirm by hemagglutinin inhibition assay and a variety of other immunological technique .
there be no antiviral therapy for rubella , but an effective vaccine ( mmr ) be widely available .
vaccination effort have essentially eliminate rubella in the united states  few than a dozen case be report in a typical year .

chickenpox and shingles chickenpox , also know as varicella , be once a common viral childhood disease .
the causative agent of chickenpox , the varicella - zoster virus , be a member of the herpesvirus family .
in child , the disease be mild and selflimite , and be easily transmit by direct contact or inhalation of material from the skin lesion .
in adult , however , chickenpox infection can be much more severe and can lead to pneumonia and birth defect in the case of infect pregnant woman .
reye syndrome , mention earlier in this chapter , be also a serious complication associate with chickenpox , generally in child .
once infect , most individual acquire a lifetime immunity to future chickenpox outbreak .
for this reason , parent once hold “ chickenpox party " for - pron - child .
at these event , uninfected child be intentionally expose to an infected individual so - pron - would contract the disease earlier in life , when the incidence of complication be very low , rather than risk a more severe infection later .
after the initial viral exposure , chickenpox have an incubation period of about two week .
the initial infection of the respiratory tract lead to viremia and eventually produce fever and chill .
a pustular rash then develop on the face , progress to the trunk , and then the extremity , although most form on the trunk ( figure two  two  .  two  zero ) .
eventually , the lesion burst and form a crusty scab .
individual with chickenpox be infectious from about two day before the outbreak of the rash until all the lesion have scabbe over .

like other herpesviruse , the varicella - zoster virus can become dormant in nerve cell .
while the pustular vesicle be develop , the virus move along sensory nerve to the dorsal ganglia in the spinal cord .
once there , the varicella - zoster virus can remain latent for decade .
these dormant virus may be reactivate later in life by a variety of stimuli , include stress , aging , and immunosuppression .
once reactivate , the virus move along sensory nerve to the skin of the face or trunk .
this result in the production of the painful lesion in a condition know as shingle ( figure two  two  .  two  one ) .
these symptom generally last for two – six week , and may recur more than once .
postherpetic neuralgia , pain signal send from damage nerve long after the other symptom have subside , be also possible .
in addition , the virus can spread to other organ in immunocompromised individual .
a person with shingles lesion can transmit the virus to a nonimmune contact , and the newly infect individual would develop chickenpox as the primary infection .
shingle can not be transmit from one person to another .
the primary diagnosis of chickenpox in child be mainly base on the presentation of a pustular rash of the trunk .
serological and pcr - base test be available to confirm the initial diagnosis .
treatment for chickenpox infection in child be usually not require .
in patient with shingle , acyclovir treatment can often reduce the severity and length of symptom , and diminish the risk of postherpetic neuralgia .
an effective vaccine be now available for chickenpox .
a vaccine be also available for adult old than six  zero year who be infect with chickenpox in - pron - youth .
this vaccine reduce the likelihood of a shingles outbreak by boost the immune defense that be keep the latent infection in check and prevent reactivation .

smallpox stockpiles smallpox have probably kill more human than any other infectious disease , with the possible exception of tuberculosis .
this disease , cause by the variola major virus , be transmit by inhalation of viral particle shed from lesion in the throat .
the smallpox virus spread systemically in the bloodstream and produce a pustular skin rash .
historical epidemic of smallpox have fatality rate of five  zero % or great in susceptible population .
concerted worldwide vaccination effort eradicate smallpox from the general population in one  nine  seven  seven .
this be the first microbial disease in history to be eradicate , a feat make possible by the fact that the only reservoir for the smallpox virus be infect human .
although the virus be no longer present in the wild , laboratory sample of the virus still exist in the united states and russia . [ three  three ]
the question be , why do these sample still exist ?
some claim that these stock should be maintain for research purpose .
should the smallpox virus ever reappear , - pron - say , - pron - would need access to such stock for development of vaccine and treatment .
concern about a re - emergence of the virus be not totally unfounded .
although there be no live reservoir of the virus , there be always the possibility that smallpox could re - emerge from mummified human body or human remain preserve in permafrost .
- pron - be also possible that there be as - yet undiscovered sample of the virus in other location around the world .

 compare the major characteristic of specific fungal disease of the respiratory tract fungal pathogen be ubiquitous in the environment .

histoplasmosis histoplasmosis be a fungal disease of the respiratory system and most commonly occur in the mississippi valley of the united states and in part of central and south america , africa , asia , and australia .
the causative agent , histoplasma capsulatum , be a dimorphic fungus .
this microbe grow as a filamentous mold in the environment but occur as a budding yeast during human infection .
the primary reservoir for this pathogen be soil , particularly in location rich in bat or bird fece .
histoplasmosis be acquire by inhale microconidial spore in the air  this disease be not transmit from human to human .
the incidence of histoplasmosis exposure be high in endemic area , with six  zero %– nine  zero % of the population have anti - histoplasma antibody , depend on location [ three  five ] however , relatively few individual expose to the fungus actually experience symptom .
those most likely to be affect be the very young , the elderly , and immunocompromise people .
in many way , the course of this disease be similar to that of tuberculosis .
follow inhalation , the spore enter the lung and be phagocytize by alveolar macrophage .
the fungal cell then survive and multiply within these phagocyte ( see figure five  .  two  six ) .
focal infection cause the formation of granulomatous lesion , which can lead to calcification that resemble the ghon complex of tuberculosis , even in asymptomatic case .
also like tuberculosis , histoplasmosis can become chronic and reactivation can occur , along with dissemination to other area of the body ( e . g . , the liver or spleen ) .
sign and symptom of pulmonary histoplasmosis include fever , headache , and weakness with some chest discomfort .
the initial diagnosis be often base on chest radiograph and culture grow on fungal selective medium like sabouraud ' s dextrose agar .
direct fluorescence antibody staining and giemsa staining can also be use to detect this pathogen .
in addition , serological test include a complement fixation assay and histoplasmin sensitivity can be use to confirm the diagnosis .
in most case , these infection be self - limit and antifungal therapy be not require .
however , in disseminated disease , the antifungal agent amphotericin b and ketoconazole be effective  itraconazole may be effective in immunocompromised patient , in whom the disease can be more serious .

blastomycosis blastomycosis be a rare disease cause by another dimorphic fungus , blastomyce dermatitidis .
like histoplasma and coccidioides , blastomyces use the soil as a reservoir , and fungal spore can be inhale from disturbed soil .
the pulmonary form of blastomycosis generally cause mild flu - like symptom and be self - limit .
- pron - can , however , become disseminate in immunocompromised people , lead to chronic cutaneous disease with subcutaneous lesion on the face and hand ( figure two  two  .  two  five ) .
these skin lesion eventually become crusty and discolored and can result in deform scar .
systemic blastomycosis be rare , but if leave untreated , - pron - be always fatal .
preliminary diagnosis of pulmonary blastomycosis can be make by observe the characteristic budding yeast form in sputum sample .
commercially available urine antigen test be now also available .
additional confirmatory test include serological assay such as immunodiffusion test or eia .
most case of blastomycosis respond well to amphotericin b or ketoconazole treatment .

mucormycosis a variety of fungi in the order mucorales cause mucormycosis , a rare fungal disease .
these include bread mold , like rhizopus and mucor  the most commonly associate specie be rhizopus arrhizus ( oryzae ) ( see figure five  .  two  eight ) .

although most people be regularly expose to the causative agent of mucormycosis , infection in healthy individual be rare .
exposure to spore from the environment typically occur through inhalation , but the spore can also infect the skin through a wound or the gastrointestinal tract if ingest .
respiratory mucormycosis primarily affect immunocompromised individual , such as patient with cancer or those who have have a transplant . [ three  eight ]

aspergillosis aspergillus be a common filamentous fungus find in soil and organic debris .
nearly everyone have be expose to this mold , yet very few people become sick .
in immunocompromised patient , however , aspergillus may become establish and cause aspergillosis .
inhalation of spore can lead to asthma - like allergic reaction .
the symptom commonly include shortness of breath , wheeze , cough , runny nose , and headache .
fungal ball , or aspergilloma , can form when hyphal colony collect in the lung ( figure two  two  .  two  six ) .
the fungal hypha can invade the host tissue , lead to pulmonary hemorrhage and a bloody cough .
in severe case , the disease may progress to a disseminate form that be often fatal .
death most often result from pneumonia or brain hemorrhage .
laboratory diagnosis typically require chest radiograph and a microscopic examination of tissue and respiratory fluid sample .
serological test be available to identify aspergillus antigen .
in addition , a skin test can be perform to determine if the patient have be expose to the fungus .
this test be similar to the mantoux tuberculin skin test use for tuberculosis .
aspergillosis be treat with intravenous antifungal agent , include itraconazole and voriconazole .
allergic symptom can be manage with corticosteroid because these drug suppress the immune system and reduce inflammation .
however , in disseminated infection , corticosteroid must be discontinue to allow a protective immune response to occur .

pneumocystis pneumonia
a type of pneumonia call pneumocystis pneumonia ( pcp ) be cause by pneumocystis jirovecii .
once think to be a protozoan , this organism be formerly name p . carinii but - pron - have be reclassify as a fungus and rename base on biochemical and genetic analysis .
pneumocystis be a lead cause of pneumonia in patient with acquire immunodeficiency syndrome ( aids ) and can be see in other compromise patient and premature infant .
respiratory infection lead to fever , cough , and shortness of breath .
diagnosis of these infection can be difficult .
the organism be typically identify by microscopic examination of tissue and fluid sample from the lung ( figure two  two  .  two  seven ) .
a pcr - base test be available to detect p . jirovecii in asymptomatic patient with aids .
the good treatment for these infection be the combination drug trimethoprim - sulfamethoxazole ( tmp / smz ) .
these sulfa drug often have adverse effect , but the benefit outweigh these risk .
leave untreated , pcp infection be often fatal .

fungal diseases of the respiratory tract
most respiratory mycose be cause by fungi that inhabit the environment .
such infection be generally transmit via inhalation of fungal spore and can not be transmit between human .
in addition , healthy people be generally not susceptible to infection even when expose  the fungi be only virulent enough to establish infection in patient with hiv , aids , or another condition that compromise the immune defense .

this openstax book be available for free at http / / cnx . org / content / col one  two  zero  eight  seven  /  one  .  five
 air enter the upper respiratory tract through the nasal cavity and mouth , which both lead to the pharynx .
the low respiratory tract extend from the larynx into the trachea before branch into the bronchi , which divide further to form the bronchiole , which terminate in alveoli , where gas exchange occur .

the upper respiratory tract be colonize by an extensive and diverse normal microbiota , many of which be potential pathogen .
few microbial inhabitant have be find in the low respiratory tract , and these may be transient .

member of the normal microbiota may cause opportunistic infection , use a variety of strategy to overcome the innate nonspecific defense ( include the mucociliary escalator ) and adaptive specific defense of the respiratory system .
 effective vaccine be available for many common respiratory pathogen , both bacterial and viral .

most respiratory infection result in inflammation of the infect tissue  these condition be give name end in - itis , such as rhinitis , sinusitis , otitis , pharyngitis , and bronchitis .
two  two  .  two bacterial infections of the respiratory tract

a wide variety of bacteria can cause respiratory disease  most be treatable with antibiotic or preventable with vaccine .

streptococcus pyogene cause strep throat , an infection of the pharynx that also cause high fever and can lead to scarlet fever , acute rheumatic fever , and acute glomerulonephritis .

acute otitis medium be an infection of the middle ear that may be cause by several bacteria , include streptococcus pneumoniae , haemophilus influenzae , and moraxella catarrhalis .
the infection can block the eustachian tube , lead to otitis medium with effusion .
 diphtheria , cause by corynebacterium diphtheriae , be now a rare disease because of widespread vaccination .
the bacteria produce exotoxin that kill cell in the pharynx , lead to the formation of a pseudomembrane  and damage other part of the body .

bacterial pneumonia result from infection that cause inflammation and fluid accumulation in the alveoli .
- pron - be most commonly cause by s . pneumoniae or h . influenzae .
the former be commonly multidrug resistant .

mycoplasma pneumonia result from infection by mycoplasma pneumoniae  - pron - can spread quickly , but the disease be mild and self - limit .

chlamydial pneumonia can be cause by three pathogen that be obligate intracellular parasite .
chlamydophila pneumoniae be typically transmit from an infect person , whereas c . psittaci be typically transmit from an infected bird .
chlamydia trachomatis , may cause pneumonia in infant .

several other bacteria can cause pneumonia in immunocompromised individual and those with cystic fibrosis .

tuberculosis be cause by mycobacterium tuberculosis .
infection lead to the production of protective tubercle in the alveoli and calcify ghon complex that can harbor the bacteria for a long time .
antibioticresistant form be common and treatment be typically long term .

pertussis be cause by bordetella pertussis .
mucus accumulation in the lung lead to prolong severe coughing episode ( whooping cough ) that facilitate transmission .
despite an available vaccine , outbreak be still common .

legionnaires disease be cause by infection from environmental reservoir of the legionella pneumophila bacterium .
the bacterium be endocytic within macrophage and infection can lead to pneumonia , particularly among immunocompromised individual .
 q fever be cause by coxiella burnetii , whose primary host be domesticate mammal ( zoonotic disease ) .
- pron - cause pneumonia primarily in farm worker and can lead to serious complication , such as endocarditis .
two  two  .  three viral infections of the respiratory tract

viruses cause respiratory tract infection more frequently than bacteria , and most viral infection lead to mild symptom .

the common cold can be cause by more than two  zero  zero virus , typically rhinoviruse , coronaviruse , and chapter two  two
 respiratory system infections one  zero  zero  five adenovirus , transmit by direct contact , aerosol , or environmental surface .

due to - pron - ability to rapidly mutate through antigenic drift and antigenic shift , influenza remain an important threat to human health .
two new influenza vaccine be develop annually .
 several viral infection , include respiratory syncytial virus infection , which frequently occur in the very young , can begin with mild symptom before progress to viral pneumonia .
 sars and mer be acute respiratory infection cause by coronaviruse , and both appear to originate in animal .
sars have not be see in the human population since two  zero  zero  four but have a high mortality rate during - pron - outbreak .
mer also have a high mortality rate and continue to appear in human population .

measles , rubella , and chickenpox be highly contagious , systemic infection that gain entry through the respiratory system and cause rash and fever .
vaccine be available for all three .
measles be the most severe of the three and be responsible for significant mortality around the world .
chickenpox typically cause mild infection in child but the virus can reactivate to cause painful case of shingle later in life .
two  two  .  four respiratory mycoses 
fungal pathogen rarely cause respiratory disease in healthy individual , but inhalation of fungal spore can cause severe pneumonia and systemic infection in immunocompromised patient .
 antifungal drug like amphotericin b can control most fungal respiratory infection .

histoplasmosis be cause by a mold that grow in soil rich in bird or bat dropping .
few expose individual become sick , but vulnerable individual be susceptible .
the yeast - like infectious cell grow inside phagocyte .

coccidioidomycosis be also acquire from soil and , in some individual , will cause lesion on the face .
extreme case may infect other organ , cause death .

blastomycosis , a rare disease cause by a soil fungus , typically produce a mild lung infection but can become disseminated in the immunocompromised .
systemic case be fatal if untreated .

mucormycosis be a rare disease , cause by fungi of the order mucorales .
- pron - primarily affect immunocompromised people .
infection involve growth of the hypha into infected tissue and can lead to death in some case .

aspergillosis , cause by the common soil fungus aspergillus , infect immunocompromised people .
hyphal ball may impede lung function and hyphal growth into tissue can cause damage .
disseminate form can lead to death .

pneumocystis pneumonia be cause by the fungus p . jirovecii .
the disease be find in patient with aids and other immunocompromised individual .
sulfa drug treatment have side effect , but untreated case may be fatal .

cryptococcosis be cause by cryptococcus neoforman .
lung infection may move to the brain , cause meningitis , which can be fatal .

the urogenital system be a combination of the urinary tract and reproductive system .
because both system be open to the external environment , - pron - be prone to infection .
some infection be introduce from outside , whereas other result from imbalance in the microbiota of the urogenital tract .
urinary tract infection ( uti ) be one the most common bacterial infection worldwide , affect over one  zero  zero million people each year .
during two  zero  zero  seven in the united states , doctor office visit for uti exceed one  zero million , and an additional two – three million emergency department visit be attribute to uti .
sexually transmitted infection ( sti ) also primarily affect the urogenital system and be an important cause of patient morbidity .
the centers for disease control and prevention ( cdc ) estimate that there be approximately two  zero million new case of reportable sti annually in the united states , half of which occur in people age one  five – two  four year old .
when sti spread to the reproductive organ , - pron - can be associate with severe morbidity and loss of fertility .
because male and female have different urogenital anatomy , urogenital infection may affect male and female differently .
in this chapter , - pron - will discuss the various microbe that cause urogenital disease and the factor that contribute to - pron - pathogenicity .

anatomy of the urinary tract
the basic structure of the urinary tract be common in male and female .
however , there be unique location for these structure in female and male , and there be a significant amount of overlap between the urinary and genital structure in male .
figure two  three  .  two illustrate the urinary anatomy common to female and male .
the kidney carry out the urinary system 's primary function of filter the blood and maintain water and electrolyte balance .
the kidney be compose of million of filtration unit call nephron .
each nephron be in intimate contact with blood through a specialized capillary bed call the glomerulus ( plural glomeruli ) .
fluid , electrolyte , and molecule from the blood pass from the glomerulus into the nephron , create the filtrate that become urine ( figure two  three  .  three ) .
urine that collect in each kidney empty through a ureter and drain to the urinary bladder , which store urine .
urine be release from the bladder to the urethra , which transport - pron - to be excrete from the body through the urinary meatus , the opening of the urethra .

normal microbiota of the urogenital system
the normal microbiota of different body site provide an important nonspecific defense against infectious disease ( see physical defenses ) , and the urogenital tract be no exception .
in both man and woman , however , the kidney be sterile .
although urine do contain some antibacterial component , bacteria will grow in urine leave out at room temperature .
therefore , - pron - be primarily the flush action that keep the ureter and bladder free of microbe .
below the bladder , the normal microbiota of the male urogenital system be find primarily within the distal urethra and include bacterial specie that be commonly associate with the skin microbiota .
in woman , the normal microbiota be find within the distal one third of the urethra and the vagina .
the normal microbiota of the vagina become establish shortly after birth and be a complex and dynamic population of bacteria that fluctuate in response to environmental change .
member of the vaginal microbiota play an important role in the nonspecific defense against vaginal infection and sexually transmit infection by occupy cellular bind site and compete for nutrient .
in addition , the production of lactic acid by member of the microbiota provide an acidic environment within the vagina that also serve as a defense against infection .
for the majority of woman , the lactic - acid – produce bacteria in the vagina be dominate by a variety of specie of lactobacillus .
for woman who lack sufficient lactobacilli in - pron - vagina , lactic acid production come primarily from other specie of bacteria such as leptotrichia spp .
, megasphaera spp . , and atopobium vagina .
lactobacillus spp .
use glycogen from vaginal epithelial cell for metabolism and production of lactic acid .
this process be tightly regulate by the hormone estrogen .
increase level of estrogen correlate with increase level of vaginal glycogen , increase production of lactic acid , and a low vaginal ph .

general signs and symptoms of urogenital infections infections of the urinary tract most commonly cause inflammation of the bladder ( cystitis ) or of the urethra ( urethritis ) .
urethritis can be associate with cystitis , but can also be cause by sexually transmit infection .
symptom of urethritis in man include burn sensation while urinating , discharge from the penis , and blood in the seman or the urine .
in woman , urethritis be associate with painful and frequent urination , vaginal discharge , fever , chill , and abdominal pain .
the symptom of cystitis be similar to those of urethritis .
when urethritis be cause by a sexually transmit pathogen , additional symptom involve the genitalia can occur .
these can include painful vesicle ( blister ) , wart , and ulcer .
ureteritis , a rare infection of the ureter , can also occur with cystitis .
these infection can be acute or chronic .
pyelonephritis and glomerulonephriti be infection of the kidney that be potentially serious .
pyelonephritis be an infection of one or both of the kidney and may develop from a low urinary tract infection  the upper urinary tract , include the ureter , be often affect .
sign and symptom of pyelonephritis include fever , chill , nausea , vomiting , low back pain , and frequent painful urination .
pyelonephritis usually only become chronic in individual who have malformation in or damage to the kidney .
glomerulonephritis be an inflammation of the glomeruli of the nephron .
symptom include excessive protein and blood in urine , increase blood pressure , and fluid retention lead to edema of face , hand , and foot .
glomerulonephritis may be an acute infection or - pron - can become chronic .
infection occur within the reproductive structure of male include epididymitis , orchitis , and prostatitis .
bacterial infection may cause inflammation of the epididymis , call epididymitis .
this inflammation cause pain in the scrotum , testicle , and groin  swelling , redness , and warm skin in these area may also be observe .
inflammation of the testicle , call orchitis , be usually cause by a bacterial infection spread from the epididymis , but - pron - can also be a complication of mump , a viral disease .
the symptom be similar to those of epididymitis , and - pron - be not uncommon for - pron - both to occur together , in which case the condition be call epididymo - orchitis .
inflammation of the prostate gland , call prostatitis , can result from a bacterial infection .
the sign and symptom of prostatiti include fever , chill , and pain in the bladder , testicle , and penis .
patient may also experience burn during urination , difficulty empty the bladder , and painful ejaculation .
because of - pron - proximity to the exterior , the vagina be a common site for infection in woman .
the general term for any inflammation of the vagina be vaginitis .
vaginitis often develop as a result of an overgrowth of bacteria or fungi that normally reside in the vaginal microbiota , although - pron - can also result from infection by transient pathogen .
bacterial infection of the vagina be call bacterial vaginosis , whereas fungal infection ( typically involve candida spp . ) be call yeast infection .
dynamic change affect the normal microbiota , acid production , and ph variation can be involve in the initiation of the microbial overgrowth and the development of vaginitis .
although some individual may have no symptom , vaginosis and vaginitis can be associate with discharge , odor , itching , and burn .
pelvic inflammatory disease ( pid ) be an infection of the female reproductive organ include the uterus , cervix , fallopian tube , and ovary .
the two most common pathogen be the sexually transmit bacterial pathogen neisseria gonorrhoeae and chlamydia trachomatis .
inflammation of the fallopian tube , call salpingitis , be the most serious form of pid .
symptom of pid can vary between woman and include pain in the low abdomen , vaginal discharge , fever , chill , nausea , diarrhea , vomiting , and painful urination .
