strongyloidiasis strongyloidiasis be generally cause by strongyloides stercorali , a soil - transmit helminth with both free - living and parasitic form .
in the parasitic form , the larvae of these nematode generally penetrate the body through the skin , especially through bare foot , although transmission through organ transplantation or at facility like day - care center can also occur .
when excrete in the stool , larvae can become free - live adult rather than develop into the parasitic form .
these free - living worm reproduce , lay egg that hatch into larvae that can develop into the parasitic form .
in the parasitic life cycle , infective larvae enter the skin , generally through the foot .
the larvae reach the circulatory system , which allow - pron - to travel to the alveolar space of the lung .
- pron - be transport to the pharynx where , like many other helminth , the infect patient cough - pron - up and swallow - pron - again so that - pron - return to the intestine .
once - pron - reach the intestine , female live in the epithelium and produce egg that develop asexually , unlike the free - living form , which use sexual reproduction .
the larvae may be excrete in the stool or can reinfect the host by enter the tissue of the intestine and skin around the anus , which can lead to chronic infection .
the condition be generally asymptomatic , although severe symptom can develop after treatment with corticosteroid for asthma or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease , or follow other form of immunosuppression .
when the immune system be suppress , the rate of autoinfection increase , and huge amount of larvae migrate to organ chapter two  four  digestive system infections one  zero  nine  five throughout the body .
sign and symptom be generally nonspecific .
the condition can cause a rash at the site of skin entry , cough ( dry or with blood ) , fever , nausea , difficulty breathing , bloating , pain , heartburn , and , rarely , arthritis , or cardiac or kidney complication .
disseminated strongyloidiasis or hyperinfection be a life - threaten form of the disease that can occur , usually follow immunosuppression such as that cause by glucocorticoid treatment ( most commonly ) , with other immunosuppressive medication , with hiv infection , or with malnutrition .
as with other helminth , direct examination of the stool be important in diagnosis .
ideally , this should be continue over seven day .
serological testing , include antigen testing , be also available .
these can be limit by crossreaction with other similar parasite and by the inability to distinguish current from resolve infection .
ivermectin be the preferred treatment , with albendazole as a secondary option .

the liver fluke be several specie of trematode that cause disease by interfere with the bile duct .

summary two  four  .  one anatomy and normal microbiota of the digestive system

the digestive tract , consist of the oral cavity , pharynx , esophagus , stomach , small intestine , and large intestine , have a normal microbiota that be important for health .

the constant movement of material through the gastrointestinal canal , the protective layer of mucus , the normal microbiota , and the harsh chemical environment in the stomach and small intestine help to prevent colonization by pathogen .

infections or microbial toxin in the oral cavity can cause tooth decay , periodontal disease , and various type of ulcer .

infections and intoxication of the gastrointestinal tract can cause general symptom such as nausea , vomiting , diarrhea , and fever .
localized inflammation of the gi tract can result in gastritis , enteritis , gastroenteritis , hepatitis , or colitis , and damage to epithelial cell of the colon can lead to dysentery .

foodborne illness refer to infection or intoxication that originate with pathogen or toxin ingest in contaminate food or water .
two  four  .  two microbial diseases of the mouth and oral cavity 
dental carie , tartar , and gingiviti be cause by overgrowth of oral bacteria , usually streptococcus and actinomyces specie , as a result of insufficient dental hygiene .

gingivitis can worsen , allow porphyromonas , streptococcus , and actinomyces specie to spread and cause periodontitis .
when prevotella intermedia , fusobacterium specie , and treponema vicentii be involve , - pron - can lead to acute necrotizing ulcerative gingivitis .

the herpe simplex virus type one can cause lesion of the mouth and throat call herpetic gingivostomatitis .

other infection of the mouth include oral thrush , a fungal infection cause by overgrowth of candida yeast , and mump , a viral infection of the salivary gland cause by the mump virus , a paramyxovirus .

describe general sign and symptom of disease associate with infection of the circulatory and lymphatic system the circulatory and lymphatic system be network of vessel and a pump that transport blood and lymph , respectively , throughout the body .
when these system be infect with a microorganism , the network of vessel can facilitate the rapid dissemination of the microorganism to other region of the body , sometimes with serious result .
in this section , - pron - will examine some of the key anatomical feature of the circulatory and lymphatic system , as well as general sign and symptom of infection .
the circulatory system
the circulatory ( or cardiovascular ) system be a closed network of organ and vessel that move blood around the body ( figure two  five  .  two ) .
the primary purpose of the circulatory system be to deliver nutrient , immune factor , and oxygen to tissue and to carry away waste product for elimination .
the heart be a four - chambered pump that propel the blood throughout the body .
deoxygenated blood enter the right atrium through the superior vena cava and the inferior vena cava after return from the body .
the blood next pass through the tricuspid valve to enter the right ventricle .
when the heart contract , the blood from the right ventricle be pump through the pulmonary artery to the lung .
there , the blood be oxygenate at the alveoli and return to the heart through the pulmonary vein .
the oxygenated blood be receive at the left atrium and proceed through the mitral valve to the left ventricle .
when the heart contract , the oxygenated blood be pump throughout the body via a series of thick - walled vessel call artery .
the first and large artery be call the aorta .
the artery sequentially branch and decrease in size ( and be call arteriole ) until - pron - end in a network of small vessel call capillary .
the capillary bed be locate in the interstitial space within tissue and release nutrient , immune factor , and oxygen to those tissue .
the capillary connect to a series of vessel call venule , which increase in size to form the vein .
the vein join together into large vessel as - pron - transfer blood back to the heart .
the large vein , the superior and inferior vena cava , return part one barbara be a four  three  - year - old patient who have be diagnose with metastatic inflammatory breast cancer .
to facilitate - pron - ongoing chemotherapy , - pron - physician implant a port attach to a central venous catheter .
at a recent checkup , - pron - report feel restless and complain that the site of the catheter have become uncomfortable .
after remove the dressing , the physician observe that the surgical site appear red and be warm to the touch , suggest a localize infection .
barbara 's be also run a fever of three  eight  .  two ° c ( one  zero  zero  .  eight ° f ) .
- pron - physician treat the affected area with a topical antiseptic and apply a fresh dressing .
- pron - also prescribe a course of the antibiotic oxacillin .

the lymphatic system
the lymphatic system be also a network of vessel that run throughout the body ( figure two  five  .  three ) .
however , these vessel do not form a full circulating system and be not pressurize by the heart .
rather , the lymphatic system be an open system with the fluid move in one direction from the extremity toward two drainage point into vein

these fluid , term lymph , also contain large number of white blood cell .

infection of the circulatory system
under normal circumstance , the circulatory system and the blood should be sterile  the circulatory system have no normal microbiota .
because the system be closed , there be no easy portal of entry into the circulatory system for microbe .
those that be able to breach the body 's physical barrier and enter the bloodstream encounter a host of circulate immune defense , such as antibody , complement protein , phagocyte , and other immune cell .
microbe often gain access to the circulatory system through a break in the skin ( e . g . , wound , needle , intravenous catheter , insect bite ) or spread to the circulatory system from infection in other body site .
for example , microorganism cause pneumonia or renal infection may enter the local circulation of the lung or kidney and spread from there throughout the circulatory network .
if microbe in the bloodstream be not quickly eliminate , - pron - can spread rapidly throughout the body , lead to serious , even life - threaten infection .
various term be use to describe condition involve microbe in the link to learn one  one  one  six chapter two  five  circulatory and lymphatic system infections
this openstax book be available for free at http / / cnx . org / content / col one  two  zero  eight  seven  /  one  .  five circulatory system .
the term bacteremia refer to bacteria in the blood .
if bacteria be reproduce in the blood as - pron - spread , this condition be call septicemia .
the presence of virus in the blood be call viremia .
microbial toxin can also be spread through the circulatory system , cause a condition term toxemia .
microbe and microbial toxin in the blood can trigger an inflammatory response so severe that the inflammation damage host tissue and organ more than the infection - pron - .
this counterproductive immune response be call systemic inflammatory response syndrome ( sirs ) , and - pron - can lead to the life - threaten condition know as sepsis .
sepsis be characterize by the production of excess cytokine that lead to classic sign of inflammation such as fever , vasodilation , and edema ( see inflammation and fever ) .
in a patient with sepsis , the inflammatory response become dysregulated and disproportionate to the threat of infection .
critical organ such as the heart , lung , liver , and kidney become dysfunctional , result in increase heart and respiratory rate , and disorientation .
if not treat promptly and effectively , patient with sepsis can go into shock and die .
certain infection can cause inflammation in the heart and blood vessel .
inflammation of the endocardium , the inner lining of the heart , be call endocarditis and can result in damage to the heart valve severe enough to require surgical replacement .
inflammation of the pericardium , the sac surround the heart , be call pericarditis .
the term myocarditis refer to the inflammation of the heart 's muscle tissue .
pericarditis and myocarditis can cause fluid to accumulate around the heart , result in congestive heart failure .
inflammation of blood vessel be call vasculitis .
although somewhat rare , vasculitis can cause blood vessel to become damaged and rupture  as blood be release , small red or purple spot call petechiae appear on the skin .
if the damage of tissue or blood vessel be severe , - pron - can result in reduced blood flow to the surround tissue .
this condition be call ischemia , and - pron - can be very serious .
in severe case , the affect tissue can die and become necrotic  these situation may require surgical debridement or amputation .

why do the circulatory system have no normal microbiota ?

explain why the presence of microbe in the circulatory system can lead to serious consequence .
infection of the lymphatic system like the circulatory system , the lymphatic system do not have a normal microbiota , and the large number of immune cell typically eliminate transient microbe before - pron - can establish an infection .
only microbe with an array of virulence factor be able to overcome these defense and establish infection in the lymphatic system .
however , when a localize infection begin to spread , the lymphatic system be often the first place the invade microbe can be detect .
infection in the lymphatic system also trigger an inflammatory response .
inflammation of lymphatic vessel , call lymphangitis , can produce visible red streak under the skin .
inflammation in the lymph node can cause - pron - to swell .
a swollen lymph node be refer to as a bubo , and the condition be refer to as lymphadenitis .
two  five  .  two bacterial infections of the circulatory and lymphatic systems learning objectives
 identify and compare bacteria that most commonly cause infection of the circulatory and lymphatic system  compare the major characteristic of specific bacterial disease affect the circulatory and lymphatic system
bacteria can enter the circulatory and lymphatic system through acute infection or breach of the skin barrier or chapter two  five  circulatory and lymphatic system infections one  one  one  seven mucosa .
breach may occur through fairly common occurrence , such as insect bite or small wound .
even the act of tooth brushing , which can cause small rupture in the gum , may introduce bacteria into the circulatory system .
in most case , the bacteremia that result from such common exposure be transient and remain below the threshold of detection .
in severe case , bacteremia can lead to septicemia with dangerous complication such as toxemia , sepsis , and septic shock .
in these situation , - pron - be often the immune response to the infection that result in the clinical sign and symptom rather than the microbe - pron - .
bacterial sepsis , septic and toxic shock
at low concentration , pro - inflammatory cytokine such as interleukin one ( il -  one ) and tumor necrosis factor - α ( tnf - α ) play important role in the host 's immune defense .
when - pron - circulate systemically in large amount , however , the result immune response can be life threaten .
il -  one induce vasodilation ( widen of blood vessel ) and reduce the tight junction between vascular endothelial cell , lead to widespread edema .
as fluid move out of circulation into tissue , blood pressure begin to drop .
if leave unchecked , the blood pressure can fall below the level necessary to maintain proper kidney and respiratory function , a condition know as septic shock .
in addition , the excessive release of cytokine during the inflammatory response can lead to the formation of blood clot .
the loss of blood pressure and occurrence of blood clot can result in multiple organ failure and death .
bacteria be the most common pathogen associate with the development of sepsis , and septic shock . [ three ]
the most common infection associate with sepsis be bacterial pneumonia ( see bacterial infections of the respiratory tract ) , account for about half of all case , follow by intra - abdominal infection ( bacterial infections of the gastrointestinal tract ) and urinary tract infection ( bacterial infections of the urinary system ) . [ four ] infections associate with superficial wound , animal bite , and indwell catheter may also lead to sepsis and septic shock .
these initially minor , localized infection can be cause by a wide range of different bacteria , include staphylococcus , streptococcus , pseudomonas , pasteurella , acinetobacter , and member of the enterobacteriaceae .
however , if leave untreated , infection by these gram - positive and gram - negative pathogen can potentially progress to sepsis , shock , and death .
toxic shock syndrome and streptococcal toxic shock - like syndrome toxemia associate with infection cause by staphylococcus aureus can cause staphylococcal toxic shock syndrome ( tss ) .
some strain of s . aureus produce a superantigen call toxic shock syndrome toxin -  one ( tsst -  one ) .
tss may occur as a complication of other localized or systemic infection such as pneumonia , osteomyelitis , sinusitis , and skin wound ( surgical , traumatic , or burn ) .
those at high risk for staphylococcal tss be woman with preexist s . aureus colonization of the vagina who leave tampon , contraceptive sponge , diaphragms , or other device in the vagina for long than the recommend time .
staphylococcal tss be characterize by sudden onset of vomiting , diarrhea , myalgia , body temperature high than three  eight  .  nine ° c ( one  zero  two  .  zero ° f ) , and rapid - onset hypotension with a systolic blood pressure less than nine  zero mm hg for adult  a diffuse erythematous rash that lead to peel and shed skin one to two week after onset  and additional involvement of three or more organ systems . [ five ]
the mortality rate associate with staphylococcal tss be less than three % of case .
diagnosis of staphylococcal tss be base on clinical sign , symptom , serologic test to confirm bacterial specie , and the detection of toxin production from staphylococcal isolate .
culture of skin and blood be often negative  less than five % be positive in case of staphylococcal tss .
treatment for staphylococcal tss include decontamination , debridement , vasopressor to elevate blood pressure , and antibiotic therapy with clindamycin plus vancomycin or daptomycin pende susceptibility result .

puerperal sepsis a type of sepsis call puerperal sepsis , also know as puerperal infection , puerperal fever , or childbe fever , be a nosocomial infection associate with the period of puerperium - the time follow childbirth during which the mother 's reproductive system return to a nonpregnant state .
such infection may originate in the genital tract , breast , urinary tract , or a surgical wound .
initially the infection may be limit to the uterus or other local site of infection , but - pron - can quickly spread , result in peritonitis , septicemia , and death .
before the one  nine th century work of ignaz semmelweis and the widespread acceptance of germ theory ( see modern foundations of cell theory ) , puerperal sepsis be a major cause of mortality among new mother in the first few day follow childbirth .
puerperal sepsis be often associate with streptococcus pyogene , but numerous other bacteria can also be responsible .
example include gram - positive bacterial ( e . g . streptococcus spp .
, staphylococcus spp . , and enterococcus spp . ) , gram - negative bacteria ( e . g . chlamydia spp . , escherichia coli
, klebsiella spp . , and proteus spp . ) , as well as anaerobe such as peptostreptococcus spp .
, bacteroides spp . , and clostridium spp .

diagnosis of puerperal fever be base on the timing and extent of fever and isolation , and identification of the etiologic agent in blood , wound , or urine specimen .
because there be numerous possible cause , antimicrobial susceptibility testing must be use to determine the good antibiotic for treatment .
nosocomial incidence of puerperal fever can be greatly reduce through the use of antiseptic during delivery and strict adherence to handwash protocol by doctor , midwife , and nurse .
infectious arthritis also call septic arthritis , infectious arthritis can be either an acute or a chronic condition .
infectious arthritis be characterize by inflammation of joint tissue and be most often cause by bacterial pathogen .
most case of acute infectious arthritis be secondary to bacteremia , with a rapid onset of moderate to severe joint pain and swell that limit the motion of the affect joint .
in adult and young child , the infective pathogen be most often introduce directly through injury , such as a wound or a surgical site , and bring to the joint through the circulatory system .
acute infection may also occur after joint replacement surgery .
acute infectious arthritis often occur in patient with an immune system impair by other viral and bacterial infection .
s . aureus be the most common cause of acute septic arthritis in the general population of adult and young child .
neisseria gonorrhoeae be an important cause of acute infectious arthritis in sexually active individual .
chronic infectious arthritis be responsible for five % of all infectious arthritis case and be more likely to occur in patient with other illness or condition .
patient at risk include those who have an hiv infection , a bacterial or fungal infection , prosthetic joint , rheumatoid arthritis ( ra ) , or who be undergo immunosuppressive chemotherapy .
onset be often in a single joint  there may be little or no pain , ache pain that may be mild , gradual swelling , mild warmth , and minimal or no redness of the joint area .
diagnosis of infectious arthritis require the aspiration of a small quantity of synovial fluid from the afflict joint .
direct microscopic evaluation , culture , antimicrobial susceptibility testing , and polymerase chain reaction ( pcr ) analyse of the synovial fluid be use to identify the potential pathogen .
typical treatment include administration of appropriate antimicrobial drug base on antimicrobial susceptibility testing .
for nondrug - resistant bacterial strain , β - lactam such as oxacillin and cefazolin be often prescribe for staphylococcal infection .
third - generation cephalosporin ( e . g . , ceftriaxone ) be use for increasingly prevalent β - lactam - resistant neisseria infection .
infection by mycobacterium spp .
or fungi be treat with appropriate long - term antimicrobial therapy .
even with treatment , the prognosis be often poor for those infect .
about four  zero % of patient with nongonnococcal infectious arthritis will suffer permanent joint damage and mortality rate range from five % to two  zero % . [ seven ] mortality rate be high among the elderly . [ eight ]
osteomyelitis osteomyelitis be an inflammation of bone tissue most commonly cause by infection .
these infection can either be acute or chronic and can involve a variety of different bacteria .
the most common causative agent of osteomyelitis be s . aureus .
however , m . tuberculosis , pseudomonas aeruginosa , streptococcus pyogene , s . agalactiae , specie in the enterobacteriaceae , and other microorganism can also cause osteomyelitis , depend on which bone be involve .
in adult , bacteria usually gain direct access to the bone tissue through trauma or a surgical procedure involve prosthetic joint .
in child , the bacteria be often introduce from the bloodstream , possibly spread from focal infection .
the long bone , such as the femur , be more commonly affect in child because of the more extensive vascularization of bone in the young . [ nine ]
the sign and symptom of osteomyelitis include fever , localize pain , swell due to edema , and ulcer in soft seven .

the result inflammation can lead to tissue damage and bone loss .
in addition , the infection may spread to joint , result in infectious arthritis , or disseminate into the blood , result in sepsis and thrombosis ( formation of blood clot ) .

what bacterium the most common cause of both septic arthritis and osteomyelitis ?
rheumatic fever infections with s . pyogene have a variety of manifestation and complication generally call sequelae .
as mention , the bacterium can cause suppurative infection like puerperal fever .
however , this microbe can also cause nonsuppurative sequelae in the form of acute rheumatic fever ( arf ) , which can lead to rheumatic heart disease , thus impact the circulatory system .
rheumatic fever occur primarily in child a minimum of two – three week after an episode of untreated or inadequately treat pharyngitis ( see bacterial infections of the respiratory tract ) .
at one time , rheumatic fever be a major killer of child in the us  today , however , - pron - be rare in the us because of early diagnosis and treatment of streptococcal pharyngitis with antibiotic .
in part of the world where diagnosis and treatment be not readily available , acute rheumatic fever and rheumatic heart disease be still major cause of mortality in children . [ one  zero ] rheumatic fever be characterize by a variety of diagnostic sign and symptom cause by nonsuppurative , immunemediated damage result from a cross - reaction between patient antibody to bacterial surface protein and similar protein find on cardiac , neuronal , and synovial tissue .
damage to the nervous tissue or joint , which lead to joint pain and swelling , be reversible .
however , damage to heart valve can be irreversible and be worsen by repeat episode of acute rheumatic fever , particularly during the first three – five year after the first rheumatic fever attack .
the inflammation of the heart valve cause by cross - reacting antibody lead to scarring and stiffness of the valve leaflet .
this , in turn , produce a characteristic heart murmur .
patient who have previously develop rheumatic fever and who subsequently develop recurrent pharyngitis due to s . pyogene be at high risk for a recurrent attack of rheumatic fever .
the american heart association recommends[ one  one ] a treatment regiman consist of benzathine benzylpenicillin every three or four week , depend on the patient 's risk for reinfection .
additional prophylactic antibiotic treatment may be recommend depend on the age of the patient and risk for reinfection .

chapter two  five  circulatory and lymphatic system infections one  one  two  one bacterial endocarditis and pericarditis
the endocardium be a tissue layer that line the muscle and valve of the heart .
this tissue can become infect by a variety of bacteria , include gram - positive cocci such as staphylococcus aureus , viridan streptococci , and enterococcus faecalis , and the gram - negative so - call hacek bacilli 
haemophilus spp .
, actinobacillus actinomycetemcomitan , cardiobacterium homini , eikenella corroden , and kingella kingae .
the result inflammation be call endocarditis , which can be describe as either acute or subacute .
causative agent typically enter the bloodstream during accidental or intentional breach in the normal barrier defense ( e . g . , dental procedure , body piercing , catheterization , wound ) .
individual with preexist heart damage , prosthetic valve and other cardiac device , and those with a history of rheumatic fever have a high risk for endocarditis .
this disease can rapidly destroy the heart valve and , if untreated , lead to death in just a few day .
in subacute bacterial endocarditis , heart valve damage occur slowly over a period of month .
during this time , blood clot form in the heart , and these protect the bacteria from phagocyte .
these patch of tissue - associate bacteria be call vegetation .
the result damage to the heart , in part result from the immune response cause fibrosis of heart valve , can necessitate heart valve replacement ( figure two  five  .  six ) .
outward sign of subacute endocarditis may include a fever .
diagnosis of infective endocarditis be determine use the combination of blood culture , echocardiogram , and clinical symptom .
in both acute and subacute endocarditis , treatment typically involve relatively high dos of intravenous antibiotic as determine by antimicrobial susceptibility testing .
acute endocarditis be often treat with a combination of ampicillin , nafcillin , and gentamicin for synergistic coverage of staphylococcus spp .
and streptococcus spp .
prosthetic - valve endocarditis be often treat with a combination of vancomycin , rifampin , and gentamicin .
rifampin be necessary to treat individual with infection of prosthetic valve or other foreign body because rifampin can penetrate the biofilm of most of the pathogen that infect these device .
staphylcoccus spp .
and streptococcus spp .
can also infect and cause inflammation in the tissue surround the heart , a condition call acute pericarditis .
pericarditis be mark by chest pain , difficulty breathing , and a dry cough .
in most case , pericarditis be self - limit and clinical intervention be not necessary .
diagnosis be make with the aid of a chest radiograph , electrocardiogram , echocardiogram , aspirate of pericardial fluid , or biopsy of pericardium .
antibacterial medication may be prescribe for infection associate with pericarditis  however , pericarditis can also be cause other pathogen , include virus ( e . g . , echovirus , influenza virus ) , fungi ( e . g . , histoplasma spp .
, coccidioides spp . ) , and eukaryotic parasite ( e . g . , toxoplasma spp . ) .

bacterial vegetation be visible on the valve tissue .

gas gangrene
traumatic injury or certain medical condition , such as diabetes , can cause damage to blood vessel that interrupt blood flow to a region of the body .
when blood flow be interrupt , tissue begin to die , create an anaerobic environment in which anaerobic bacteria can thrive .
this condition be call ischemia .
endospore of the anaerobic bacterium clostridium perfringen ( along with a number of other clostridium spp .
from the gut ) can readily germinate in ischemic tissue and colonize the anaerobic tissue .
the result infection , call gas gangrene , be characterize by rapidly spread myonecrosis ( death of muscle tissue ) .
the patient experience a sudden onset of excruciate pain at the infection site and the rapid development of a foul - smell wound contain gas bubble and a thin , yellowish discharge tinge with a small amount of blood .
as the infection progress , edema and cutaneous blister contain bluish - purple fluid form .
the infected tissue become liquefy and begin slough off .
the margin between necrotic and healthy tissue often advance several inch per hour even with antibiotic therapy .
septic shock and organ failure frequently accompany gas gangrene  when patient develop sepsis , the mortality rate be great than five  zero % .
α - toxin and theta ( θ ) toxin be the major virulence factor of c . perfringen implicate in gas gangrene .
α
- toxin be a lipase responsible for break down cell membrane  - pron - also cause the formation of thrombi ( blood clot ) in blood vessel , contribute to the spread of ischemia .
θ
- toxin form pore in the patient 's cell membrane , cause cell lysis .
the gas associate with gas gangrene be produce by clostridium 's fermentation of butyric acid , which produce hydrogen and carbon dioxide that be release as the bacteria multiply , form pocket of gas in tissue ( figure two  five  .  seven ) .
gas gangrene be initially diagnose base on the presence of the clinical sign and symptom describe earlier in this section .
diagnosis can be confirm through gram stain and anaerobic cultivation of wound exudate ( drainage ) and tissue sample on blood agar .
treatment typically involve surgical debridement of any necrotic tissue  advanced case may require amputation .
surgeon may also use vacuum - assist closure ( vac ) , a surgical technique in which vacuum - assist drainage be use to remove blood or serous fluid from a wound or surgical site to speed recovery .
the most common antibiotic treatment include penicillin g and clindamycin .
some case be also treat with hyperbaric oxygen therapy because clostridium spp .
be incapable of survive in oxygen - rich environment .

a radiograph of the arm show a darkening in the tissue , which indicate the presence of gas .

system infections one  one  two  three tularemia infection with the gram - negative bacterium francisella tularensis cause tularemia ( or rabbit fever ) , a zoonotic infection in human .
f . tularensis be a facultative intracellular parasite that primarily cause illness in rabbit , although a wide variety of domesticate animal be also susceptible to infection .
human can be infect through ingestion of contaminate meat or , more typically , handling of infect animal tissue ( e . g . , skin an infect rabbit ) .
tularemia can also be transmit by the bite of infect arthropod , include the dog tick ( dermacentor variabilis ) , the lone star tick ( amblyomma americanum ) , the wood tick ( dermacentor andersoni ) , and deer fly ( chrysops spp . ) .
although the disease be not directly communicable between human , exposure to aerosol of f . tularensis can result in life - threaten infection .
f . tularensis be highly contagious , with an infectious dose of as few as one  zero bacterial cell .
in addition , pulmonary infection have a three  zero %– six  zero % fatality rate if untreated . [ one  two ]
for these reason , f . tularensis be currently classify and must be handle as a biosafety level -  three ( bsl -  three ) organism and as a potential biological warfare agent .
follow introduction through a break in the skin , the bacteria initially move to the lymph node , where - pron - be ingest by phagocyte .
after escape from the phagosome , the bacteria grow and multiply intracellularly in the cytoplasm of phagocyte .
- pron - can later become disseminate through the blood to other organ such as the liver , lung , and spleen , where - pron - produce mass of tissue call granuloma ( figure two  five  .  eight ) .
after an incubation period of about three day , skin lesion develop at the site of infection .
other sign and symptom include fever , chill , headache , and swollen and painful lymph node .

a skin lesion appear at the site of infection on the hand of an individual infect with francisella tularensis .
( b )
a scan electron micrograph show the coccobacilli cell ( blue ) of f . tularensis .

a direct diagnosis of tularemia be challenging because - pron - be so contagious .
once a presumptive diagnosis of tularemia be make , special handling be require to collect and process patient ' specimen to prevent the infection of healthcare worker .
specimen suspect of contain f . tularensis can only be handle by bsl -  two or bsl -  three laboratory register with the federal select agent program , and individual handle the speciman must wear protective equipment and use a class ii biological safety cabinet .
tularemia be relatively rare in the us , and - pron - sign and symptom be similar to a variety of other infection that may need to be rule out before a diagnosis can be make .
direct fluorescent - antibody ( dfa ) microscopic examination use antibody specific for f . tularensis can rapidly confirm the presence of this pathogen .
culture this microbe be difficult because of - pron - requirement for the amino acid cysteine , which must be supply as an extra nutrient in culture medium .
serological test be available to detect an immune response against the bacterial pathogen .
in patient with suspect infection , acute - and convalescent - phase serum sample be require to confirm an active one  two .

brucellosis species in the genus
brucella be gram - negative facultative intracellular pathogen that appear as coccobacilli .
several specie cause zoonotic infection in animal and human , four of which have significant human pathogenicity  b . abortus from cattle and buffalo , b . cani from dog , b . suis from swine , and b . melitensis from goat , sheep , and camel .
infection by these pathogen be call brucellosis , also know as undulant fever ,
“ mediterranean fever , " or “ malta fever .
”
vaccination of animal have make brucellosis a rare disease in the us , but - pron - be still common in the mediterranean , south and central asia , central and south america , and the caribbean .
human infection be primarily associate with the ingestion of meat or unpasteurized dairy product from infected animal .
infection can also occur through inhalation of bacteria in aerosol when handle animal product , or through direct contact with skin wound .
in the us , most case of brucellosis be find in individual with extensive exposure to potentially infect animal ( e . g . , slaughterhouse worker , veterinarian ) .
two important virulence factor produce by brucella spp . be urease , which allow ingested bacteria to avoid destruction by stomach acid , and lipopolysaccharide ( lps ) , which allow the bacteria to survive within phagocyte .
after gain entry to tissue , the bacteria be phagocytize by host neutrophil and macrophage .
the bacteria then escape from the phagosome and grow within the cytoplasm of the cell .
bacteria phagocytize by macrophage be disseminate throughout the body .
this result in the formation of granuloma within many body site , include bone , liver , spleen , lung , genitourinary tract , brain , heart , eye , and skin .
acute infection can result in undulant ( relapse ) fever , but untreated infection develop into chronic disease that usually manifest as acute febrile illness ( fever of four  zero – four  one ° c [ one  zero  four – one  zero  five  .  eight ° f ] ) with recur flu - like sign and symptom .
brucella be only reliably find in the blood during the acute fever stage  - pron - be difficult to diagnose by cultivation .
in addition , brucella be consider a bsl -  three pathogen and be hazardous to handle in the clinical laboratory without protective clothing and at least a class ii biological safety cabinet .
agglutination test be most often use for serodiagnosis .
in addition , enzyme - link immunosorbent assay ( elisas ) be available to determine exposure to the organism .
the antibiotic doxycycline or ciprofloxacin be typically prescribe in combination with rifampin  gentamicin , streptomycin , and trimethoprim - sulfamethoxazole ( tmp - smz ) be also effective against brucella infection and can be use if need .

cat - scratch disease
the zoonosis cat - scratch disease ( csd ) ( or cat - scratch fever ) be a bacterial infection that can be introduce to the lymph node when a human be bite or scratch by a cat .
- pron - be cause by the facultative intracellular gram - negative bacterium bartonella henselae .
cat can become infected from flea fece contain b . henselae that - pron - ingest while grooming .
human become infected when flea fece or cat saliva ( from claws or licking ) contain b . henselae be introduce at the site of a bite or scratch .
once introduce into a wound , b . henselae infect red blood cell .
b . henselae invasion of red blood cell be facilitate by adhesin associate with outer membrane protein and a secretion system that mediate transport of virulence factor into the host cell .
evidence of infection be indicate if a small nodule with pus form in the location of the scratch one to three week after the initial injury .
the bacteria then migrate to the near lymph node , where - pron - cause swell and pain .
sign and symptom may also include fever , chill , and fatigue .
most infection be mild and tend to be self - limit .
however , immunocompromised patient may chapter two  five  circulatory and lymphatic
system infections one  one  two  five develop bacillary angiomatosis ( ba ) , characterize by the proliferation of blood vessel , result in the formation of tumor - like mass in the skin and internal organ  or bacillary peliosis ( bp ) , characterize by multiple cyst - like , blood - fill cavity in the liver and spleen .
most case of csd can be prevent by keep cat free of flea and promptly clean a cat scratch with soap and warm water .
the diagnosis of csd be difficult because the bacterium do not grow readily in the laboratory .
when necessary , immunofluorescence , serological test , pcr , and gene sequencing can be perform to identify the bacterial specie .
give the limited nature of these infection , antibiotic be not normally prescribe .
for immunocompromised patient , rifampin , azithromycin , ciprofloxacin , gentamicin ( intramuscularly ) , or tmp - smz be generally the most effective option .
rat - bite fever
the zoonotic infection rat - bite fever can be cause by two different gram - negative bacteria  streptobacillus moniliformi , which be more common in north america , and spirillum minor , which be more common in asia .
because of modern sanitation effort , rat bite be rare in the us .
however , contact with fomite , food , or water contaminate by rat fece or body fluid can also cause infection .
sign and symptom of rat - bite fever include fever , vomiting , myalgia ( muscle pain ) , arthralgia ( joint pain ) , and a maculopapular rash on the hand and foot .
an ulcer may also form at the site of a bite , along with some swelling of nearby lymph node .
in most case , the infection be self - limit .
little be know about the virulence factor that contribute to these sign and symptom of disease .
cell culture , maldi - tof mass spectrometry , pcr , or elisa can be use in the identification of streptobacillus moniliformi .
the diagnosis spirillum minor may be confirm by direct microscopic observation of the pathogen in blood use giemsa or wright stain , or darkfield microscopy .
serological test can be use to detect a host immune response to the pathogen after about one  zero day .
the most commonly use antibiotic to treat these infection be penicillin or doxycycline .
plague the gram - negative bacillus yersinia pestis cause the zoonotic infection plague .
this bacterium cause acute febrile disease in animal , usually rodent or other small mammal , and human .
the disease be associate with a high mortality rate if leave untreated .
historically , y . pestis have be responsible for several devastating pandemic , result in million of death ( see micro connections  the history of the plague ) .
there be three form of plague  bubonic plague ( the most common form , account for about eight  zero % of case ) , pneumonic plague , and septicemic plague .
these form be differentiate by the mode of transmission and the initial site of infection .
figure two  five  .  nine illustrate these various mode of transmission and infection between animal and human .
in bubonic plague , y . pestis be transfer by the bite of infect flea .
since most flea bite occur on the leg and ankle , y . pestis be often introduce into the tissue and blood circulation in the low extremity .
after a two  - to six  - day incubation period , patient experience an abrupt onset fever ( three  nine  .  five – four  one ° c [ one  zero  three  .  one – one  zero  five  .  eight ° f ] ) , headache , hypotension , and chill .
the pathogen localize in lymph node , where - pron - cause inflammation , swelling , and hemorrhage that result in purple bubo ( figure two  five  .  one  zero ) .
bubo often form in lymph node of the groin first because these be the node associate with the low limb  eventually , through circulation in the blood and lymph , lymph node throughout the body become infected and form bubo .
the average mortality rate for bubonic plague be about five  five % if untreated and about one  zero % with antibiotic treatment .
septicemic plague occur when y . pestis be directly introduce into the bloodstream through a cut or wound and circulate through the body .
the incubation period for septicemic plague be one to three day , after which patient develop fever , chill , extreme weakness , abdominal pain , and shock .
disseminate intravascular coagulation ( dic ) can also occur , result in the formation of thrombi that obstruct blood vessel and promote ischemia and necrosis in surround tissue ( figure two  five  .  one  zero ) .
necrosis occur most commonly in extremity such as finger and toe , which become blacken .
septicemic plague can quickly lead to death , with a mortality rate near one  zero  zero % when - pron - be untreated .
even with antibiotic treatment , the mortality rate be about five  zero % .
pneumonic plague occur when y . pestis cause an infection of the lung .
this can occur through inhalation of one  one  two  six chapter two  five  circulatory and lymphatic system infections
this openstax book be available for free at http / / cnx . org / content / col one  two  zero  eight  seven  /  one  .  five aerosolized droplet from an infected individual or when the infection spread to the lung from elsewhere in the body in patient with bubonic or septicemic plague .
after an incubation period of one to three day , sign and symptom include fever , headache , weakness , and a rapidly develop pneumonia with shortness of breath , chest pain , and cough produce bloody or watery mucus .
the pneumonia may result in rapid respiratory failure and shock .
pneumonic plague be the only form of plague that can be spread from person to person by infectious aerosol droplet .
if untreated , the mortality rate be near one  zero  zero %  with antibiotic treatment , the mortality rate be about five  zero % .
figure two  five  .  nine yersinia pestis , the causative agent of plague , have numerous mode of transmission .
the mode be divide into two ecological class  urban and sylvatic ( i . e . , forest or rural ) .
the urban cycle primarily involve transmission from infected urban mammal ( rat ) to human by flea vector ( brown arrow ) .
the disease may travel between urban center ( purple arrow ) if infect rat find - pron - way onto ship or train .
the sylvatic cycle involve mammal more common in nonurban environment .
sylvatic bird and mammal ( include human ) may become infected after eat infect mammal ( pink arrow ) or by flea vector .
pneumonic transmission occur between human or between human and infected animal through the inhalation of y . pestis in aerosol .

the high mortality rate for the plague be , in part , a consequence of - pron - be unusually well equip with virulence factor .
to date , there be at least one  five different major virulence factor that have be identify from y . pestis and , of these , eight be involve with adherence to host cell .
in addition , the f one component of the y . pestis capsule be a virulence factor that allow the bacterium to avoid phagocytosis .
f one be produce in large quantity during mammalian infection and be the most immunogenic component . [ one  three ] successful use of virulence factor allow the bacilli to disseminate from the area of the bite to regional lymph node and eventually the entire blood and lymphatic system .
culturing and direct microscopic examination of a sample of fluid from a bubo , blood , or sputum be the good way to identify y . pestis and confirm a presumptive diagnosis of plague .
specimen may be stain use either a gram , giemsa , wright , or wayson ' s staining technique ( figure two  five  .  one  one ) .

the confirmatory method for identify y . pestis isolate in the us be bacteriophage lysis .
prompt antibiotic therapy can resolve most case of bubonic plague , but septicemic and pneumonic plague be more difficult to treat because of - pron - short incubation stage .
survival often depend on an early and accurate diagnosis and an appropriate choice of antibiotic therapy .
in the us , the most common antibiotic use to treat patient with plague be gentamicin , fluoroquinolone , streptomycin , levofloxacin , ciprofloxacin , and doxycycline .

the history of the plague
the first record pandemic of plague , the justinian plague , occur in the sixth century ce .
- pron - be think to have originate in central africa and spread to the mediterranean through trade route .
at - pron - peak , more than five  ,  zero  zero  zero people die per day in constantinople alone .
ultimately , one - third of that city 's population succumb to plague . [ one  four ]
the impact of this outbreak probably contribute to the later fall of emperor justinian .
the second major pandemic , dub the black death , occur during the one  four th century .
this time , the infection be think to have originate somewhere in asia before be transport to europe by trade , soldier , and war refugee .
this outbreak kill an estimate one - quarter of the population of europe ( two  five million , primarily in major city ) .
in addition , at least another two  five million be think to have be kill in asia and africa . [ one  five ]
this second pandemic , associate with strain yersinia pestis biovar medievalis , cycle for another three  zero  zero year in europe and great britain , and be call the great plague in the one  six  six  zero .
the most recent pandemic occur in the one  eight  nine  zero s with yersinia pestis biovar orientalis .
this outbreak originate in the yunnan province of china and spread worldwide through trade .
- pron - be at this time that plague make - pron - way to the us .
the etiologic agent of plague be discover by alexandre yersin ( one  eight  six  three – one  nine  four  three ) during this outbreak as well .
the overall number of death be low than in prior outbreak , perhaps because of improve sanitation and medical support . [ one  six ] most of the death attribute to this final pandemic occur in india .

zoonotic febrile diseases
a wide variety of zoonotic febrile disease ( disease that cause fever ) be cause by pathogenic bacteria that require arthropod vector .
these pathogen be either obligate intracellular specie of anaplasma , bartonella , ehrlichia , orientia , and rickettsia , or spirochete in the genus borrelia .
isolation and identification of pathogen in this group be best perform in bsl -  three laboratory because of the low infective dose associate with the disease .
anaplasmosis
the zoonotic tickborne disease human granulocytic anaplasmosis ( hga ) be cause by the obligate intracellular pathogen anaplasma phagocytophilum .
hga be endemic primarily in the central and northeastern us and in country in europe and asia .
hga be usually a mild febrile disease that cause flu - like symptom in immunocompetent patient  however , symptom be severe enough to require hospitalization in at least five  zero % of infection and , of those patient , less than one % will die of hga . [ one  seven ]
small mammal such as white - footed mouse , chipmunk , and vole have be identify as reservoir of a . phagocytophilum , which be transmit by the bite of an ixodes tick .
five major virulence factors[ one  eight ] have be report in anaplasma  three be adherence factor and two be factor that allow the pathogen to avoid the human immune response .
diagnostic approach include locate intracellular microcolonie of anaplasma through microscopic examination of neutrophil or eosinophil stain with giemsa or wright stain , pcr for detection of a . phagocytophilum , and serological test to detect antibody titer against the pathogen .
the primary antibiotic use for treatment be doxycycline .
ehrlichiosis human monocytotropic ehrlichiosis ( hme ) be a zoonotic tickborne disease cause by the bsl -  two , obligate intracellular pathogen ehrlichia chaffeensis .
currently , the geographic distribution of hme be primarily the eastern half of the us , with a few case report in the west , which correspond with the known geographic distribution of the primary vector , the lone star tick ( amblyomma americanum ) .
symptom of hme be similar to the flu - like symptom observe in anaplasmosis , but a rash be more common , with six  zero % of child and less than three  zero % of adult develop petechial , macula , and maculopapular
rashes . [ one  nine ]
virulence factor allow e . chaffeensis to adhere to and infect monocyte , form intracellular microcolonie in monocyte that be diagnostic for the hme .
diagnosis of hme can be confirm with pcr and serologic test .
the first - line treatment for adult and child of all age with hme be doxycycline .

the disease epidemic typhus be cause by rickettsia prowazekii and be transmit by body lice , pediculus humanu .
fly squirrel be animal reservoir of r . prowazekii in north america and can also be source of lice capable of transmit the pathogen .
epidemic typhus be characterize by a high fever and body ache that last for about two week .
a rash develop on the abdomen and chest and radiate to the extremity .
severe case can result in death from shock or damage to heart and brain tissue .
infect human be an important reservoir for this bacterium because r . prowazekii be the only rickettsia that can establish a chronic carrier state in human .
epidemic typhus have play an important role in human history , cause large outbreak with high mortality rate during time of war or adversity .
during world war i , epidemic typhus kill more than three million people on the eastern front . [ two  zero ] with the advent of effective insecticide and improve personal hygiene , epidemic typhus be now quite rare in the us .
in the develop world , however , epidemic can lead to mortality rate of up to four  zero % in the absence of treatment . [ two  one ]
in recent year , most outbreak have take place in burundi , ethiopia , and rwanda .
for example , an outbreak in burundi refugee camp in one  nine  nine  seven result in four  five  ,  zero  zero  zero illness in a population of about seven  six  zero  ,  zero  zero  zero people . [ two  two ]
a rapid diagnosis be difficult because of the similarity of the primary symptom with those of many other disease .
molecular and immunohistochemical diagnostic test be the most useful method for establish a diagnosis during the acute stage of illness when therapeutic decision be critical .
pcr to detect distinctive gene from r . prowazekii can be use to confirm the diagnosis of epidemic typhus , along with immunofluorescent staining of tissue biopsy specimen .
serology be usually use to identify rickettsial infection .
however , adequate antibody titer take up to one  zero day to develop .
antibiotic therapy be typically begin before the diagnosis be complete .
the most common drug use to treat patient with epidemic typhus be doxycycline or chloramphenicol .
murine ( endemic )
typhus murine typhus ( also know as endemic typhus ) be cause by rickettsia typhi and be transmit by the bite of the rat flea , xenopsylla cheopi , with infected rat as the main reservoir .
clinical sign and symptom of murine typhus include a rash and chill accompany by headache and fever that last about one  two day .
some patient also exhibit a cough and pneumonia - like symptom .
severe illness can develop in immunocompromised patient , with seizure , coma , and renal and respiratory failure .
clinical diagnosis of murine typhus can be confirm from a biopsy specimen from the rash .
diagnostic test include indirect immunofluorescent antibody ( ifa ) staining , pcr for r . typhi , and acute and convalescent serologic testing .
primary treatment be doxycycline , with chloramphenicol as the second choice .
rocky mountain spot fever
the disease rocky mountain spot fever ( rmsf ) be cause by rickettsia rickettsii and be transmit by the bite of a hard - bodied tick such as the american dog tick ( dermacentor variabilis ) , rocky mountain wood tick ( d . andersoni ) , or brown dog tick ( rhipicephalus sanguineus ) .
this disease be endemic in north and south america and - pron - incidence be coincident with the arthropod vector range .
despite - pron - name , most case in the us do not occur in the rocky mountain region but in the southeast  north carolina , oklahoma , arkansas , tennessee , and missouri account for great than six  zero % of all cases . [ two  three ]

in the us , rocky mountain spot fever be most prevalent in the southeastern state .
( credit  modification of work by centers for disease control and prevention ) sign and symptom of rmsf include a high fever , headache , body ache , nausea , and vomiting .
a petechial rash ( similar in appearance to measle ) begin on the hand and wrist , and spread to the trunk , face , and extremity ( figure two  five  .  one  three ) .
if untreated , rmsf be a serious illness that can be fatal in the first eight day even in otherwise healthy patient .
ideally , treatment should begin before petechiae develop , because this be a sign of progression to severe disease  however , the rash usually do not appear until day six or later after onset of symptom and only occur in three  five %– six  zero % of patient with the infection .
increase vascular permeability associate with petechiae formation can result in fatality rate of three % or great , even in the presence of clinical support .
most death be due to hypotension and cardiac arrest or from ischemia follow blood coagulation .
diagnosis can be challenge because the disease mimics several other disease that be more prevalent .
the diagnosis of rmsf be make base on symptom , fluorescent antibody stain of a biopsy specimen from the rash , pcr for rickettsia rickettsii , and acute and convalescent serologic testing .
primary treatment be doxycycline , with chloramphenicol as the second choice .

this openstax book be available for free at http / / cnx . org / content / col one  two  zero  eight  seven  /  one  .  five lyme disease lyme disease be cause by the spirochete borrelia burgdorferi that be transmit by the bite of a hard - bodied , blackleg ixodes tick .
i . scapularis be the biological vector transmit b . burgdorferi in the eastern and north - central us and i . pacificus transmit b . burgdorferi in the western us
( figure two  five  .  one  five ) .
different specie of ixode tick be responsible for b . burgdorferi transmission in asia and europe .
in the us , lyme disease be the most commonly report vectorborne illness .
in two  zero  one  four , - pron - be the fifth most common nationally notifiable disease . [ two  four ]
ixodes tick have complex life cycle and deer , mouse , and even bird can act as reservoir .
over two year , the tick pass through four developmental stage and require a blood meal from a host at each stage .
in the spring , tick egg hatch into six - legged larvae .
these larvae do not carry b . burgdorferi initially .
- pron - may acquire the spirochete when - pron - take - pron - first blood meal ( typically from a mouse ) .
the larvae then overwinter and molt into eight - legged nymph in the follow spring .
nymph take blood meal primarily from small rodent , but may also feed on human , burrow into the skin .
the feeding period can last several day to a week , and - pron - typically take two  four hour for an infected nymph to transmit enough b . burgdorferi to cause infection in a human host .
nymph ultimately mature into male and female adult tick , which tend to feed on large animal like deer or , occasionally , human .
the adult then mate and produce egg to continue the cycle ( figure two  five  .  one  four ) .

the symptom of lyme disease follow three stage  early localize , early disseminate , and late stage .
during the early - localize stage , approximately seven  zero %– eight  zero %[ two  five ] of case may be characterize by a bull ' s - eye rash , call erythema migran , at the site of the initial tick bite .
the rash form three to three  zero day after the tick bite ( seven day be the average ) and may also be warm to the touch ( figure two  five  .  one  five  ) . [ two  six ]
this diagnostic sign be often overlook if the tick bite occur on the scalp or another less visible location .
other early symptom include flu - like symptom such as malaise , headache , fever , and muscle stiffness .
if the patient go untreated , the second early - disseminate stage of the disease occur day to week later .
the symptom at this stage may include severe headache , neck stiffness , facial paralysis , arthritis , and carditis .
the late - stage manifestation of the disease may occur year after exposure .
chronic inflammation cause damage that can eventually cause severe arthritis , meningitis , encephalitis , and alter mental state .
the disease may be fatal if untreated .
a presumptive diagnosis of lyme disease can be make base solely on the presence of a bull's - eye rash at the site of infection , if - pron - be present , in addition to other associate symptom ( figure two  five  .  one  five ) .

relapsing fever borrelia spp .
also can cause relapse fever .
two of the most common specie be b . recurrentis , which cause epidemic of louseborne relapsing fever , and b . hermsii , which cause tickborne relapsing fever .
these borrelia specie be transmit by the body louse pediculus humanus and the soft - bodied tick ornithodoros hermsi , respectively .
lice acquire the spirochete from human reservoir , whereas tick acquire - pron - from rodent reservoir .
spirochete infect human when borrelia in the vector 's saliva or excreta enter the skin rapidly as the vector bite .
in both louse - and tickborne relapse fever , bacteremia usually occur after the initial exposure , lead to a sudden high fever ( three  nine – four  three ° c [ one  zero  two  .  two – one  zero  nine  .  four ° f ) typically accompany by headache and muscle ache .
after about three day , these symptom typically subside , only to return again after about a week .
after another three day , the symptom subside again but return a week later , and this cycle may repeat several time unless - pron - be disrupt by antibiotic treatment .
immune evasion through bacterial antigenic variation be responsible for the cyclical nature of the symptom in these disease .
the diagnosis of relapse fever can be make by observation of spirochete in blood , use darkfield microscopy ( figure two  five  .  one  six ) .
for louseborne relapsing fever , doxycycline or erythromycin be the first - line antibiotic .
for tickborne relapsing fever , tetracycline or erythromycin be the first - line antibiotic .

trench fever
the louseborne disease trench fever be first characterize as a specific disease during world war i , when approximately one million soldier be infect .
today , - pron - be primarily limit to area of the develop world where poor sanitation and hygiene lead to infestation of lice ( e . g . , overpopulate urban area and refugee camp ) .
trench fever be cause by the gram - negative bacterium bartonella quintana , which be transmit when fece from infected body lice , pediculus humanus var corporis , be rub into the louse bite , abraded skin , or the conjunctiva .
the symptom typically follow a five  - day course mark by a high fever , body ache , conjunctivitis , ocular pain , severe headache , and severe bone pain in the shin , neck , and back .
diagnosis can be make use blood culture  serological test like elisa can be use to detect antibody titer to the pathogen and pcr can also be use .
the first - line antibiotic be doxycycline , macrolide antibiotic , and ceftriaxone .

bacterial infections of the circulatory and lymphatic systems
although the circulatory system be a closed system , bacteria can enter the bloodstream through several route .
wound , animal bite , or other break in the skin and mucous membrane can result in the rapid dissemination of bacterial pathogen throughout the body .
localize infection may also spread to the bloodstream , cause serious and often fatal systemic infection .
figure two  five  .  one  eight and figure two  five  .  one  nine summarize the major characteristic of bacterial infection of the circulatory and lymphatic system .

 circulatory and lymphatic system infections one  one  three  nine systems learning objectives
 identify common viral pathogen that cause infection of the circulatory and lymphatic system  compare the major characteristic of specific viral disease affect the circulatory and lymphatic system viral pathogen of the circulatory system vary tremendously both in - pron - virulence and distribution worldwide .
some of these pathogen be practically global in - pron - distribution .
fortunately , the most ubiquitous virus tend to produce the mildest form of disease .
in the majority of case , those infect remain asymptomatic .
on the other hand , other virus be associate with life - threaten disease that have impact human history .
infectious mononucleosis and burkitt lymphoma
human herpesvirus four , also know as epstein - barr virus ( ebv ) , have be associate with a variety of human disease , such as mononucleosis and burkitt lymphoma .
exposure to the human herpesvirus four
( hhv -  four ) be widespread and nearly all people have be expose at some time in - pron - childhood , as evidence by serological test on population .
the virus primarily reside within b lymphocyte and , like all herpe virus , can remain dormant in a latent state for a long time .
when uninfected young adult be expose to ebv , - pron - may experience infectious mononucleosis .
the virus be mainly spread through contact with body fluid ( e . g . , saliva , blood , and seman ) .
the main symptom include pharyngitis , fever , fatigue , and lymph node swell .
abdominal pain may also occur as a result of spleen and liver enlargement in the second or third week of infection .
the disease typically be self - limit after about a month .
the main symptom , extreme fatigue , can continue for several month , however .
complication in immunocompetent patient be rare but can include jaundice , anemia , and possible rupture of the spleen cause by enlargement .
in patient with malaria or hiv , epstein - barr virus can lead to a fast - grow malignant cancer know as burkitt lymphoma
( figure two  five  .  two  zero ) .
this condition be a form of non - hodgkin lymphoma that produce solid tumor chiefly consist of aberrant b cell .
burkitt lymphoma be more common in africa , where prevalence of hiv and malaria be high , and - pron - more frequently afflict child .
repeat episode of viremia cause by reactivation of the virus be common in immunocompromised individual .
in some patient with aids , ebv may induce the formation of malignant b - cell lymphoma or oral hairy leukoplakia .
immunodeficiency - associate burkitt lymphoma primarily occur in patient with hiv .
hiv infection , similar to malaria , lead to polyclonal b - cell activation and permit poorly control proliferation of ebv+ b cell , lead to the formation of lymphoma .
infectious mononucleosis be typically diagnose base on the initial clinical symptom and a test for antibody to ebv - associate antigen .
because the disease be self - limit , antiviral treatment be rare for mononucleosis .
case of burkitt lymphoma be diagnose from a biopsy specimen from a lymph node or tissue from a suspect tumor .
stage of the cancer include compute tomography ( ct ) scan of the chest , abdoman , pelvi , and cytologic and histologic evaluation of biopsy specimen .
because the tumor grow so rapidly , staging study must be expedite and treatment must be initiate promptly .
an intensive alternate regiman of cyclophosphamide , vincristine , doxorubicin , methotrexate , ifosfamide , etoposide , and cytarabine ( codox - m / ivac ) plus rituximab result in a cure rate great than nine  zero % for child and adult .

cytomegalovirus infections also know as cytomegalovirus ( cmv ) , human herpesvirus five ( hhv -  five ) be a virus with high infection rate in the human population .
- pron - be currently estimate that five  zero % of people in the us have be infect by the time - pron - reach adulthood . [ two  seven ]
cmv be the major cause of non - epstein - barr infectious mononucleosis in the general human population .
- pron - be also an important pathogen in immunocompromised host , include patient with aids , neonate , and transplant recipient .
however , the vast majority of cmv infection be asymptomatic .
in adult , if symptom do occur , - pron - typically include fever , fatigue , swollen gland , and pharyngitis .
cmv can be transmit between individual through contact with body fluid such as saliva or urine .
common mode of transmission include sexual contact , nursing , blood transfusion , and organ transplant .
in addition , pregnant woman with active infection frequently pass this virus to - pron - fetus , result in congenital cmv infection , which occur in approximately one in every one  five  zero infant in us . [ two  eight ]
infant can also be infect during passage through the birth canal or through breast milk and saliva from the mother .
perinatal infection tend to be milder but can occasionally cause lung , spleen , or liver damage .
serious symptom in newborn include growth retardation , jaundice , deafness , blindness , and mental retardation if the virus cross the placenta during the embryonic state when the body system be develop in utero .
however , a majority ( approximately eight  zero % ) of infect infant will never have symptom or experience long - term problems . [ two  nine ] diagnosis of cmv infection during pregnancy be usually achieve by serology  cmv be the " c " in prenatal torch screening .
many patient receive blood transfusion and nearly all those receive kidney transplant ultimately become infected with cmv .
approximately six  zero % of transplant recipient will have cmv infection and more than two  zero % will develop symptomatic disease . [ three  zero ]
these infection may result from cmv - contaminate tissue but also may be a consequence of immunosuppression require for transplantation cause reactivation of prior cmv infection .
the result viremia can lead to fever and leukopenia , a decrease in the number of white blood cell in the bloodstream .

currently , yellow fever occur primarily in tropical and subtropical area in south america and africa .
- pron - be cause by the yellow fever virus of the genus flavivirus ( name for the latin word flavus mean yellow ) , which be transmit to human by mosquito vector .
sylvatic yellow fever occur in tropical jungle region of africa and central and south america , where the virus can be transmit from infect monkey to human by the mosquito aedes africanus or haemagogus spp .
in urban area , the aedes aegypti mosquito be mostly responsible for transmit the virus between human .
most individual infect with yellow fever virus have no illness or only mild disease .
onset of milder symptom be sudden , with dizziness , fever of three  nine – four  zero ° c ( one  zero  two – one  zero  four ° f ) , chill , headache , and myalgia .
as symptom worsen , the face become flushed , and nausea , vomiting , constipation , severe fatigue , restlessness , and irritability be common .
mild disease may resolve after one to three day .
however , approximately one  five % of case progress to develop moderate to severe yellow fever disease . [ three  three ]
in moderate or severe disease , the fever fall suddenly two to five day after onset , but recur several hour or day later .
symptom of jaundice , petechial rash , mucosal hemorrhage , oliguria ( scant urine ) , epigastric tenderness with bloody vomit , confusion , and apathy also often occur for approximately seven day of moderate to severe disease .
after more than a week , patient may have a rapid recovery and no sequelae .
in - pron - most severe form , call malignant yellow fever , symptom include delirium , bleeding , seizure , shock , coma , and multiple organ failure  in some case , death occur .
patient with malignant yellow fever also become severely immunocompromised , and even those in recovery may become susceptible to bacterial superinfection and pneumonia .
of the one  five % of patient who develop moderate or severe disease , up to half may die .
diagnosis of yellow fever be often base on clinical sign and symptom and , if applicable , the patient 's travel history , but infection can be confirm by culture , serologic test , and pcr .
there be no effective treatment for patient with yellow fever .
whenever possible , patient with yellow fever should be hospitalize for close observation and give supportive care .
prevention be the good method of control yellow fever .
use of mosquito netting , window screen , insect repellent , and insecticide be all effective method of reduce exposure to mosquito vector .
an effective vaccine be also available , but in the us , - pron - be only administer to those travel to area with endemic yellow fever .
in west africa , the world health organization ( who ) launch a yellow fever initiative in two  zero  zero  six and , since that time , significant progress have be make in combat yellow fever .
more than one  zero  five million people have be vaccinate , and no outbreak of yellow fever be report in west africa in two  zero  one  five .
yellow fever 
alter the course of history yellow
fever originate in africa and be still most prevalent there today .
this disease be think to have be translocate to the americas by the slave trade in the one  six th century . [ three  four ]
since that time , yellow fever have be associate with many severe outbreak , some of which have important impact upon historic event .
yellow fever virus be once an important cause of disease in the us .
in the summer of one  seven  nine  three , there be a serious outbreak in philadelphia ( then the us capitol ) .
- pron - be estimate that five  ,  zero  zero  zero people ( one  zero % of the city 's population ) die .
all of the government official , include george washington , flee the city in the face of this epidemic .
the disease only abate when autumn frost kill the mosquito vector population .
in one  eight  zero  two , napoleon bonaparte send an army of four  zero  ,  zero  zero  zero to hispaniola to suppress a slave revolution .
this be see by many as a part of a plan to use the louisiana territory as a granary as - pron - reestablish france as a global power .

abandon - pron - aspiration in the new world , napoleon sell the louisiana territory to the us for $ one  five million in one  eight  zero  three .

the most famous historic event associate with yellow fever be probably the construction of the panama canal .

dengue fever
the disease dengue fever , also know as breakbone fever , be cause by four serotype of dengue virus call dengue one – four .
these be flavivirus specie that be transmit to human by a . aegypti or a . albopictus mosquito .
the disease be distribute worldwide but be predominantly locate in tropical region .
the who estimate that five  zero million to one  zero  zero million infection occur yearly , include five  zero  zero  ,  zero  zero  zero dengue hemorrhagic fever ( dhf ) case and two  two  ,  zero  zero  zero death , most among children . [ three  five ] dengue fever be primarily a self - limit disease characterize by abrupt onset of high fever up to four  zero ° c ( one  zero  four ° f ) , intense headache , rash , slight nose or gum bleeding , and extreme muscle , joint , and bone pain , cause patient to feel as if - pron - bone be break , which be the reason this disease be also refer to as breakbone fever .
as the body temperature return to normal , in some patient , sign of dengue hemorrhagic fever may develop that include drowsiness , irritability , severe abdominal pain , severe nose or gum bleeding , persistent vomiting , vomit blood , and black tarry stool , as the disease progress to dhf or dengue shock syndrome ( dss ) .
patient who develop dhf experience circulatory system failure cause by increase blood vessel permeability .
patient with dengue fever can also develop dss from vascular collapse because of the severe drop in blood pressure .
patient who develop dhf or dss be at great risk for death without prompt appropriate supportive treatment .
about three  zero % of patient with severe hemorrhagic disease with poor supportive treatment die , but mortality can be less than one % with experienced support . [ three  six ] diagnostic test for dengue fever include serologic testing , elisa , and reverse transcriptase - polymerase chain reaction ( rt - pcr ) of blood .
there be no specific treatment for dengue fever , nor be there a vaccine .
instead , supportive clinical care be provide to treat the symptom of the disease .
the good way to limit the impact of this viral pathogen be vector control .
chikungunya fever
the arboviral disease chikungunya fever be cause by chikungunya virus ( chikv ) , which be transmit to human by a . aegypti and a . albopictus mosquito .
until two  zero  one  three , the disease have not be report outside of africa , asia , and a few european country  however , chikv have now spread to mosquito population in north and south america .
chikungunya fever be characterize by high fever , joint pain , rash , and blister , with joint pain persist for several month .
these infection be typically self - limit and rarely fatal .
the diagnostic approach for chikungunya fever be similar to that for dengue fever .
virus can be culture directly from patient serum during early infection .
ifa , eia , elisa , pcr , and rt - pcr be available to detect chikv antigen and patient antibody response to the infection .
there be no specific treatment for this disease except to manage symptom with fluid , analgesic , and bed rest .
as with most arbovirus , the good strategy for combat the disease be vector control .

ebola virus disease
the ebola virus disease ( evd ) be a highly contagious disease cause by specie of ebolavirus , a bsl -  four filovirus ( figure two  five  .  two  two ) .
transmission to human occur through direct contact with body fluid ( e . g . , blood , saliva , sweat , urine , fece , or vomit ) , and indirect contact by contaminated fomite .
infected patient can easily transmit ebola virus to other if appropriate containment and use of personal protective equipment be not available or use .
handle and work with patient with evd be extremely hazardous to the general population and health - care worker .
in almost every evd outbreak there have be ebola infection among health - care worker .
this ease of ebola virus transmission be recently demonstrate in the ebola epidemic in guinea , liberia , and sierra leone in two  zero  one  four , in which more than two  eight  ,  zero  zero  zero people in one  zero country be infect and more than one  one  ,  zero  zero  zero died . [ three  seven ]
after infection , the initial symptom of ebola be unremarkable  fever , severe headache , myalgia , cough , chest pain , and pharyngitis .
as the disease progress , patient experience abdominal pain , diarrhea , and vomiting .
hemorrhaging begin after about three day , with bleed occur in the gastrointestinal tract , skin , and many other site .
this often lead to delirium , stupor , and coma , accompany by shock , multiple organ failure , and death .
the mortality rate of evd often range from five  zero % to nine  zero % .
the initial diagnosis of ebola be difficult because the early symptom be so similar to those of many other illness .
- pron - be possible to directly detect the virus from patient sample within a few day after symptom begin , use antigen - capture elisa , immunoglobulin m ( igm ) elisa , pcr , and virus isolation .
there be currently no effective , approved treatment for ebola other than supportive care and proper isolation technique to contain - pron - spread .
