- pron - successfully prepare a rabie vaccine use dry nerve tissue from infected animal .
this vaccine be use to first treat an infect human in one  eight  eight  five .
the most common reservoir in the united states be wild animal such as raccoon ( three  zero  .  two % of all animal case during two  zero  one  four ) , bat ( two  nine  .  one % ) , skunk ( two  six  .  three % ) , and fox ( four  .  one % )  collectively , these animal be responsible for a total of nine  two  .  six % of animal rabie case in the united states in two  zero  one  four .
the remain seven  .  four % of case that year be in domesticated animal such as dog , cat , horse , mule , sheep , goat , and llamas . [ two  seven ]
while there be typically only one or two human case per year in the united states , rabie still cause ten of thousand of human death per year worldwide , primarily in asia and africa .
the low incidence of rabie in the united states be primarily a result of the widespread vaccination of dog and cat .
an oral vaccine be also use to protect wild animal , such as raccoon and fox , from infection .
oral vaccine program tend to focus on geographic area where rabie be endemic . [ two  eight ]
the oral vaccine be usually deliver in a package of bait that be drop by airplane , although bait in urban area be do by hand to maximize safety . [ two  nine ]
many country require a quarantine or proof of rabie vaccination for domestic pet be bring into the country .
these procedure be especially strict in island nation where rabie be not yet present , such as australia .
the incubation period for rabie can be lengthy , range from several week or month to over a year .
as the virus replicate , - pron - move from the site of the bite into motor and sensory axon of peripheral nerve and spread from nerve to nerve use a process call retrograde transport , eventually make - pron - way to the cns through the spinal ganglia .
once rabie virus reach the brain , the infection lead to encephalitis cause by the disruption of normal neurotransmitter function , result in the symptom associate with rabie .
the virion act in the synaptic space as competitor with a variety of neurotransmitter for acetylcholine , gaba , and glycine receptor .
thus , the action of rabie virus be neurotoxic rather than cytotoxic .
after the rabie virus infect the brain , - pron - can continue to spread through other neuronal pathway , travel out of the cns to tissue such as the salivary gland , where the virus can be release .
as a result , as the disease progress the virus can be find in many other tissue , include the salivary gland , taste bud , nasal cavity , and tear .
the early symptom of rabie include discomfort at the site of the bite , fever , and headache .
once the virus reach the brain and later symptom appear , the disease be always fatal .
terminal rabie case can end in one of two way  either furious or paralytic rabie .
individual with furious rabie become very agitated and hyperactive .
hydrophobia ( a fear of water ) be common in patient with furious rabie , which be cause by muscular spasm in the throat when swallow or think about water .
excess salivation and a desire to bite can lead to foam of the mouth .
these behavior serve to enhance the likelihood of viral transmission , although contact with infected secretion like saliva or tear alone be sufficient for infection .
the disease culminate after just a few day with terror and confusion , follow by cardiovascular and respiratory arrest .
in contrast , individual with paralytic rabie generally follow a long course of disease .
the muscle at the site of infection become paralyzed .
over a period of time , the paralysis slowly spread throughout the body .
this paralytic form of disease culminate in coma and death .
before present - day diagnostic method be available , rabie diagnosis be make use a clinical case history and histopathological examination of biopsy or autopsy tissue , look for the presence of negri body .
- pron - now know these histologic change can not be use to confirm a rabie diagnosis .
there be no test that can detect rabie virus in human at the time of the bite or shortly thereafter .
once the virus have begin to replicate ( but before clinical symptom occur ) , the virus can be detect use an immunofluorescence test on cutaneous nerve find at the base of hair follicle .
saliva can also be test for viral genetic material by reverse transcription follow by polymerase chain reaction ( rt - pcr ) .
even when these test be perform , most suspect infection be treat as positive in the two  seven .

patient may also be treat with human rabie immune globulin ( antibody to the rabie virus ) to encourage passive immunity .
these antibody will neutralize any free viral particle .
although the rabie infection progress slowly in peripheral tissue , patient be not normally able to mount a protective immune response on - pron - own .

poliomyelitis poliomyelitis ( polio ) , cause by poliovirus , be a primarily intestinal disease that , in a small percentage of case , proceed to the nervous system , cause paralysis and , potentially , death .
poliovirus be highly contagious , with transmission occur by the fecal - oral route or by aerosol or droplet transmission .
approximately seven  two % of all poliovirus infection be asymptomatic  another two  five % result only in mild intestinal disease , produce nausea , fever , and headache . [ three  zero ]
however , even in the absence of symptom , patient infect with the virus can shed - pron - in fece and oral secretion , potentially transmit the virus to other .
in about one case in every two  zero  zero , the poliovirus affect cell in the cns . [ three  one ] three  zero .

after - pron - enter through the mouth , initial replication of poliovirus occur at the site of implantation in the pharynx and gastrointestinal tract .
as the infection progress , poliovirus be usually present in the throat and in the stool before the onset of symptom .
one week after the onset of symptom , there be less poliovirus in the throat , but for several week , poliovirus continue to be excrete in the stool .
poliovirus invade local lymphoid tissue , enter the bloodstream , and then may infect cell of the cns .
replication of poliovirus in motor neuron of the anterior horn cell in the spinal cord , brain stem , or motor cortex result in cell destruction and lead to flaccid paralysis .
in severe case , this can involve the respiratory system , lead to death .
patient with impair respiratory function be treat use positivepressure ventilation system .
in the past , patient be sometimes confine to emerson respirator , also know as iron lung ( figure two  six  .  one  six ) .
direct detection of the poliovirus from the throat or fece can be achieve use reverse transcriptase pcr ( rt - pcr ) or genomic sequencing to identify the genotype of the poliovirus infect the patient .
serological test can be use to determine whether the patient have be previously vaccinate .
there be no therapeutic measure for polio  treatment be limit to various supportive measure .
these include pain reliever , rest , heat therapy to ease muscle spasm , physical therapy and corrective brace if necessary to help with walking , and mechanical ventilation to assist with breathe if necessary .

two different vaccine be introduce in the one  nine  five  zero that have lead to the dramatic decrease in polio worldwide ( figure two  six  .  one  seven ) .
the salk vaccine be an inactivated polio virus that be first introduce in one  nine  five  five .
this vaccine be deliver by intramuscular injection .
the sabin vaccine be an oral polio vaccine that contain an attenuated virus  - pron - be license for use in one  nine  six  two .
there be three serotype of poliovirus that cause disease in human  both the salk and the sabin vaccine be effective against all three .
attenuated virus from the sabin vaccine be shed in the fece of immunized individual and thus have the potential to infect nonimmunized individual .
by the late one  nine  nine  zero , the few polio case originate in the united states could be trace back to the sabin vaccine .
in these case , mutation of the attenuated virus follow vaccination likely allow the microbe to revert to a virulent form .
for this reason , the united states switch exclusively to the salk vaccine in two  zero  zero  zero .
because the salk vaccine contain an inactivated virus , there be no risk of transmission to other ( see vaccines ) .
currently four dos of the vaccine be recommend for child  at two , four , and six – one  eight month of age , and at four – six year of age .
in one  nine  eight  eight , who launch the global polio eradication initiative with the goal of eradicate polio worldwide through immunization .
that goal be now close to be realize .
polio be now endemic in only a few country , include afghanistan , pakistan , and nigeria , where vaccination effort have be disrupt by military conflict or political instability .

the terror of polio
in the year afterworldwar ii , the united states and the soviet union enter a period know as the coldwar .
although there be no armed conflict , the two super power be diplomatically and economically isolate from each other , as represent by the so - call iron curtain between the soviet union and the rest of the world .
after one  nine  five  zero , migration or travel outside of the soviet union be exceedingly difficult , and - pron - be equally difficult for foreigner to enter the soviet union .
the united states also place strict limit on soviets enter the country .
during the eisenhower administration , only two  zero graduate student from the soviet union be allow to come to study in the united states per year .
yet even the iron curtain be no match for polio .
the salk vaccine become widely available in the west in one  nine  five  five , and by the time the sabin vaccine be ready for clinical trial , most of the susceptible population in the united states and canada have already be vaccinate against polio .
sabin need to look elsewhere for study participant .
at the height of the cold war , mikhail chumakov be allow to come to the united states to study sabin 's work .
likewise , sabin , an american microbiologist , be allow to travel to the soviet union to begin clinical trial .
chumakov organize soviet - base production and manage the experimental trial to test the new vaccine in the soviet union .
by one  nine  five  nine , over ten million soviet child have be safely treat with sabin 's vaccine .
as a result of a global vaccination campaign with the sabin vaccine , the overall incidence of polio have drop dramatically .
today , polio have be nearly eliminate around the world and be only rarely see in the united states .
perhaps one day soon , polio will become the third microbial disease to be eradicate from the general population [ small pox and rinderpest ( the cause of cattle plague ) be the first two] .  how be poliovirus transmit ?

transmissible spongiform encephalopathies acellular infectious agent call prion be responsible for a group of related disease know as transmissible spongiform encephalopathy ( tse ) that occur in human and other animal ( see viroids , virusoid , and prions ) .
all tse be degenerative , fatal neurological disease that occur when brain tissue become infect by prion .
these disease have a slow onset  symptom may not become apparent until after an incubation period of year and perhaps decade , but death usually occur within month to a few year after the first symptom appear .
tse in animal include scrapie , a disease in sheep that have be know since the one  seven  zero  zero , and chronic waste disease , a disease of deer and elk in the united states and canada .
mad cow disease be see in cattle and can be transmit to human through the consumption of infect nerve tissue .
human prion disease include creutzfeldt -
jakob disease and kuru , a rare disease endemic to papua new guinea .
prion be infectious proteinaceous particle that be not virus and do not contain nucleic acid .
- pron - be typically transmit by exposure to and ingestion of infect nervous system tissue , tissue transplant , blood transfusion , or contaminate fomite .
prion protein be normally find in a healthy brain tissue in a form call prpc .
however , if this protein be misfolde into a denature form ( prpsc ) , - pron - can cause disease .
although the exact function of prpc be not currently understand , the protein fold into mostly alpha helix and bind copper .
the rogue protein , on the other hand , fold predominantly into beta - pleat sheet and be resistant to proteolysis .
in addition , prpsc can induce prpc to become misfolde and produce more rogue protein ( figure two  six  .  one  eight ) .
as prpsc accumulate , - pron - aggregate and form fibril within nerve cell .
these protein complex ultimately cause the cell to die .
as a consequence , brain tissue of infect individual form mass of neurofibrillary tangle and amyloid plaque that give the brain a spongy appearance , which be why these disease be call spongiform encephalopathy ( figure six  .  two  six ) .
damage to brain tissue result in a variety of neurological symptom .
most commonly , affected individual suffer from memory loss , personality change , blur vision , uncoordinated movement , and insomnia .
these symptom gradually worsen over time and culminate in coma and death .
the gold standard for diagnose tse be the histological examination of brain biopsy for the presence of characteristic amyloid plaque , vacuole , and prion protein .
great care must be take by clinician when handle suspect prion - infect material to avoid become infect - pron - .
other tissue assay search for the presence of the one  four - three - three protein , a marker for prion disease like creutzfeldt - jakob disease .
new assay , like rt - quic ( realtime quaking - induce conversion ) , offer new hope to effectively detect the abnormal prion protein in tissue earlier in the course of infection .
prion disease can not be cure .
however , some medication may help slow - pron - progress .
medical support be focus on keep patient as comfortable as possible despite progressive and debilitate symptom .

since few drug be available to combat these infection , vector control and vaccination be critical for prevention and containment .

learning objectives
 identify the most common fungi that can cause infection of the nervous system  compare the major characteristic of specific fungal disease affect the nervous system fungal infection of the nervous system , call neuromycose , be rare in healthy individual .
however , neuromycose can be devastating in immunocompromised or elderly patient .
several eukaryotic parasite be also capable of infect the nervous system of human host .
although relatively uncommon , these infection can also be life - threaten in immunocompromised individual .
in this section , - pron - will first discuss neuromycose , follow by parasitic infection of the nervous system .
cryptococcocal meningitis cryptococcus neoforman be a fungal pathogen that can cause meningitis .
this yeast be commonly find in soil and be particularly associate with pigeon dropping .
- pron - have a thick capsule that serve as an important virulence factor , inhibit clearance by phagocytosis .
most c . neoforman case result in subclinical respiratory infection that , in healthy individual , generally resolve spontaneously with no long - term consequence ( see respiratory mycoses ) .
in immunocompromised patient or those with other underlie illness , the infection can progress to cause meningitis and granuloma formation in brain tissue .
cryptococcus antigen can also serve to inhibit cellmediated immunity and delay - type hypersensitivity .
cryptococcus can be easily culture in the laboratory and identify base on - pron - extensive capsule ( figure two  six  .  two  zero ) .
c . neoforman be frequently culture from urine sample of patient with disseminated infection .
prolonged treatment with antifungal drug be require to treat cryptococcal infection .
combined therapy be require with amphotericin b plus flucytosine for at least one  zero week .
many antifungal drug have difficulty cross the bloodbrain barrier and have strong side effect that necessitate low dos  these factor contribute to the lengthy time of treatment .
patient with aids be particularly susceptible to cryptococcus infection because of - pron - compromise immune state .
aids patient with cryptococcosis can also be treat with antifungal drug , but - pron - often have relapse  lifelong dos of fluconazole may be necessary to prevent reinfection .

amoebic meningitis primary amoebic meningoencephalitis ( pam ) be cause by naegleria fowleri .
this amoeboflagellate be commonly find free - living in soil and water .
- pron - can exist in one of three form -
the infective amoebic trophozoite form , a motile flagellate form , and a rest cyst form .
pam be a rare disease that have be associate with young and otherwise healthy individual .
individual be typically infect by the amoeba while swim in warm body of freshwater such as river , lake , and hot spring .
the pathogenic trophozoite infect the brain by initially enter through nasal passage to the sinus  - pron - then move down olfactory nerve fiber to penetrate the submucosal nervous plexus , invade the cribriform plate , and reach the subarachnoid space .
the subarachnoid space be highly vascularized and be a route of dissemination of trophozoite to other area of the cns , include the brain ( figure two  six  .  two  two ) .
inflammation and destruction of gray matter lead to severe headache and fever .
within day , confusion and convulsion occur and quickly progress to seizure , coma , and death .
the progression can be very rapid , and the disease be often not diagnose until autopsy .
n . fowleri infection can be confirm by direct observation of csf  the amoebae can often be see move while view a fresh csf wet mount through a microscope .
flagellated form can occasionally also be find in csf .
the amoebae can be stain with several stain for identification , include giemsa - wright or a modified trichrome stain .
detection of antigen with indirect immunofluorescence , or genetic analysis with pcr , can be use to confirm an initial diagnosis .
n . fowleri infection be nearly always fatal  only three of one  three  eight patient with pam in the united states have survived . [ three  two ]
a new experimental drug call miltefosine show some promise for treat these infection .
this drug be a phosphotidylcholine derivative that be think to inhibit membrane function in n . fowleri , trigger apoptosis and disturbance of lipid - dependent cell signal pathways . [ three  three ]
when administer early in infection and couple with therapeutic hypothermia ( lower the body 's core temperature to reduce the cerebral edema associate with infection ) , this drug have be successfully use to treat primary amoebic encephalitis .

granulomatous amoebic encephalitis acanthamoeba and balamuthia specie be free - living amoebae find in many body of fresh water .
human infection by these amoebae be rare .
however , - pron - can cause amoebic keratitis in contact lens wearer ( see protozoan and helminthic infections of the eyes ) , disseminated infection in immunocompromised patient , and granulomatous amoebic encephalitis ( gae ) in severe case .
compare to pam , gae tend to be subacute infection .
the microbe be think to enter through either the nasal sinuse or break in the skin .
- pron - be disseminate hematogenously and can invade the cns .
there , the infection lead to inflammation , formation of lesion , and development of typical neurological symptom of encephalitis ( figure two  six  .  two  three ) .
gae be nearly always fatal .
gae be often not diagnose until late in the infection .
lesion cause by the infection can be detect use ct or mri .
the live amoebae can be directly detect in csf or tissue biopsy .
serological test be available but generally be not necessary to make a correct diagnosis , since the presence of the organism in csf be definitive .
some antifungal drug , like fluconazole , have be use to treat acanthamoebal infection .
in addition , a combination of miltefosine and voriconazole ( an inhibitor of ergosterol biosynthesis ) have recently be use to successfully treat gae .
even with treatment , however , the mortality rate for patient with these infection be high .

human african trypanosomiasis human african trypanosomiasis ( also know as african sleep sickness ) be a serious disease endemic to two distinct region in sub - saharan africa .
- pron - be cause by the insect - borne hemoflagellate trypanosoma brucei .
the subspecie trypanosoma brucei rhodesiense cause east african trypanosomiasis ( eat ) , and another subspecie , trypanosoma brucei gambiense cause west african trypanosomiasis ( wat ) .
a few hundred case of eat be currently report each year . [ three  four ]
wat be more commonly report and tend to be a more chronic disease .
around seven  zero  zero  zero to one  zero  ,  zero  zero  zero new case of wat be identify each year . [ three  five ]
t . brucei be primarily transmit to human by the bite of the tsetse fly ( glossina spp . ) .
soon after the bite of a tsetse fly , a chancre form at the site of infection .
the flagellate then spread , move into the circulatory system ( figure two  six  .  two  four ) .
these systemic infection result in an undulating fever , during which symptom persist for two or three day with remission of about a week between bout .
as the disease enter - pron - final phase , the pathogen move from the lymphatic into the cns .
neurological symptom include daytime sleepiness , insomnia , and mental deterioration .
in eat , the disease run - pron - course over a span of week to month .
in contrast , wat often occur over a span of month to year .
although a strong immune response be mount against the trypanosome , - pron - be not sufficient to eliminate the pathogen .
through antigenic variation , trypanosoma can change - pron - surface protein into over one  zero  zero serological type .
this variation lead to the undulating form of the initial disease .
the initial septicemia cause by the infection lead to high fever .
as the immune system respond to the infection , the number of organism decrease , and the clinical symptom abate .
however , a subpopulation of the pathogen then alter - pron - surface coat antigen by antigenic variation and evade the immune response .
these flagellate rapidly proliferate and cause another bout of disease .
if untreated , these infection be usually fatal .
clinical symptom can be use to recognize the early sign of african trypanosomiasis .
these include the formation of a chancre at the site of infection andwinterbottom 's sign .
winterbottom 's sign refer to the enlargement of lymph node on the back of the neck - often indicative of cerebral infection .
trypanosoma can be directly observe in stain sample include blood , lymph , csf , and skin biopsy of chancre from patient .
antibody against the parasite be find in most patient with acute or chronic disease .
serologic testing be generally not use for diagnosis , however , since the microscopic detection of the parasite be sufficient .
early diagnosis be important for treatment .
before the nervous system be involve , drug like pentamidine ( an inhibitor of nuclear metabolism ) and suramin ( mechanism unclear ) can be use .
these drug have few side effect than the drug need to treat the second stage of the disease .
once the sleep sickness phase have begin , harsh drug include melarsoprol ( an arsenic derivative ) and eflornithine can be effective .
follow successful treatment , patient still need to have follow - up examination of - pron - csf for two year to detect possible relapse of the disease .
the most effective mean of prevent these disease be to control the insect vector population .

neurotoxoplasmosis toxoplasma gondii be an ubiquitous intracellular parasite that can cause neonatal infection .
cat be the definitive host , and human can become infected after eat infect meat or , more commonly , by ingest oocyst shed in the fece of cat ( see parasitic infections of the circulatory and lymphatic systems ) .
t . gondii enter the circulatory system by pass between the endothelial cell of blood vessels . [ three  six ] most case of toxoplasmosis be asymptomatic .
however , in immunocompromised patient , neurotoxoplasmosis cause by t . gondii infection be one of the most common cause of brain abscesses . [ three  seven ]
the organism be able to cross the blood - brain barrier by infect the endothelial cell of capillary in the brain .
the parasite reproduce within these cell , a step that appear to be necessary for entry to the brain , and then cause the endothelial cell to lyse , release the progeny into brain tissue .
this mechanism be quite different than the method - pron - use to enter the bloodstream in the first place . [ three  eight ]
the brain lesion associate with neurotoxoplasmosis can be detect radiographically use mri or cat scan ( figure two  six  .  two  five ) .
diagnosis can be confirm by direct observation of the organism in csf .
rt - pcr assay can also be use to detect t . gondii through genetic marker .
treatment of neurotoxoplasmosis cause by t . gondii infection require six week of multi - drug therapy with pyrimethamine , sulfadiazine , and folinic acid .
long - term maintenance dos be often require to prevent recurrence .

how do toxoplasma circumvent the blood - brain barrier ?
neurocysticercosis cysticercosis be a parasitic infection cause by the larval form of the pork tapeworm , taenia solium .
when the larvae invade the brain and spinal cord , the condition be refer to as neurocysticercosis .
this condition affect million of people worldwide and be the lead cause of adult onset epilepsy in the develop world . [ three  nine ]
the life cycle of t . solium be discuss in helminthic infections of the gastrointestinal tract .
follow ingestion , the egg hatch in the intestine to form larvae call cysticercus .
adult tapeworm form in the small intestine and produce egg that be shed in the fece .
these egg can infect other individual through fecal contamination of food or other surface .
eggs can also hatch within the intestine of the original patient and lead to an ongoing autoinfection .
the cystercerci , can migrate to the blood and invade many tissue in the body , include the cns .
neurocysticercosis be usually diagnose through noninvasive technique .
epidemiological information can be use as an initial screen  cysticercosis be endemic in central and south america , africa , and asia .
radiological image ( mri and ct scan ) be the primary method use to diagnose neurocysticercosis  imaging can be use to detect the one - to two - centimeter cyst that form around the parasite ( figure two  six  .  two  six ) .
elevated level of eosinophil in the blood can also indicate a parasitic infection .
eia and elisa be also use to detect antigen associate with the pathogen .

the treatment for neurocysticercosis depend on the location , number , size , and stage of cysticercus present .
antihelminthic chemotherapy include albendazole and praziquantel .
because these drug kill viable cyst , - pron - may acutely increase symptom by provoke an inflammatory response cause by the release of taenia cysticerci antigen , as the cyst be destroy by the drug .
to alleviate this response , corticosteroid that cross the blood - brain barrier ( e . g . , dexamethasone ) can be use to mitigate these effect .
surgical intervention may be require to remove intraventricular cyst .
parasitic diseases of the nervous system parasites that successfully invade the nervous system can cause a wide range of neurological sign and symptom .
often , - pron - inflict lesion that can be visualize through radiologic imaging .
a number of these infection be fatal , but some can be treat ( with vary level of success ) by antimicrobial drug ( figure two  six  .  two  seven ) .

summary two  six  .  one anatomy of the nervous system

the nervous system consist of two subsystem  the central nervous system and peripheral nervous system .

the skull and three meninge ( the dura mater , arachnoid mater , and pia mater ) protect the brain .

tissues of the pns and cns be form of cell call glial cell and neuron .

since the blood - brain barrier exclude most microbe , there be no normal microbiota in the cns .

some pathogen have specific virulence factor that allow - pron - to breach the blood - brain barrier .
inflammation of the brain or meninge cause by infection be call encephalitis or meningitis , respectively .

two  six  .  two bacterial diseases of the nervous system

bacterial meningitis can be cause by several specie of encapsulate bacteria , include haemophilus influenzae , neisseria meningitidis , streptococcus pneumoniae , and streptococcus agalactiae
( group b streptococci ) .
h . influenzae affect primarily young child and neonate , n . meningitidis be the only communicable pathogen and mostly affect child and young adult , s . pneumoniae affect mostly young child , and s . agalactiae affect newborn during or shortly after birth .
 symptom of bacterial meningitis include fever , neck stiffness , headache , confusion , convulsion , coma , and death .

diagnosis of bacterial meningitis be make through observation and culture of organism in csf .
bacterial meningitis be treat with antibiotic .
h . influenzae and n . meningitidis have vaccine available .

clostridium specie cause neurological disease , include botulism and tetanus , by produce potent neurotoxin that interfere with neurotransmitter release .
the pns be typically affect .
treatment of clostridium infection be effective only through early diagnosis with administration of antibiotic to control the infection and antitoxin to neutralize the endotoxin before - pron - enter cell .

listeria monocytogene be a foodborne pathogen that can infect the cns , cause meningitis .
the infection can be spread through the placenta to a fetus .
diagnosis be through culture of blood or csf .
treatment be with antibiotic and there be no vaccine .

hansen 's disease ( leprosy ) be cause by the intracellular parasite mycobacterium leprae .
infection cause demylenation of neuron , result in decreased sensation in peripheral appendage and body site .
treatment be with multi - drug antibiotic therapy , and there be no universally recognize vaccine .
two  six  .  three acellular diseases of the nervous system 
viral meningitis be more common and generally less severe than bacterial menigitis .
- pron - can result from secondary sequelae of many virus or be cause by infection of arbovirus .
 various type of arboviral encephalitis be concentrate in particular geographic location throughout the world .
these mosquito - bear viral infection of the nervous system be typically mild , but - pron - can be lifethreatene in some case .

zika virus be an emerge arboviral infection with generally mild symptom in most individual , but infection of pregnant woman can cause the birth defect microcephaly .

polio be typically a mild intestinal infection but can be damaging or fatal if - pron - progress to a neurological disease .

rabies be nearly always fatal when untreated and remain a significant problem worldwide .

transmissible spongiform encephalopathy such as creutzfeldt - jakob disease and kuru be cause by prion .
these disease be untreatable and ultimately fatal .
similar prion disease be find in animal .
two  six  .  four fungal and parasitic diseases of the nervous system

neuromycoses be uncommon in immunocompetent people , but immunocompromise individual with fungal infection have high mortality rate .
treatment of neuromycose require prolonged therapy with antifungal drug at low dos to avoid side effect and overcome the effect of the blood - brain barrier .

some protist infection of the nervous system be fatal if not treat , include primary amoebic meningitis , granulomatous amoebic encephalitis , human african trypanosomiasis , and neurotoxoplasmosis .

the various form of ameobic encephalitis cause by the different amoebic infection be typically fatal even with treatment , but - pron - be rare .

african trypanosomiasis be a serious but treatable disease endemic to two distinct region in sub - saharan africa cause by the insect - borne hemoflagellate trypanosoma brucei .

neurocysticercosis be treat use antihelminthic drug or surgery to remove the large cyst from the cns .
